texts.en: Lolonyo is a young woman of 29 whose business is re-selling jewelry.  She is the mother of a 3-year-old child who does not attend school.  Lolonyo set up her business six years ago and has a stall at the market.  She is requesting her second loan from WAGES to buy additional jewelry to strengthen her business.  She would like to open her own private store and ensure food security for her family.

loans.use: to buy jewelry

loans.name: Roza

texts.ru: Розе 45 лет, замужем, воспитывает  4 детей. В качестве основного источника дохода для своей семьи, Роза с 1990 года занимается животноводством, начав этот бизнес с суммы в 15,000 сом (KGS). На сегодняшний день в хозяйстве Розы имеется 2 коровы, 1 телок,15 овец, 8 коз и 2 лошади. Перепродажа скота и разведение скота приносит 15,000 сом (KGS) в месяц. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Роза обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 75,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 3 бычков. Доходы от кредита Роза планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение хозяйства за счет покупку скота. В планах у розы женить старшего сына.
texts.en:
Roza is 45 years old, married, and has four children.  Her family's main source of income has been Roza's animal husbandry business, which she began in 1990 with 15,000 som (KGS).  Today, she has two cows, one calf, 15 sheep, eight goats, and two horses.  Raising and selling cattle bring in 15,000 som (KGS) per month.  

With an aim to further developing her business, Roza applied to Bai Tushum & Partners for a loan of 75,000 som (KGS) to buy three bulls.  Roza plans to invest the profits from the loan in the further expansion of her business by buying more cattle.  Among Roza's plans is to marry off her eldest son.

loans.use: to purchase 3 bulls

loans.name: Tosheka Group

texts.fr: La cliente Mwavita  est présidente du groupe Tosheka. Mariée à un homme d’affaire. Elle est âgée de 41 ans et mère de 9 enfants, tous  scolarisés. La cliente est vendeuse de farines et autres denrées alimentaires. Ce nouveau crédit va lui servir de s’approvisionner avec 3 sacs de farines de 50kgs à marchander .  Elle souhaite voir son entreprise grandir et  scolariser correctement ses enfants. Ainsi, elle  remercie Hekima et ses partenaires pour ses actions en faveur de pauvres femmes.
texts.en: Mwavita is the president of the Tosheka group. Married to a businessman, she is 41 years old and the mother of nine children, all in school. She sells flour and other food products. The loan she is requesting will allow her to purchase three 50 kg sacks of flour to resell. She hopes to see her business grow in the future and to make sure her children get proper schooling. She thanks Hekima and partners for their actions to help poor women.

loans.use: to purchase three 50kg sacks of flour.

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Serge Paulin

texts.fr: Serge est un jeune camerounais de 32 ans, célibataire, sans enfant. Il mène une activité de production et vente des beignets dans coin de la ville depuis 1 an déjà. il voudrait accroître ses ventes pour satisfaire les demandes de sa clientèle et constituer de ce fait un portefeuille clientèle considérable. Il voudrait avec ce crédit acheter 03 pousse-pousse, 3 glacières et 3 casse à beignets pour pouvoir écouler sa production qu'il compte tripler. les bénéfices supplémentaires lui permettront de mieux subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en:
Serge is a young man from Cameroun; 32 years old, single, without children. He started a business making and selling doughnuts in a corner of town a year ago. He would like to grow his sales to meet his customers' demand, thus building a large customer base. With the proceeds of this loan, he would like to purchase three trolleys, three ice boxes and three doughnut fryers in order to handle his production, which he hopes to multiply by three.
The extra profits will allow him to more easily cover the family's needs.

loans.use: to purchase equipment

loans.name: Ryskul

texts.ru: Рыскул 50 лет, замужем, имеет 4 детей. В качестве источника дохода для семьи, Рыскул занимается животноводством.  Начатое в 1984 году с 10,000 сом (KGS)  хозяйство  на сегодня приносит около 5,000 сом (KGS) в месяц от продажи молока и молочных продуктов. Благодаря упорному труду Рыскул, ее поголовье насчитывает 8 коров, 5 коз, 2 лошади и 10 овец. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Рыскул обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота. Доходы Рыскул планирует вложить в реконструкцию дома, а в дальнейшем - в увеличение поголовья скота.
texts.en:
Ryskul is 50 years old, married, and has four children.  Ryskul is in the business of raising livestock, which is her family's main source of income.  She started her business in 1984 with 10,000 som (KGS) and today it brings in about 5,000 som (KGS) per month from the sale of milk and dairy products.  As a result of Ryskul's hard work, she now has eight cows, five goats, two horses, and ten sheep.

With an aim to further developing her business, Ryskul has applied to Bai Tushum & Partners for a loan of 100,000 som (KGS) to buy livestock.  Ryskul plans to invest the profits in rebuilding her home, and, later, in increasing the size of her herd.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Aminata

texts.fr: Madame Aminata, mariée et mère de 3 enfants, fait de la vente de tissus et divers autres produits. Elle a une expérience de 20 ans dans ce domaine. Elle commence sa journée à 7h et la fini à 13h. Avec le crédit reçu, elle veut acheter des tissus, du savon, du karité. Elle pourra élargir le nombre de ses employés car  il y a ses enfants qui lui placent dès fois la marchandise. Madame Aminata aide son mari dans les charges familiales. Avec le fond nécessaire, elle rêve de devenir une grande commerçante.
texts.en: Madame Aminata is married and mother to 3 children. She is a trader of fabric and various other products. She has 20 years experience in this field. She starts her day at 7am and finishes at 1pm. She will use this loan to buy fabric, soap and shea butter. She will be able to increase the number of her employees because her children have been, at times, selling the goods. Madame Aminata helps her husband with the family expenses. With sufficient funding, she dreams of one day becoming a great trader.

loans.use: to buy fabric, soap and shea butter for resale

loans.name: Saodat

texts.ru: Саодат проживает в районе Спитамен. Ей 45 лет. Она замужем. У нее двое детей. Ее муж работает шафером. Сама Саодат зарабатывает путем разведения мелко - рогатого скота. Этим видом деятельности она занимается у себя дома. Саодат берет кредит для закупа мелко - рогатого скота, чтобы увеличить поголовья скота. Она имеет богатый опыт в этой области.
texts.en:
Saodat lives in the Spitamen region.  She is 45 years old, married, and has two children.  Her husband works as a driver.  Saodat, however, earns money by raising sheep.  Hers is a home-based business.  

Saodat is taking out this loan to buy sheep to increase the size of her herd.  She has a great deal of experience in this field.

loans.use: to buy sheep

loans.name: Abdusalom

texts.ru: Абдусалом житель Спитаменского района. Ему 53 года. Он женат. У него двое детей. Жена Абдусалома занимается торговлей обуви на рынке. Его дети маленькие. Абдусалом занимается животноводством. У него дома имеются условия для разведения крупнорогатого скота. Абдусалом пятнадцать лет как занимается купле - продажей крупнорогатого скота. Он бреет кредит для закупа дойной коровы.
texts.en: Abdusalom is a resident of the Spitamen region.  He is 53 years old, married, and has two children.  They are still small.  Abdusalom's wife sells shoes at the market.  Abdusalom raises cattle for resale.  His home has facilities for raising large cattle and he has been in this business for 15 years.  He is taking out this loan to buy a milk cow.

loans.use: to buy a milk cow

loans.name: Baktygul

texts.ru: Бактыгул 47 лет, замужем. Бактыгул имеет среднее образование по специальности секретарь референт.  С 1996 года занимается животноводством, начав этот бизнес с 2,000 сом. Благодаря упорному труду Бактыгул в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется 2 дойные коровы, 2 бычка и 2 лошади. Ежемесячный доход от бизнеса составляет 8,000 сом. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Бактыгул обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота на откорм. Доходы от кредита Бактыгул планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение количества домашней скотины и построить дом сыну.
texts.en:
Baktygul is 47 years old and married.  She has a secondary-level education as an administrative assistant.  She has a business in raising cattle, which she began in 1996 with 2,000 som (KGS).  As a result of her hard work, Baktygul now has 2 milk cows, 2 bulls, and 2 horses.  The monthly income from her business comes to 8,000 som.  

With an aim to further developing her business, Baktygul has applied to Bai Tushum & Partners for a loan of 100,000 som (KGS) to buy cattle for fattening up and selling.  Baktygul is planning to invest the profits from the loan in further increasing the number of domestic cattle she has, and to build a house for her son.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Munira

texts.ru: Мунире 40 лет. Она замужем и на воспитании имеет 3 детей. Ее муж уехал в Российскую Федерацию, так как на родине он не имел постоянную работу. После того как ее муж уехал, Мунира стала основной кормилицей   в семье. Она несколько лет назад обучилась в курсе шитья и кройки и имеет опыта в шитье женской одежды.  Ее навыки и опыт дали ей шанс стать тренером в курсе шитья и кройки и таким образом зарабатывать на жизнь. Уже 3 месяца она занимается этим делом и хочет организовать свой бизнес. Она хочет открыть собственный швейный цех, где она будет обслуживать клиентов, а также обучать несколько учеников. Для открытия швейного цеха, она нуждается швейной машинки, но не имеет средства для этого. Ее муж отказался ей отправить деньги для покупки швейной машинки и поэтому она запрашивает займ на сумму 1500 сомони для покупки швейной машинки. Она ждет вашу доброту и надеется только на вас. Это займ поможет ей организовать свой бизнес и таким путем найти источник дохода, который принесет в ее дом стабильность.
texts.en:
Munira is 40 years old.  She is married and has three children.  Her husband moved to the Russian Federation because he didn't have steady employment in his motherland.  Since her husband left, Munira has been the primary breadwinner for the family.  Several years ago, she studied in a dressmaking course and she has experience in sewing women's clothing.  Her work habits and experience gave her an opportunity to earn money by teaching a dressmaking course.  She has been doing this for three months already and she wants to open her own sewing shop where she will both serve customers and teach several students.

Munira needs a sewing machine in order to open her shop, but she doesn't have the financial resources to buy one.  Her husband refused to send her the money, so she is requesting a loan of 1,500 somoni (TJS) to buy a sewing machine.  She anticipates your kindness and she is relying only on you.  This loan will help her to open her own business, giving her a source of income that will bring stability into her home.

loans.use: to buy sewing a machine

loans.name: Akossiwa

texts.fr: Akossiwa vit avec son conjoint mécanicien et leur 04enfants à Lomé. Trois vont à l’école. Pour aider son conjoint dans les charges du foyer, elle a commencé par vendre des produits d’alimentation générale à domicile. Activité qu’elle exerce depuis 2003.  Elle fait un premier crédit à WAGES pour acheter des sacs de riz, des cartons de tomates, des bidons d’huile végétale et autres produits pour vendre afin de tirer plus de profit.  Avec les profits supplémentaires, elle voudrait construire sa maison pour louer, élargir sa boutique afin de devenir grossiste et améliorer les conditions de  vie de la famille. Elle est âgée de 26ans.
texts.en:
Akossiwa lives in Lomé with her four children and her husband, a mechanic.  Three of the couple's children attend school.  In order to help her husband to provide for the family, she started selling general food products from home in 2003.

She is taking a first loan from WAGES to buy bags of rice, boxes of tomatoes, cans of vegetable oil, and other products that she will resell to make more profits.

With her additional profits, she would like to build a house to be rented out, to expand her shop in order to become a wholesaler, and to improve her family's living conditions.  Akossiwa is 26 years old.

loans.use: to buy general food products.

loans.name: Salamat

texts.ru: Саламат 26 лет, замужем, воспитывает 2 детей, младшему из которых 4 года. Саламат имеет высшее образование После окончания школы клиентка поступила в Аграрный Институт по специальности "Экономист-менеджер" - с 2006 года занимается животноводством и полеводством, начав этот бизнес со стартовой суммы 20,000 сом (KGS). На сегодняшний день, в хозяйстве Саламат имеется 2 лошади, 1 корова. доходы от перепродажи скота и продажи молока составляют примерно 5,000 сом (KGS) в месяц. Саламат обрабатывает 0,3 га  земли где ежегодно сажают Фасоль. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Саламат обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на закуп  1 коровы и скота. Доходы от кредита Саламат планирует вкладывать в увеличения поголовья скота и увеличение площади посевных полей.
texts.en:
Salamat is 26 years old, married, and raising 2 children, the youngest of whom is 4 years of age. Salamat has post-secondary education: after graduating from high school, she enrolled in the Agrarian Institute to study economics and management. Since 2006, Salamat has been raising livestock and cultivating crops, having started her business with an initial investment of 20,000 som (KGS). Presently, she keeps 2 horses and 1 cow. Her income from resale of livestock and sales of milk amounts to roughly 5,000 som (KGS) per month. Salamat also works 0.3 hectares of land where she annually plants beans.

In order to continue developing her business, Salamat has turned to Bai Tushum & Partners for a loan of 50,000 som (KGS) to purchase 1 cow and other livestock. She plans to invest her profits from this loan into further increasing the size of her herd, as well as expanding the area of the land she cultivates.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Salomat

texts.ru: Саломат молодая и энергичная женщина, которая живет далеко от столицы Таджикистана, но всегда старается не отставать от современного развивающегося мира. Она замужем на хорошего человека, которого зовут Ассадулло. Она еще не имеет детей и мечтает, чтобы у нее родились хорошие дети. Она живет с мужем и родителями мужа. Родители мужа пенсионеры, а муж получает маленькую зарплату.  Это зарплата не хватает для обеспечения семьи со всеми необходимыми средствами. Саломат решила помочь мужу для благо получения семьи. С такой целью она обучилась в курсе «Добейся успеха» организованный Ассоциация Деловых Женщин и получила сертификат. Теперь она вполне может организовать свой бизнес и стать успешной в этой сфере. Она хочет организовать бизнес купле продажей  скота, так как имеет опыт в этом виде бизнеса. От полученного дохода она планирует улучшить условию проживания, а также создать свой материнский капитал для будущих детей. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 2500 сомони для покупки скота, чтобы организовать новый бизнес. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Salomat is an energetic young woman who lives far from Tajikistan's capital city but nevertheless tries to keep up with the modern world. She is married to a good man by the name of Assadullo. They do not yet have children, but dream of having beautiful babies. Salomat and her husband live together with his parents. Assadullo's parents are pensioners, while he earns only a small salary, which is insufficient to provide the family with all necessities of life. Salomat has decided to help her husband for the good of the family, and to this end took the course "Succeed" organized by the Association of Business Women and earned her graduation certificate. Now she is quite ready to launch her own business and achieve success.

Salomat would like to start her business of buying and selling cattle, as she has experience in this line of work. She plans to use her profits to improve her living conditions, as well as accumulate savings for her future children. Salomat is requesting a loan of 2500 somoni to purchase livestock and launch her new business. She is counting on your kindness.

loans.use: to buy livestock for launching her new business

loans.name: Gulmira

texts.ru: Гульмире 52 года, замужем, воспитала 3 детей. Гульмира в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи, с 2000 года занимается животноводством, начав этот бизнес с суммы в 10,000 сом (KGS). На сегодняшний день  хозяйство Гульмиры очень развитое и и имеет хороший потенциал. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Гульмира обратилась в компанию «Бай –Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку  молодых овец и телят для откорма и последующей реализации. Доходы от кредита Гульмира планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение хозяйства.
texts.en:
Gulmira is 52 years old, married, and has raised 3 children. As the main source of income for her family, Gulmira has been raising livestock since 2000, having started her business with a sum of 10,000 som (KGS). Her business has developed very well so far and has good potential for future growth.

In order to continue developing her business, Gulmira has turned to Bai Tushum & Partners for a loan of 100,000 som (KGS) to purchase young sheep and calves for fattening and subsequent resale. She plans to invest her profits from this loan into further expansion of her business.

loans.use: to purchase calves and young sheep

loans.name: Abdullobeg

texts.ru: Абдуллобег, когда в детстве играл с друзьями, всегда входил в роль преподавателя. Когда он вырос, его детская мечта осуществилась в реальность, и он стал учителем истории и права. Ему 55 лет. Он женат и на воспитании имеет 5 детей. Его жена пенсионерка и получает маленькую пенсию, что не хватает даже для обеспечения ее самой. Дети совершеннолетние и помогают ему для обеспечения семьи. Они используют свои доходы вместе для покупки продукты питания, одежды, а также для образования. Абдуллобег работает в средней школе и очень любит свою профессию. Его зарплата не хватает, чтобы сделать сбережения. Скоро одна из его дочерей выходит замуж. Он должен купить приданное, а также проводить свадебное мероприятие, которое по  таджикскому обычаю называется «домодталабон». Это мероприятие проводится в доме или в ресторане участием родных и друзей. Накрывается шикарный стол и участвует певец. Это очень интересное мероприятие, где невесту украшают национальными украшениями. Абдуллобег запрашивает займ на сумму 3000 сомони для проведения свадебного мероприятия. Он ждет вашу доброту. Это займ поможет ему сделать счастливой его дочь. Он как добросовестный человек обещает погасить займ во время.
texts.en:
When Abdullobeg was a child and played with his friends, he always wanted to play the role of the teacher.  When he grew up, his childhood dream came true.  He is a teacher of history and law.  He is 55 years old, married, and has five children.  His wife is retired and receives a small pension that isn't enough to pay for even her own needs.  The children are adults and help him provide for their family.  They put their money together and use it to buy food, clothing, and to pay for education.  Abdullobeg works in a high school and he loves his profession, but his salary isn't large enough for him to put any money into savings.

Soon, one of his daughters is going to get married.  Abdullobeg has to pay the dowry and throw a wedding party, which in the Tajik tradition is called a "domodtalabon."  This is a party that is held at home or in a restaurant with friends and family participating.  The table is lavishly set and there is a singer.  At this interesting ceremony, the bride gets bedecked with traditional adornments.  

Abdullobeg is requesting a loan of 3,000 somoni (TJS) to hold the wedding party.  He is relying on your kindness.  This loan will help him make his daughter happy.  As the conscientious man he is, he promises to repay the loan in a timely fashion.

loans.use: to hold a wedding party of his daughter

loans.name: Murotjon

texts.ru: Дом, где живет  Муротджон, не отвечает стандартам жилья и он срочно должен отремонтировать свой дом. Ему 42  лет, он женат и на воспитании имеет 3 детей. Дети совершеннолетние и помогают ему в ведении бизнеса.  У Муротджона есть стоительная бригада, и он более чем 17 лет занимается обслуживанием ремонта дома. Его жена работает медсестрой в клинике и получает маленькую зарплату. Муротджон должен отремонтировать дом, то есть заменить окна и двери, так как зимой они не держат теплоту дома внутри, а в Таджикистане зима довольно холодная. Муротджон запрашивает займ на сумму  2000 сомони для покупки окон для ремонта дома. Он ждет вашу доброту и надеется только на вас.
texts.en:
Murotjon's house is in very poor condition and he must repair it quickly. He is 42 years old, married, and has 3 children in his care. The children are of the age of majority and help their father with his business. Murotjon has a construction crew, and for over 17 years he has been servicing and repairing people's homes. His wife works as a nurse in a clinic and earns a small salary.

Murotjon needs to repair his home and replace old doors and windows that do not currently provide good insulation against Tajikistan's cold winter. He is requesting a loan of 2000 somoni to purchase new windows for his house. Murotjon is counting on your kindness as he has nowhere else to turn.

loans.use: to buy windows for repairing his house

loans.name: Huseyn

texts.ru: Хусейн очень трудолюбивый и целеустремленный человек. С детства он работал и трудился для благо получения семьи, так как они жили бедно в трудных условиях. В то время как его одноклассники играли во дворе после школы, Хусейн работал в кафе, пекарни разнорабочим. Когда он немного вырос, он научился ремонту дома у одного мастера, и стал работать как мастер по ремонту дома. Однако расход семьи увеличивалось, и он был вынужден уехать в Российскую Федерацию, чтобы найти подходящею работу. Данное время ему 34 года, он женат и на воспитании имеет 3 прекрасных детей. Его жена немного подрабатывает купле продажей детской одежды. Он сам работает в пекарни в своей родине, так как ему не удалось в миграции найти подходящею работу. Дети еще не трудоспособные и учатся в средней школе. Хусейн очень заботливый отец и тратит все свои деньги на их содержания. Хусейн имеет машину, в котором его семья очень нуждается. Его машина недавно сломалась, а у Хусейна нет денег для ремонта машины. Еще он должен сделать мелкий ремонт часть дома и поэтому он запрашивает займ на сумму 3000 сомони для ремонта машины и дома. Он является повторным клиентом и имеет хорошую кредитную историю. Он нуждается и ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Huseyn is a very hard-working and purposeful person. Since childhood, he has laboured for his family's well-being, as they lived in difficult conditions. While his classmates played outside after school, Huseyn worked as an assistant in a cafe-bakery. When he grew a little older, he learned home repair from a professional and began working as a repairman himself. However, the family's expenses grew, and Huseyn was forced to travel to Russia to find work. 

Currently, Huseyn is 34 years old, married, and has 3 wonderful children in his care. Huseyn's wife is engaged part-time in selling children's clothing, while he works in a bakery after being unable to find good work abroad. The children are too young to work and currently attend school. Huseyn is a very caring father and spends all his money on his children's well-being.

Huseyn owns a car, which is an absolute necessity for his family. The car recently began to malfunction, but Huseyn lacks the money for its repairs. Additionally, he needs to carry out small repairs in his home. Therefore, Huseyn is requesting a loan of 3000 somoni to repair his car and his house. He is a return client of IMON International and has a good credit history. He needs and counts on your kindness.

loans.use: to repair his car and his house

loans.name: Idris

texts.ru: Идрис проживает в городе Душанбе. Ему 62 года. Он разведен. Идрис три года проработал юристом. У него высшее юридическое образование. На сегодняшний день Идрис предоставляет услугу. Он работает по маршруту №3 по центральной дороге города. Идрис берет кредит для ремонта автомобиля и дома.
texts.en: Idris lives in Dushanbe.  He is 62 years old and divorced.  Idris has a higher education in law and he worked for three years as an attorney.   Today he offers taxi services, working route No. 3 along the city's main road.  Idris is taking out the loan to repair his car and his home.

loans.use: to repair his car and house

loans.name: Aizada

texts.ru: Айзаде 34 годa, замужем, вместе с мужем воспитывает троих детей, младшему из которых два годика. После окончания университета, Айзада  2000 году, в поисках  источника финансирования для своей семьи, Айзада начала заниматься животноводством. Начатое с суммы в 6,000 сом (KGS) хозяйство сегодня приносит около 4,000 сом (KGS) в месяц от продажи молочных продуктов и перепродажи скота. На сегодняшний день, в ее хозяйстве насчитывается 1  корова с теленком, 5 голов овец. В целях дальнейшего увеличения поголовья скота, Айзада обратилась в компанию «Бай Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку телят и овец молодняк. Доходы от кредита Айзада планирует вложить в увеличение поголовья, что позволит ей увеличить свое хозяйство. Ведь в будущем ей предстоит налаживать жизнь детей, она думает сейчас начать чтобы потом было легче.
texts.en:
Aizada is 34 years old and married.  She and her husband have three children, the youngest of whom is just two years old.  After graduating from the university in 2000, Aizada began working in animal husbandry to give her family a source of income.   She started her business with 6,000 som (KGS) and it now brings in about 4,000 som (KGS) per month from the sale of dairy products and cattle.   Today, she has one cow and its calf and five sheep.  

With an aim to increasing the number of cattle she has, she applied to Bai Tushum & Partners for a loan of 50,000 som (KGS) to buy calves and young sheep.  Aizada plans to invest the profits from the loan in increasing the size of her herd, which will expand her business.  After all, one day she will have to get her children established in life and she wants to get started now so it will be easier later.

loans.use: to purchase calves and young sheep

loans.name: Abdulmanon

texts.ru: Абдулманон житель района Рудаки. Ему 42 года. Он женат. У него двое детей. Его жена домохозяйка. Абдулманон предоставляет услугу. Он занимается ремонтом автомашин. Этим видом деятельности он занимается четыре года. Абдулманон берет кредит для приобретения инструментов.
texts.en: Abdulmanon lives in the Rudaki region of Tajikistan. He is married and has two children. Abdulmanon's wife takes care of the household while he works as a car mechanic. He has been in this line of work for four years. Abdulmanon is requesting this loan to purchase tools.

loans.use: to buy tools

loans.name: Jamalkan

texts.ru: Жамалкан 62 года, замужем, воспитала пятерых детей. Жамалкан 30 лет назад начала свой бизнес в животноводстве. Начатое с суммы в 1,000 сом (KGS) хозяйство, сегодня приносит около 5,000 сом (KGS) в месяц от продажи молочных и перепродажи скота.  В целях дальнейшего увеличения поголовья скота, Жамалкан обратилась в компанию «Бай Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку телят и  и молодых овец. Доходы от кредита Жамалкан планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение количества домашние скотины, и в ближайшем будущем – улучшить содержание скота.
texts.en: Jamalkan is 62 years old, married, and has raised five children. She started her livestock business 30 years ago with a sum of 1,000 som (KGS). Today, she earns around 5,000 som (KGS) per month from sales of dairy products and resale of livestock. In order to further increase the size of her herd, Jamalkan has turned to Bai Tushum & Partners for a loan of 50,000 som (KGS) to purchase calves and young sheep. She plans to invest her profits from this loan into further expansion of her herd, and also intends to improve the animal's living conditions in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase calves and young sheep

loans.name: Umarali

texts.ru: Умарали проживает в районе Рудаки. Он женатый молодой человек. У него один ребенок. Жена Умарали домохозяйка. Умарали имеет среднее образование. Он три года как открыл собственный автосервис. Умарали занимается ремонтом автомашин. Он берет кредит для приобретения запасных частей автомашин.
texts.en:
Umarali lives in the Rudaki region. He is a young, married man. He has one child. Umarali's wife is a housewife. 

Umarali has secondary education. Three years ago he opened his own auto service center. Umarali works with repairing vehicles. He takes a loan for the purchase of spare parts for cars.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for cars

loans.name: Ainur

texts.ru: Айнура 41 год, замужем и воспитывает двоих детей. Супруг Айнуры работает в музее заведующим хозяйством. В поисках источника финансирования для своей семьи, Айнура начала свой бизнес в животноводстве еще 1991 году, использовав для этого стартовую сумму 5,000 сом (KGS). Успешно работая в сфере животноводства и полеводства добилась очень хороших результатов, Айнура также выращивает кормовые культуры, что позволяет ей обеспечивать кормами свой скот и иметь дополнительный доход от продажи кормов.Помимо кормовых на своём участке Айнура выращивает картофель.  Ежемесячно семья имеет до 10,000 KGS. Для дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Айнура обратилась в компанию «Бай - Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 135,000 сом (KGS) на покупку коров с телятами и несколько голов МРС молодняк. На прибыль от кредита Айнура планирует увеличить своё хозяйство. Айнура поделилась, что в будущем она планирует выдать построить дом на соседнем участке и улучшить условия содержания скота, построить новый большой сарай.
texts.en:
Ainur is 41 years old, married, and raising two children. Ainur's husband works as head of a museum. In search of a source of income for her family, Ainur started her business of livestock breeding already in 1991, with a starting sum of 5,000 som (KGS). Successfully working in the areas of livestock breeding and field crop cultivation has given good results. Ainur also grows fodder crops, which she uses to provide fodder for her livestock and gets additional income from selling fodder. Besides fodder, Ainur grows potatoes on her plot of land. Every month, the family gets up to 10,000 som (KGS). 

In order to further develop her business, Ainur turned to the organization "Bai Tushum & Partners" for a loan in the amount of 135,000 som (KGS) for the purchase of cows with calves and young sheep. Ainur plans to use the income from the loan in developing her farm. Ainur told us that in the future she plans to build a house at the neighboring plot and improve the conditions of the livestock, building a new, large shed.

loans.use: To purchase cows with calves and young sheep

loans.name: Rakhima

texts.ru: Рахима живет в районе Джалолиддин Руми. Ей 33 года. Она замужем, имеет 3 детей. Муж Рахимы занимается земледелием. Рахима хочет заниматься шитьем национальной одежды. Она хочет взять кредит, чтобы купить швейную машинку.
texts.en: Rakhima lives in the region of J-Rumy. She is married and has three children. Her husband does land cultivation. Rakhima wants to start sewing national Tajik clothing. She wants to take out a loan to buy a sewing machine.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages for her store.

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna is married and a mother of three dependents. She is 47 years old and lives in Calabayan, Osamiz City. Edna owns and operates a motorcycle transport business. She established the motorcycle transport business as a way of generating extra income of 9,000 PHP per month. She has been engaged in this type of service for 3 years. 

Edna requested a loan of 17,000 PHP from GDMPC. She intends to use the money from the loan to purchase motorcycle spare parts and accessories. Edna been a good member of GDMPC since 2007. In the future, Edna wants to purchase more motorcycles to use in her business.

loans.use: to purchase motorcycle spare parts and accessories.

loans.name: Michael

texts.en:
This is Michael, 32, resident of Silang, Cavite, Philippines. Single, he works hard to provide income for his everyday needs as he also help his parents financially.

Michael operates a hair parlor business. He mainly offers hair cutting, coloring, straightening/relaxing, etc. His regular customers are his neighbors and the local community, usually women. He earns a minimum of Php 250 in sales every day.

To help him continue operations of his business, he is requesting a Php 20, 000 loan. He will be utilizing the loan to buy products like hair straightening gel, scissors, shampoo, hair hot oil and other products needed for hair care in his parlor. He expects a boost in his business income as he expands his business.  

Michael dreams to expand his business and hopes that his parlor will be able to branch out through all his hard work on his business. He faithfully meets up with his co-fellowship members to share stories of his work every week.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for products like hair straightening gel, scissors, shampoo, hair hot oil and other products needed for hair care in his parlor.

loans.name: Diosdada

texts.en:
Diosdada is separated and has 8 children. She is 52 years old and resides at Segatic Daku, Clarin. She plants, harvests, and sells bananas to earn a living and she's been in this business for 9 years. Each month, she earns about 10,000 PHP and requested a loan of 20,000 PHP to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise. 

In 2011, Diosdada joined GDMPC. In the future, she wants to make improvements to her house and to improve/expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is now 28 years old and still single. She is still operating her tailoring business and her monthly income has increased to KES 13,500. 

Rose is applying for her second loan with KADET after repaying the previous loan successfully. She will use the loan to stock up on textile materials for her tailoring business. She anticipates getting some profit which she will use to expand her business. 

She still hopes to open a boutique shop, which will improve her living standards.

loans.use: To stock up on textile materials.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy leather for making bags and shoes.

loans.name: Mwaka

texts.en:
Mwaka is a 41-year-old woman with six children, all living together with her husband. She is a woman with a desire to succeed and who shows high integrity and respect to others. She has always been known for being a hard worker and everything has been inspired by her family. She has always been able to provide for her family, and her husband appreciates her support very much.
 
She raises goats and sheep in the summer for them to be sold to slaughter houses and other consumers who buy at retail. It’s for this reason that she is approaching Yehu with a loan request amounting to Ksh 30,000 so that she can buy more goats and vaccines for her livestock.

loans.use: to buy more goats and vaccines for her livestock.

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en:
Ibrahim is 47 years old and lives in the town of Arua hill in the Arua region of Uganda. He is married and has 7 children, with 4 of them currently in school. For the past 22 years, Ibrahim has been working hard to manage his small business, which sells products such as rice, sugar and millet. 

To help expand his business, Ibrahim has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more products such as maize flour, beans and rice for resale, and will help Ibrahim to generate greater profits and pay school fees for his children. Ibrahim hopes that in the future he will be able to eradicate poverty in his family. 

Ibrahim is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Ibrahim who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for micro-loans.

loans.use: to buy more products for resale, such as maize flour, beans and rice.

loans.name: Al-Frasha Group

texts.en: This group is called Al-Frasha and consists of 4 ladies who live in Taiz, Yemen. They took out a loan of 175,000 YER from AMB. Sumia is 31 years old and a married woman who has 3 children. She and her husband are the breadwinners of the family. They work to offer a good life for their children. Sumia intends to buy a home appliance, and she applied for a loan of 50,000 YER from AMB to buy an oven to use in her house. She hopes to give her children a good life.

loans.use: to buy an oven to use in her house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Saymiddin

texts.ru: Саймиддин проживает в районе Рудаки. Он женат. Ему 34 года. У него трое детей. Жена Саймиддина домохозяйка. Саймиддин занимается частным извозом. В этой области он десять лет. Саймиддин берет кредит для ремонта своего авто.
texts.en:
Saymiddin lives in the Rudaki region. He is 24 years old, and married. He has three children. Saymiddin's wife is a housewife. 

Saymiddin works as a private taxi driver. He has worked in this area for 10 years. Saymiddin takes a loan for the repair of his car.

loans.use: to repair his car

loans.name: Chinara

texts.ru: Чинаре 52 года, замужем, воспитывает 3 детей. В качестве источника дохода для семьи, Чинара в 1980 году начала заниматься животноводством и земледелием. Начатое с 10,000 сом (KGS) хозяйство на сегодня приносит около 15,000 сом (KGS) в месяц от продажи молочных и мясных продуктов.  Благодаря упорному труду Чинары, ее поголовье насчитывает 5 дойную корову и 50 овец. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Чинара обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 60,000 сом (KGS) на сена для скота. Доходы Чинара планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение поголовья скота и улучщить материальное положение семьи.
texts.en:
Chinara is 52 years old, married, and raising three children. In search of a source of income for the family, Chinara started working with livestock breeding and field crop cultivation in 1980. Having started with 10,000 som (KGS), the farm today brings in around 15,000 som (KGS) per month from the sale of milk and dairy products. Thanks to Chinara's persistent work, she currently has five dairy cows and 50 sheep. 

With an aim to further develop her business, Chinara turned to the organization "Bai Tushum & Partners" for a loan in the amount of 60,000 som (KGS) for hay for the livestock. Chinara plans to invest the income in further increasing the number of livestock and improve the financial situation of the family.

loans.use: to purchase fodder

loans.name: Serah

texts.en: Everyone is on the lookout for opportunities to increase sales during this festive season. Sedah is one of them. She wants to stock her cosmetic store with a variety of beauty products. She is thankful for the last loan that helped her shop to flourish. Sedah is requesting a new loan to buy more cosmetics such as shampoo, hair weaves, creams and other beauty items. She tells us that her business is doing well and she wants to expand it so that she can have increased sales and profits.

loans.use: to buy more cosmetics such as shampoo, hair weaves, creams, and other beauty items.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is a 42-year-old single mother of two children. She has been selling secondhand clothes for the past 10 years with a monthly income of about Kes 10,000, which she uses to support her family.

The client is applying for her first loan term with KADET LTD after being introduced by another existing customer. She plans to use the loan to purchase more stock of secondhand clothes. She anticipates profits that she plans to save towards the education of her children. 

Her dreams are to be able to buy secondhand clothes in bulk for resale.

loans.use: To purchase more stock of secondhand clothes.

loans.name: Siraji

texts.en:
Siraji is 33 years old and lives in the town of Arua hill in the Arua region of Uganda. He is married and has 9 children with 5 of them currently in school. For the past 7 years, he has been working hard to manage his retail shop, which sells sugar, salt and cooking oil. 

To help expand his business, Siraji has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more essential commodities such as milk, cooking oil, sugar and salt to attract more customers. This will help Siraji to generate greater profits and pay school fees for his children and their medical bills. He hopes that in the future he will be able to improve his family's standard of living. 

Siraji is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Siraji who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for micro-loans.

loans.use: to buy more essential commodities such as milk, cooking oil, sugar and salt to attract more customers.

loans.name: Svetlana

texts.ru: Благодаря кредиту, полученному при помощи поддержки Фонда КИВА, Светлана смогла приумножить количество скота и получить доходы от продажи молока и молочных продуктов. Учитывая успешный опыт заимствования и хороший результат -  на сегодня ее хозяйство насчитывает 4 лошади, 1 бычок и 10 овец, кроме скота она имеет 5,5 га посевной земли в собственности и 6 га арендуемой. Светлана в третий раз обратилась в компанию "Бай - Тушум и Партнеры" за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 1 доиной коровы. Доходы Светлана планирует вложить в развитие бизнеса.
texts.en:
Thanks to her previous loan, received through the support of Kiva, Svetlana was able to increase the number of livestock and receive income from selling milk and dairy products. Due to the successful experience of borrowing and the good result her farm currently counts 4 horses, 1 steer and 10 sheep, and in addition to the livestock she owns 5.5 hectares of crop land and rents 6 hectares. 

Svetlana turned to the organization "Bai Tushum & Partners" for the third time for a loan in the amount of 50,000 som (KGS) for the purchase of a dairy cow. Svetlana plans to invest the income in developing the business.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Fotima

texts.en:
Fotima is a very kind and industrious woman. She is a careful mother of 3 children. She has had very hard luck. Her husband married another woman, and he doesn’t help Fotima provide for the children. During her 39 years she worked in many places very hard to earn a living. She wants to provide her children with a good education and a good quality of life, but her income is small and that’s why she decided to start a new business with farming in order to generate an income with which she can contribute to her home’s finances. 

She studied the course of ‘To get ahead’ through a women's organization and got enough skills about business. She is going to grow wheat, carrots and onions. Her children will help her with the business. She will be a very successful businesswoman, as she is hardworking and smart. 

She is asking for a loan of 2,500 TJS to buy seeds and mineral fertilizers for organizing her new business. She will get through by using the loan, and her business will become a source of income so that her family can have a good quality of life and better financial opportunities to progress. She awaits your support.

loans.use: To buy seeds and mineral fertilizers for organizing her new business.

loans.name: Purity

texts.en:
Purity is a 48-year-old woman, single, and a mother of two children. She runs a boutique business in Nairobi which has now been operational for one year, and she gets a monthly income of about fifteen thousand shillings. 

This will be Purity’s first loan with KADET LTD and she plans to use the entire loan to buy more stock of new clothes for resale and thus maximize her sales during this festive season. She plans to use the profits to expand her business. 

In future she wants to open another boutique in another part of the town.

loans.use: To purchase new clothes for resale.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is 37 years old, single, and supports one of his siblings. He runs a retail shop in Kaptumo Location which has been in operation for a period of over 10 years, earning him an income of about KES 10,000 monthly.

He is borrowing his sixth loan from KADET LTD after repaying the previous one successfully. He intends to use this amount to purchase sugar, tea leaves, bread, wheat flour, maize flour and cooking fat for resale in his shop. The profits he earns will be used to repay the loan and pay school fees for his sibling.  

He hopes to have a family and expand his business.

loans.use: To purchase more stock for his retail shop.

loans.name: Dolores Maria

texts.es:
Dolores, 58 años de edad, originaria de Granada, madre de 5 hijos mayores de edad, independiente, de oficio comerciante. Inicio desde muy joven trabajando con  su mama en la producción de tortilla, pero con el tiempo su mama se puso enferma y fue allí que decidió dejarle el negocio a su hija, luego ella decidió solicitar un pequeño préstamo para poner otro negocio  como es la pulpería de la  que es propietaria hace mas de  2 años, ella cuenta con el apoyo de su mama, sus expectativas es ampliar su negocio para poder incrementar las ventas y asi poder obtener mejores ganancias. 
Ella esta solicitando el crédito para comprar granos básicos como arroz, azúcar, aceite, frijoles, papel higiénico y productos de limpieza etc. Pues son los productos que más buscan sus clientes. Pues desea tener bien surtido su pulpería con mucha más variedad de productos que son necesarios para el consumo familiar de sus clientes.  Su meta es mantener activo su negocio
texts.en:
Dolores, 58 years old, originally from Granada, mother of 5 independent adult children, is a merchant. She started working at a very early age with her mother making tortillas, but over time her mother became ill and it was then she decided to leave the business to her daughter. Later she decided to apply for a small loan for another business, a grocery store, and she has been the owner for more than 2 years. She has the support of her mother. Her expectations are to expand her business in order to increase sales and thus be able to gain higher profits.

She is requesting the loan in order to buy basic grains such as rice, sugar, oil, beans, toilet paper and cleaning products, etc, as these are the products most clients look for. She wants to have a well supplied store with lots of variety of products that are needed for family consumption by her customers. Her goal is to keep her business active.

loans.use: to buy basic grains such as rice, sugar, oil, beans, toilet paper, and cleaning products for her store.

loans.name: Asmar

texts.en:
Asmar is 42 years old, married, and has two children. She was born into a ordinary farmer's family and currently works in farming and animal husbandry. The family's primary source of income is animal husbandry. Beginning in her childhood, she helped her family around the farm and today she can keep her business profitable.  She is very accurate on accounts and has an industrious temperament. 

Asmar is requesting a loan for 1,600 AZN, which she will use to purchase installation materials for her house and payment for labor. She plans  to improve their living conditions without any simplification of business.

loans.use: to purchase installation materials for her house and payment for labor.

loans.name: Belen

texts.en:
Belen is a married woman and a mother of two children from Sikatuna, Bohol, Philippines. She has run a sari-sari (variety) store for several years.
Belen is requesting a loan to buy stocks of canned goods, candies, snack foods, beverages, soaps, and toiletries to sell.
In the future, Belen hopes to expand her business and make it successful.

loans.use: to buy stocks of canned goods, snack foods, beverages, and toiletries to sell

loans.name: Rosemary

texts.en:
Rosemary is 45 years old, married, and has six children, four of whom attend school.  She lives in the town of Arua hill in the Arua region of Uganda. For the past seven years, Rosemary has been working hard to manage her retail shop, selling sugar, salt, and cooking oil. 

To help expand her business, Rosemary is requesting a loan from BRAC Uganda for 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings, which she will use to purchase more essential commodities such as milk, cooking oil, sugar, and salt to attract more customers. The loan will help Rosemary to generate greater profits and pay school fees for her children. Rosemary hopes that in the future she will be able to own other more businesses that will make her a rich woman. 

Rosemary is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Rosemary who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to purchase milk, cooking oil, sugar, and salt.

loans.name: Nune

texts.en:
Nune lives in Kapan town with her son, Ruben who studies at State Engineering University of Armenia in the economic department. Nune works at a local company and gets a monthly income, but it is very difficult for her to cover daily costs and save money for Ruben's education. 

Nune is requesting a loan, which she will use to pay for university tuition. This will enable her son to continue his education and become a good economist in the future.

loans.use: to pay for university tuition.

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
This is Emma. She previously accessed a 35,000 PHP loan that she used to buy watches and cellphones for her business. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children and in their personal, household and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for another 50,000 PHP loan to buy additional stock of rice, which is her latest business. She is still into selling watches and cellphones, and part of the money will go to that business. Her profits from her business will definitely help her to sustain their daily needs and the educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Emma dreams to be able to give her children a good and high quality education through all her hard work on her business. Every week, she faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for more stock of rice needed in her business

loans.name: Salina Chepchirchir

texts.en:
Salina is 48 years old and has four children.  She changed her business from cereals to milk selling when she noticed that the business was not bringing in good returns.  She now earns 6,000 KES.

Salina successfully repaid the previous loan and is requesting another loan for 50,000 KES, which she will use to pay the milk suppliers.  The anticipated profits will be used to educate her children.  

.

loans.use: to pay the milk suppliers

loans.name: Nu

texts.en: Nu is requesting a new loan, which he will use to buy good quality food and rice in bulk. This purchase will help her to better attract and satisfy her customers. Her previous loan enabled her to improve her business. She hopes that her new loan will assist her in increasing the size of her food stall and sales and will also help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase food and rice.

loans.name: Trinh

texts.en: Trinh is requesting a new loan, which she will use to buy good quality food and breads at a wholesale price. This purchase will help her to better attract and satisfy her customers. Her previous loan enabled her to improve her business. She hopes that her new loan will assist her in increasing the size of her food stall and sales and will also help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase food and breads.

loans.name: Al_Krama Group

texts.en: The Al_krama group consists of three women and one man.  They live in Taiz, Yemen. Ebtsam is 30 years old. She has a small house and intends to renovate it. She is requesting a youth loan from AMB for 30,000 YER, which she will use  to buy construction supplies. She hopes to have a big house.

loans.use: to purchase construction supplies.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy stationary; pens, erasers, notebooks and also mechanic tools.

loans.name: Carmencita

texts.en:
Carmencita is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 5 years. She earns more income from buying and selling ready to wear clothing.

Carmencita has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to purchase materials for the repair of her fishing boat for her fishing business.

She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase materials for the repair of her fishing boat.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth works hard to support her family. Ruth is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Ruth requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stocks like can goods, soap, rice, soft drinks, etc to sell.

Ruth has been in this business for 10 years now.

In the future, Ruth would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stock like can goods, soap, rice, soft drinks, etc. to sell

loans.name: Mansueta

texts.en:
Mansueta is a 60 year old from Loboc, Bohol. She is engaged in hog raising business for several years now. This is the source of her income.
Mansueta is asking for a loan to buy additional piglets and feeds to raise.
In the future, Mansueta hopes of making her business a success.

loans.use: to buy additional piglets and feeds

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
Carmelita is a hard-working entrepreneur, who has a charcoal-selling business in the Philippines. Carmelita has been in this business for 20 years. She earns more income from food processing. 

She is borrowing PHP 23,000 through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to resell. 

Carmelita has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams of building and expanding her business, to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to resell

loans.name: Kpk Swadaya 5 Group

texts.en:
"KPK Swadaya 5" is a group of 3 people whose members live in the same village and have the same business. The group's leader, Sudarmani, is the one in the center in the picture and is 50 years old. She is married and has 2 children, Arif, 21 years old (college), and Agung, 18 years old (Senior High School). Sudarmani and her husband live together with their children and take care of the different household responsibilities together.

She sells cooked food from her home. She starts to cook in the morning, 4am to 11am. This business allows her to meet her needs and those of her children without too much difficulty.

Sudarmani and the other members of the "KPK Swadaya 5" group are requesting financial support from VisionFund Indonesia for the 2nd time so that they can increase their working capital to buy fish, vegetables, eggs and chickens. “KPK Swadaya 5” is a discipline group and the previous loans have been properly repaid.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, fish, eggs and chickens.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy house dress, blouse, T-shirt

loans.name: An

texts.en: An is requesting a new loan, which she will use to buy a range of new products, such as food and beverages, to restock her general store. This purchase will help her to better meet the needs of her customers. Her previous loan enabled her to improve her business and offer her customers a greater variety of products. She hopes that her new loan will assist her in increasing the size of her store and sales and will also help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase food and beverages to stock her store.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize and sorghum.

loans.name: Jeniva

texts.en:
Jeniva is 29 years old, married, and has four children, three of whom attend school.  She lives in the town of Arua hill in the Arua region of Uganda. For the past three years, Jeniva has been working hard to manage her hair salon.

To help expand her business, Jeniva is requesting a loan from BRAC Uganda for 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings, which she will use to buy more hair products, such as weaves for styling.  The loan will help Jeniva to generate greater profits and improve her family standard of living. Jeniva hopes that in the future she will be able to expand her business into a hair vocational training center. 

Jeniva is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Jeniva who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to purchase hair products, such as weaves for styling,

loans.name: Mai

texts.en: Mai is requesting a new loan, which she will use to buy a greater variety and quantity of basic goods, such as snack foods and confectionery, to restock her general store. This purchase will help her to better meet the needs of her customers. Her previous loan enabled her to improve her business and offer her customers a greater variety of products. She hopes that her new loan will assist her in increasing the size of her store and sales and will also help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase snack foods and confectionery.

loans.name: Huong

texts.en: Huong is requesting a new loan, which she will use to buy a range of new products, such as stationery, candies, and lighters, to restock her general store. This purchase will help her to better meet the needs of her customers. Her previous loan enabled her to improve her business and offer her customers a greater variety of products.  She hopes that her new loan will assist her in increasing the size of her store and sales and will also help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase stationery, candies, and lighters.

loans.name: Agua De Coihue Group

texts.es:
Este Banco Comunal se llama “Agua de Coihue” está conformado por 20 emprendedores quienes se dedican a diferentes rubros, entre los cuales se encuentran; tejidos, artesanía, bazar, venta de comida, peluquería, servicios entre otros. Todos ellos pertenecientes a la ciudad de Chillan.
Lidia, presidenta del grupo del Banco Comunal, quien en la foto se encuentra de pie, ocupando el cuarto lugar de izquierda a derecha, viste polera de color negra, su cabello es de color castaño oscuro y lo usa suelto.
Ella se dedica al rubro de  venta de ropa, cosméticos y accesorios, desde hace 1 año. Comenta que trabaja en su casa y ofrece su mercadería a sus vecinos a domicilio, ofrece gran variedad de productos como pulseras, aros, maquillaje, perfumes, poleras, lo que su clientela le solicita ella lo tiene.
La mercadería que va necesitando la compra en la ciudad de Concepción, encuentra variedad en ropa y accesorios a bajo costo, por lo tanto conveniente económicamente-
Con el crédito comprará poleras, short, calzas, perfumes, maquillaje, aros, cinturones, pulseras.
Una de las metas de Lidia es tener una boutique para atender a su clientela de manera ordenada y poder mostrar toda su mercadería para que su clientela encuentre lo que busca, así con esto generar mayores ingresos ya que desea agrandar la casa para su madre que es discapacitada.
Lidia vive junto a sus padres. Sus sueños a nivel personal es poder pagar sus estudios y tener una carrera, y a nivel familiar estar bien con sus padres y que no les falte nada.
Ella está muy agradecida y contenta de la ayuda brindada por Fondo Esperanza para invertir en su negocio. Además se siente muy cómoda con el grupo que participa, ya que tienen buena comunicación.
Chillán es una comuna de la zona centro sur de Chile. Su nombre significa “silla del sol” en mapudungun, idioma de nuestros indígenas mapuches. Chillán es conocida como “Cuna de la Patria” o “Tierra de Artistas”, debido a que en la ciudad han nacido destacados personajes de la historia de Chile, como por ejemplo el conocido pianista Claudio Arrau.
texts.en:
The group called “Agua de Coihue” is made up of 20 entrepreneurers that are dedicated to different areas, among which are textiles, crafts, a bazaar, selling food, hairdressing, and others. All of them live in the city of Chillan.

Lidia, president of the group, is standing fourth from the left in the photo and is wearing a black t-shirt. Her hair is dark brown and she is wearing it loose. She has been dedicated to the sale of clothing, cosmetics and accessories for the past year. She says that she works at home and offers her merchandise to her neighbors. She offers a wide variety of products such as bracelets, rings, makeup, perfumes, sweaters, shirts, anything her clients request.

She needs to buy merchandise in the city of Concepción, as it is more economical because she will find a variety of clothing and accessories at a low cost. With this loan she will buy t-shirts, shorts, leggings, makeup, rings, belts, and bracelets.

One of Lidia's goals is to have a boutique to serve her clientele in an orderly fashion and be able to show all of her merchandise to her clients. This will generate more income. She wants to enlarge her house for her disabled mother.

Lidia lives with her parents. Her personal dream is to pay for her studies and to have a career. For her parents, she wants them to lack nothing. She is very grateful and glad for the help provided by Fondo Esperanza (Hope Fund) to invest in her business. She also feels very comfortable with the group since they have good communication.

Chillán is a commune in the south central zone of Chile. Its name means "chair of the sun" in mapudungun, the language of the Mapuche Indians. Chillán is known as  “Cuna de la Patria” (Cradle of the Homeland) or “Tierra de Artistas” (Land of the Artists), since the city is the birthplace of prominent figures in Chilean history, for example the pianist Claudio Arrau.

loans.use: to buy t-shirts, shorts, leggings, perfumes, makeup, rings, belts, and bracelets.

loans.name: Keneth

texts.en:
Keneth is a 26-year-old single man who supports his mother and sister. He is a dairy farmer which has been his occupation for the last seven years. Keneth earns a monthly income of 13,500 Kenyan shillings.

This will be his sixth loan with KADET LTD, and he plans to use the entire loan to purchase another dairy cow. With the profits, he will expand his business. 

In the future, he plans to do large scale farming.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Chizi

texts.en: For the last three years, Chizi has operated a meat goat business at the market. She buys, raises, and later sells the goats, mostly to slaughterhouses and butchers. It has been a profitable project which has enabled her to support her children and provide for their education. Chizi wants to take advantage of this December season when sales almost double because of high demand. For this reason, she needs to have more goats to sell. She is a responsible woman who is also a mother to four children. She promises to repay this loan so that she can take out more loans in the future.

loans.use: to buy more goats to sell during the Christmas and New Year holidays

loans.name: Yanina

texts.es:
Yanina es una joven de 26 años de edad, es una joven con muchas ganas de salir adelante y  a pesar de sus bajos recursos con mucho esfuerzo se encuentra estudiando la carrera de Farmacia en una universidad de su ciudad.  Ella trabaja día a día en su pequeño negocio de venta de huevos de codorniz cocidos; ella lleva en este negocio desde hace 2 años y con el fruto de su trabajo puede solventar sus gastos de estudios y también apoyar con algunos gastos a sus padres; ella cree que le va bien en su negocio porque tiene muchas ganas de salir adelante y sobre todo es amable con los clientes.

Yanina está muy agradecida por el apoyo que le han brindado los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado ella podrá comprar materiales para sus estudios como son libros, separatas, micas, entre otros; así ella podrá tener los materiales necesarios para que pueda estudiar y podrá luchar por hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Ser una gran profesional y tener su casa propia”.
texts.en:
Yanina, 26, is a young woman with a great desire to get ahead.  Despite a lack of resources and with a lot of effort she's studying pharmacy in a university in her city.

She works every day in her small business selling cooked quail eggs.  She has had this business for two years and with the fruit of her labor she's able to pay her educational expenses and also support some of her parents' expenses.  She believes it's going well for her in her business because she want to get ahead very much and above all because she's friendly with the customers.

Yanina's very grateful for the support of Kiva lenders because thanks to their help she'll be able to buy books, supplements, covers, and other materials for her studies.  That way she'll have the materials she needs to be able to study and she'll strive to make her biggest dream a reality: "To be a great professional and have her own house."

loans.use: to buy materials for her studies

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize and sorghum.

loans.name: Chi

texts.en: Chi is requesting a loan to buy good quality ingredients and meats at wholesale prices to sell.  Her loan will help to better attract and satisfy her customers. Chi used a previous loan to improve her business and she hopes this loan will increase the size of her food stall and her sales. Chi will use the profit from her loan to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy good quality ingredients and meats at wholesale prices

loans.name: Efigenia

texts.en:
Efigenia earns a living through her sari-sari (or variety store) business. She sells various goods to the people in her place in Loboc, Bohol, Philippines.

Efigenia is asking for a loan to buy more stock to sell, like canned goods, noodles, soda, candies and snack foods, soap and toiletries. With this added stock, she will be able to attract more customers and sell more items, thus augmenting her profit and income.

In the future, Efigenia has hopes of expanding her business to make it a success.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell, like canned goods, noodles, soda, candies and snack foods, soap and toiletries.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize and sorghum.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize and sorghum.

loans.name: Gilbert

texts.en:
Gilbert is 45 years old and lives in the town of Paidah in the Arua region of Uganda. He is married and has two children. For the past six years, Gilbert has been working hard to manage his small business of selling charcoal.

To help expand his business, Gilbert has requested a loan of 2,000,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more charcoal for resell and will help Gilbert to generate greater profits and pay for his family's medical bills. Gilbert hopes that in the future he will be able to start another side business for additional income. 

Gilbert is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Gilbert who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans but have businesses that have grown too large for micro-loans.

loans.use: to buy more charcoal for resell.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize and sorghum.

loans.name: Muungano Group

texts.en:
Muungano Group is a group of 17 farmers in Lugari District, represented by Hellen. The group has 12 women and 5 men. Hellen is on the right of the photo with her hand raised. 

Farming inputs will be delivered to Hellen on credit, consisting of the necessary materials to plant 0.5 acres of maize and sorghum. Hellen is a new One Acre Fund farmer and is excited for the 2013 Long Rains season. She joined One Acre Fund in order to gain access to hybrid seed and fertilizer and because One Acre Fund has the best planting methods.

Hellen described her harvest last year as good, but hopes she can have an even better one as a One Acre Fund farmer. She plans to spend the money that she earns from her next harvest on sending her children to school and perhaps investing in another business. 

During the 2013 Long Rains season, each group member will receive 0.5 acres of agricultural inputs, on credit. In total, Muungano Group will receive 8.5 acres worth of inputs on credit.

Gladys and Edith, two of the farmers of Muungano Group, chose to drop out of the program after the Kiva photo was taken. They are still pictured above.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize and sorghum

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize and sorghum.

loans.name: Njete Group

texts.en:
Njete Group is located in Lugari District. It is a group of 4 women and 2 men led by Sylviar, pictured on the right with her hand raised. She is receiving an input loan for a ½ acre of maize and sorghum cultivation. Sylviar is a new One Acre Fund farmer and is excited for the 2013 Long Rains season. She joined One Acre Fund in order to grow enough food for the family.

Last year, Sylviar harvested 8 bags of maize on 1 acre of land. She is excited to improve her harvest as a One Acre Fund farmer during the 2013 Long Rains season. She plans to spend the money that she earns from her next harvest on sending her children to school, buying livestock, and perhaps investing in another business. Sylviar’s group members will each receive input loans of ½ acre during the 2013 Long Rains season. In total they will receive inputs for 3 acres of maize and sorghum.

Grace, one of the farmers of Njete Group, chose to drop out of the program after the Kiva photo was taken. She is still pictured above.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize and sorghum

loans.name: Akouvi

texts.fr: Akouvi est âgée de 29ans. Son mari est menuisier et ils ont 02 enfants. L’ainé âgé de 04ans est scolarisé et le dernier a 1an 10mois. Quant à Akouvi, elle est revendeuse de nourriture sous un hangar. Ses achats se font à Lomé et elle sollicite son premier crédit pour acheter du riz, des tomates, de l’huile végétale et autre. Elle a 2ans d’ancienneté dans l’activité. Avec le profit, elle veut épargner, ouvrir un bar dans l’avenir et avoir une bonne condition de vie.
texts.en: Akouvi is 29 years old.  Her husband is a carpenter and the couple have two children.  Their eldest is 4 years old and in school.  Their youngest is 22 months old.  Akouvi sells food from under a shelter.  She makes her purchases in Lomé and is requesting her first loan to buy rice, tomatoes, vegetable oil, etc.  She has been in this business for two years.  Akouvi would like to save the profits she makes.  In the future she would like to open a bar and enjoy good living conditions.

loans.use: to buy food products

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize and sorghum.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize and sorghum.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize and sorghum.

loans.name: Tich Gi Luya Group

texts.en:
Tich Gi Luya Group is located in the Butere District of Kenya. It is a group of five women and three men led by Erasto, who is pictured on the right with his hand raised. He is receiving an input loan for half an acre's worth of maize and sorghum to cultivate. The 2013 "long rains" season (March/April to May/June) will be Erasto’s first season with One Acre Fund. He joined this year in order to gain access to hybrid seed and fertilizer delivered reliably at the best prices, so that he can grow enough food for the family.

Last year, Erasto harvested three bags of maize on one acre of land. He is excited that he will improve his harvest as a One Acre Fund farmer. He plans to spend the money that he earns from his next harvest on sending his children to school, repairing his home, buying livestock, saving for the future and perhaps investing in another business. During the 2013 long rains season, each group member will receive half an acre of agricultural inputs on credit, meaning that Erasto’s group will receive four acres worth in total.

(One of the group members, Catherine, dropped out of the program after the Kiva photo was taken. She is still pictured above.)

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize and sorghum.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize and sorghum.

loans.name: Hoa

texts.en: Hoa is requesting a loan to buy new dishes, good quality food, and rice to stock her food stall. Her loan will help to better attract and satisfy her customers. Hoa used a previous loan to improve her business and she hopes this loan will increase the size of her food stall and her sales. Hoa will use the profit from her loan to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy new dishes, good quality food, and rice to stock her food stall

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizers for the cultivation of maize and sorghum.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize and sorghum.

loans.name: Eliana

texts.en:
Eliana is a 47-year-old, married woman. She has been working in the photography business for twenty years. 

In 2010, Eliana started to work for her own benefit. She is working hard to develop and improve her business to help her husband to increase their income and improve their living. Eliana enjoys her business a lot and she puts as much effort as she can into developing it. 

Eliana is applying for her fourth cycle loan from Kiva's partner, Al Majmoua Lebanese Association for Development, in order to buy new, updated cameras and machines necessary for her business development. Her previous loan helped her a lot to open her own studio, which was an important step forward to attract more customers. 

Eliana's husband supports her a lot and encourages her to continue to develop her business because he is proud of her and her talent. Eliana hopes to keep on improving herself and developing her business as much as she can.

loans.use: to buy new, updated cameras and machines for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy material to sew dresses in her tailor business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy 8 bags of corn, 4 bags of beans and 25 liters of oil

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy 25 pagnes and a carton of hair extensions

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy 2 boxes of hair extensions, 4 boxes of body lotion and 3 boxes of hair products

loans.name: Joshua

texts.en:
Joshua is 34 years old and lives in Kenya with his wife and three children, two of whom are in school. He has been a farmer for the past six years and produces milk, sugarcane, and tea which he sells to people in his local area. Joshua also works as a driver as an additional source of income. His major business challenge is the poor road network.

Joshua is requesting a 60,000 KES loan from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase a dairy cow to give him additional milk which will result in more income. He will use the profits from his loan to uplift his living standards and pay for his children's schooling. In the future, Joshua aspires to have his own public transport vehicle in the next five years. He is very grateful to Juhudi Kilimo for funding his loan.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Phuong

texts.en: Phuong is requesting a loan to buy a greater quantity of food ingredients to stock her food stall. These purchases will help her to better attract and satisfy her customers. Phuong used a previous loan to improve her business and she hopes this loan will increase the size of her food stall and her sales. Phuong will use the profits from her loan to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a greater quantity of food ingredients to stock her food stall

loans.name: Fredrick

texts.en:
Fredrick is still running his motorcycle transport shop and his wife is still running a retail shop to provide a secondary income for his family. After his previous loan, his income has increased to 20,000 KES. 

Fredrick is requesting his second loan with KADET LTD to purchase consumer goods such as sugar, wheat flour, rice, cooking oil, and other products for his wife's business. He has successfully repaid his previous loans. Fredrick intends to educate his children to the highest level possible and start a dairy farming business with the profit earned from his two businesses. In the future, he dreams of having a wholesale shop, buying a taxi car, and giving his children the best education possible.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, wheat flour, rice, cooking oil, and other products for his wife's business

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizers for the cultivation of maize and sorghum.

loans.name: Bahati

texts.en:
