The group has 19 women who find themselves on their fourth loan cycle, working comfortably together and supporting each other within the program.

Nancy, a member of this group, earns her living sewing. She has been a dressmaker for a while, and thanks to her hard work, she is making progress. She is an excellent person who, despite certain obstacles, is getting ahead. Her goal is to be able to have a large sewing workshop and to be able to provide jobs to other people in her neighborhood, because she knows that this is a difficult time.

She is requesting this loan for the purchase of fabric, thread, elastic, buttons, zippers, and more, so that she can use them in her workshop and continue working.

loans.use: to buy fabric, thread, elastic, buttons, zippers, and more.

loans.name: Paz Y Bien Group

texts.es: Este es el Grupo “Paz y Bien” que conforman 08 socios que se dedican a diversas actividades de comercio que pasan al ciclo 10. Este es el caso de una de los socios Eduardo de 24 años, soltero, forma parte de la directiva y es la que preside al Grupo. Hace 03 años que Eduardo inicio su propio negocio de la venta de ceviche en un puesto y cuenta con clientes fidelizados. Su sueño es de ampliar más su negocio y así poder atender mejor a sus clientes. Solicito el crédito para la compra de una cocina industrial de 02 hornillas y pescado. Eduardo está muy contento con este préstamo y agradece a los inversionistas Kiva. Eduardo se encuentra en la parte de atrás es el tercero del lado derecho, viste polo verde.
texts.en:
This is Paz y Bien Group, made up of eight members in their tenth cycle who make a living in a variety of business activities.  This is the case of Eduardo, one of the members.  He's 24 years old and single, and he presides over the board of directors.

Three years ago Eduardo started his own business selling ceviche in a stall, and he has loyal customers.  His dream is to expand his business more and be able to better serve his customers.

He requested the loan to buy an industrial stove with two burners and fish. 

Eduardo's very happy about this loan and thanks the Kiva lenders.

Eduardo's the third from the right in the back, wearing a green polo shirt.

loans.use: to buy fish and an industrial stove

loans.name: Ephys

texts.en: Ephys runs a private service vehicle business.  His wife, kids, and business are doing well.  He is now applying for his second loan with KADET LTD after repaying the previous loan successfully.  He plans to use this new loan to service his vehicles, as they are due.  With the profits he earns from his business, he plans to educate his children and to expand his dairy farm.  His dreams are to buy a piece of land and construct a permanent house in his hometown.

loans.use: to service his vehicles.

loans.name: Ecole Don Bosco Group

texts.fr: Le client Prince est un enseignant dans une école Don Bosco, âgé de 35 ans, marié et père de 3 enfants, qui étudient tous. Ce client s’est déjà lancé dans le projet de petit commerce de poissons. Elle s’entraide avec son épouse dans ces activités commerciales. Ainsi, ce nouveau prêt doit lui servir de renforcer son chiffre d’affaire en achetant 5 sacs de poissons (salés et fumés). Ce client regrette la dégradation et le développement de l’insécurité dans la province et qui a des effets collatéraux, surtout négatifs sur ses projets. Au finish, elle remercie Hekima pour son soutien en micro crédit pendant cette période de crise, alors que les autres institutions financières ont déjà stoppé l’octroie de crédit.
texts.en: The client Prince is a teacher in a Don Bosco school. He is 35 years old, married and father to 3 children, who all study. This client already went into business in a project of a small shop selling fish. He is helped in this commercial business by his spouse. Thus, this new loan will serve to strengthen his turnover by buying 5 bags of fish (salted and smoked). This client regrets the deterioration and the development of insecurity in the province which has collateral effects, especially negative for projects. In the end, he thanks Hekima for its support in micro loans during this period of crisis, while other financial institutions already stopped granting credit.

loans.use: to buy 5 bags of fish (salted and smoked).

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Las Brisas Group

texts.es:
Este Banco Comunal se llama “Las Brisas” está conformado por 21 emprendedores quienes se dedican a diferentes rubros entre los cuales se encuentran; venta de ropa, venta de pan amasado, venta de mote con huesillo (bebida típica chilena para la temporada de verano), peluquería, venta de productos para el hogar, servicios entre otros. Todos ellos pertenecientes a la ciudad de Talca.
Monica, integrante del grupo del Banco Comunal, quien en la foto se encuentra de pie al medio de la foto, viste una polera de color beige, blue jeans, cartera de color negra, su cabello es de color castaño oscuro y lo usa suelto.
Ella se dedica  al a venta de helados y semillas de  maravilla, desde hace 2 años. Comenta que trabaja en su casa de lunes a domingo y de preferencia trabaja en la tarde.
La mercadería que va necesitando la compra en distribuidoras que se especializan en ventas de helados al por mayor a bajo costo, por lo tanto conveniente económicamente.
Con el crédito comprará semillas de maravilla y helados.
Una de las metas de Mónica es crecer dia dia en su negocio y tener un local más grande donde pueda a tender a su clientela de manera tranquila y vender más cosas.
Monica vive junto a su esposo y dos hijos de 16 y 9 años de edad. Sus sueños a nivel laboral tener un local mas grande, y a nivel familiar darles un buen pasar a sus hijos.
Ella está muy contenta y agradecida de la oportunidad brindada por Fondo Esperanza para invertir en su negocio. Respecto al grupo del Banco Comunal del cual forma parte, comenta que en éste existe muy buena comunicación. Por otro lado las capacitaciones le han servido para aprender nuevas estrategias de venta y contabilidad.
Talca pertenece a la región del Maule, ubicada en la zona centro del país. Constituye el centro administrativo, económico y cultural de la región, siendo la ciudad más importante del Valle Central chileno. Sobre Talca existe una curiosa referencia en Chile, la frase "Talca, París, y Londres". Entre los mitos al respecto, algunos dicen que es una derivación de la originalmente dicha por un inglés "Talca parece Londres", por la abundante neblina que cubre frecuentemente la ciudad en la temporada invernal, a semejanza de la capital del Reino Unido.
texts.en:
This communal bank, called Las Brisas, is made up of 21 entrepreneurs who are involved in different businesses, such as the sale of clothing, homemade bread, “mote con huesillo” (a traditional Chilean summer-time drink), hairdressing, home product sales and services, among others. All of the members come from the city of Talca.

Monica is the member of the communal bank who is seen standing in the middle of the photo, dressed in a beige top and blue jeans and holding a black purse. She has dark chestnut hair, which she wears loose.

Monica has been selling ice cream and “semillas de maravilla” (sunflower seeds), She works at home from Mondays to Sundays, preferably in the afternoons. She buys the merchandise she needs from distributors who specialize in selling ice cream wholesale at a low cost, so that it is economically feasible. She will use the loan to purchase sunflower seeds and ice cream.

One of Monica’s goals is to expand her business day by day and to have a larger place where she can comfortably wait on her customers and increase her sales.

Monica lives with her husband and two children, who are 16 and 9 years old. Her dreams relative to her business are to have a larger venue and with regard to her family are to provide a good life for her children. She is very happy and grateful for the opportunity that Fondo Esperanza is giving her to invest in her business.

Monica notes that she has very good communication with the members of her communal bank and that the training workshops have helped her learn new sales strategies and bookkeeping.

Talca is part of the Maule region, located in the center of the country. It constitutes the administrative, economical and cultural center of the region and is the most important city of Chile’s Valle Central. In Chile, Talca is referred to in the curious phrase: “Talca, Paris and London.” Some say that the phrase is a derivation of the saying, originally in English, that “Talca is like London” because of the abundant fog that frequently covers the city in the winter, similar to the capital of the United Kingdom.

loans.use: to purchase sunflower seeds and ice cream.

loans.name: Divino Niño Jesus Group

texts.es:
El comité Divino Niño Jesus se formó con la unión de varias vecinas de la ciudad de Mariano Roque Alonso. Las integrantes formaron un grupo muy unido y capaz de realizar conjuntamente actividades que fortalecen su compañerismo. Todas ellas son madres de familia que luchan por salir adelante.
Maria es parte de este grupo, ella se dedica a la venta de carbón, dice que le está yendo muy bien y que sus ventas están mejorando ya que el carbón es muy utilizado, pues el gas es muy caro. Empezó con muy poco sus ventas, al principio tenía pocas ventas, pero hoy, gracias a su trabajo y esfuerzo está saliendo adelante y creciendo y cada vez le va mejor.
Está pidiendo de este crédito para la compra de más carbón, con lo que podrá seguir trabajando y seguir teniendo los medios para poder ayudar a su familia.
texts.en: The committee Divino Niño Jesus was formed by several neighbors in the city of Mariano Roque Alonso. The members made a group that was very united and capable of taking on activities together that strengthen their camaraderie. They are all mothers in families that are fighting to advance. Maria is part of this group. She works selling coal. She says that it is going very well and that her sales are increasing because coal is widely-used and because gas is very expensive. Starting out, she had few sales, but today, thanks to her work and efforts, she is progressing and growing and it is better and better for her. She is asking for this loan to buy more coal. With this purchase, she can keep working and have the means to be able to help her family.

loans.use: to buy coal to sell.

loans.name: Mba'apora Group

texts.es:
El comité Mba'apora  se formó con la unión de varias vecinas de la ciudad de Mariano Roque Alonso. Son mujeres jefas de familia, que han visto una gran oportunidad para ellas y sus familias, y es por eso que se unieron para salir adelante y ayudar a sus familias.
Emerita es miembro de este grupo, ella vende helados desde hace un tiempo y dice que está creciendo gracias a su trabajo y su sacrificio. Gracias a la venta de sus helados está ayudando a su familia y les da todo lo que necesitan para tener una vida sin privaciones El sueño de ella es poder seguir creciendo e invertir más en su negocio para poder dando lo mejor a su familia.
Solicita de este crédito para la compra de helados de muchos sabores, ya que se acerca el calor y quiere poder tener un stock bien surtido para ofrecer a sus clientes.
texts.en:
The committee "Mba'apora" was formed out of a number of neighbors in the city of Mariano Roque Alonso. They are women who are heads of household who have seen a great opportunity for them and their families, which is why they got together in order to move forward and help their families. 

Emerita is a member of this group. She sells ice cream, which she has been doing for a while, and says that it is growing thanks to her work and sacrifice. Thanks to the sale of ice cream she is helping her family and gives them everything they need to live their lives without deprivation. Her dream is to be able to continue growing and invest more in her business in order to to be able to give her family the best. 

She is seeking this loan to purchase ice cream in many flavors since hot weather is coming up and she wants to be well-stocked with products to sell to her customers.

loans.use: to purchase ice cream for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to maintain his vehicle.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase metal supplies

loans.name: Hussein

texts.en: Hussein is a Lebanese single man. He’s 21 years old. He’s really attached to his parents and two siblings who are both working. Cooperating together, Hussein and his family are capable of covering their heavy expenses in order to live a respectable life. He started his business at an early age. He had to work really hard to take some responsibilities off his father. He has been working as a car mechanic in his own garage and has gained a fair number of customers asking for his services. He also visits them at their locations in case of big damages. Today, he’s asking for a youth loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to enlarge his business and buy new mechanic tools. He wishes to respond rapidly to his clients’ problems and he believes that acting properly is really essential to attract more customers.

loans.use: to buy new mechanic's tools

loans.name: Chadi

texts.en:
Chadi is a 30-year-old married man and father of three children.  He has been working in electronics repair for 14 years.  As with other Palestinian refugees in Lebanon, he has to start work early to help his family in their living. 

Chadi started his own business in 2007 and is thankful for what he has.  He likes his work a lot and has broad experience.  This is Chadi's fourth cycle borrowing from Al Majmoua.  He states that the previous loans helped him a lot in supporting his business and increasing his income.

In addition to the maintenance he does, he also sells satellite receivers and many other electrical items.  He hopes to continue expanding his business, to remain capable of raising his children in a suitable manner, and to providing them with the best education ever.  Today he is applying for a youth loan in order to buy special electronics.  He intends to use the spare parts to make requested maintenance.

loans.use: to buy special electronics for spare parts.

loans.name: Banco Mujer Shekhinná Group

texts.es:
Doña Hilda es la presidenta de Banco Mujer SheKhinná , con 38 años, es madre de 4 hijos y vive hace mas de 21 años con su compañero.  Ambos son agricultores y trabajan en una pequeña parcela propia, donde realizan actividades agropecuarias.  Ella dedica a la cría de pollos y su esposo se encarga de los cultivos. Estas actividades son las que generan ingresos para cubrir lo gastos básicos de la familia. Este es su tercer segundo crédito y el plan de inversión es la compra de pollos, alimentos, concentrados y vitaminas.
Doña Hilda busca aumentar sus ingresos mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia, y poder enviar a sus hijos a estudiar. Junto a Doña Hilda integran el grupo 6 socias mas que van a invertir en actividades agropecuarias y comerciales.
texts.en:
Doña Hilda is the president of Banco Mujer SheKhinná. At 38 years of age she is the mother of four children and has lived with her partner for over 21 years. They are both farmers and work on a small plot of land of their own where they carry out agricultural activities. She devotes herself to raising chickens and her husband is responsible for the crops. These are the activities by which they generate income for covering the basic necessities of the family. This is their second or third loan and they plan to invest in the purchase of chickens, feed, concentrate and vitamins. 

Doña Hilda seeks to increase her earnings to improve her family's quality of life and to be able to send her children away to school. Along with Doña Hilda the group is made up of six other members who will invest in agricultural and commercial activities.

loans.use: to purchase chicken, animal feed, concentrates and vitamins.

loans.name: Abdallah

texts.en: Abdallah is a 35-year-old Lebanese married man. He lives with his wife. They have two children attending school. He was working nights and days to be able to manage his family’s expenses and his business operations. Abdallah owns a small minimarket where he sells all kinds of dairy and daily products. He also sells gifts and toys to supplement his income.  He’s well known for being kind and friendly to his clients. Today, he’s asking for a loan from Kiva Partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase the needed quantity of food provisions in addition to a diverse quantity of toys and souvenirs. In that way, he will be able to increase his revenues, thus improving his way of living. He looks forward to expanding his grocery, waiting for the perfect time to open other branches and assign people to work with him.

loans.use: to purchase food provisions, toys and souveniers

loans.name: Alice

texts.en: Alice is 43 years old and lives in Congo Town.  She is married and has five children between the ages of 13 and 26.  All of them attend school.  For the past 18 years she has been operating a small shop where she sells charcoal and soap.  Sometimes she has fewer customers but most of the time she make a lot of profit.  She is requesting a loan to purchase more charcoal, soap, and other items.  In the future she hopes to expand her business into a big store.

loans.use: to purchase more charcoal, soap, and other items for her business.

loans.name: Edward

texts.en:
Edward is a 38-year-old businessman who has been selling motorcycle spare parts for the past two years.  He is married to his wife, Daisy, and they are blessed with one child.  He has a monthly income of 30,000 KES which he uses to support his family.

He is applying for his first loan term with KADET LTD after being introduced by an existing customer. Edward will use the loan to stock motorcycle spare parts in his shop.  With the anticipated income from the business he plans to open another shop for motorcycle spare parts.  His future dreams are to give a better quality education to his children and to improve his family’s living standard.

loans.use: to buy motorcycle spare parts.

loans.name: Teresia

texts.en:
Teresia, a 33-year-old business lady, is married to Simon and the mother of four children. She has been running a boutique shop for the past two years, earning a monthly income of Kes 50,000.

Tersia is applying for her first loan term with KADET LTD after being introduced to the organization by an existing customer. She plans to use it to purchase more new clothes such as ladies' dresses, blouses, etc. to maximize her profits during this festive season. She will use those profits to educate her children.

Her future dreams are to own a big boutique shop in Thika Town.

loans.use: To purchase more new clothes like ladies' dresses, blouses, etc.

loans.name: Mwanasiti

texts.en:
Mwanasiti is undoubtedly an admirable person. She always has a smile and she is characterized by her happiness. She is described as a patient, humble, and hard-working person. She puts a lot of trust in her work and her desire to get ahead. She loves her entire family and works hard to see them always happy. She runs a cosmetic shop and a boutique.

The loan Mwanasiti is requesting is from Yehu Microfinance Trust. With it, she will buy cosmetics, like perfumes, body creams, and facial creams. For Mwanasiti, this is a way to continue moving forward and to help her family; it is an opportunity for personal and familial growth. It is for this reason that Mwanasiti is very joyful in her work and desires to better the quality of life for her whole family.

Mwanasiti's dream is to be able to have her own sufficient space where she can sell all of her products and diversify her merchandise. With the revenue generated, she can improve her home and give her children an education.

Mwanasiti has a lot of faith in God and she is convinced that, with hard work and love, her dream will come true.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics, like perfumes, body creams, and facial creams for her business.

loans.name: Irma Raquel

texts.es:
La señora Irma Raquel es viuda, su esposo era dueño de un carro taxi del cual ella se esta haciendo cargo. Contrato a una persona como chofer quien es quien trabaja el taxi y las ganancias son para ella. 
Esta solicitando un préstamo ya que tiene que darle mantenimiento y comprar algunas partes del auto que necesita, pero no cuenta con el dinero necesario para realizar el mantenimiento y comprar lo que el carro necesita para que siga funcionando.
La señora Irma Raquel vive sola tiene dos hijas quienes ya están casados y tiene su propia familia, le ayudan en las gastos económicos de la señora Irma.
Con las ganancias que obtiene del taxi es para pagar el crédito. Desea seguir teniendo su carro taxi y así poder seguir ayudando a la persona quien le trabaja.
texts.en:
Irma Raquel is a widow. Her husband owned a taxi cab, which she is now taking charge of. She hired a person as a chauffeur. This person works in the taxi and the income is for her. She is applying for a loan because she needs to do some maintenance and buy some parts for the car, but she doesn't have the money she needs to do the maintenance and buy the parts that the car needs to keep running. 
Irma Raquel lives alone. She has two daughters who are already married and have their own families. They help her with her expenses. She will pay off the loan with the income she gets from the taxi. She hopes to keep her taxi cab and that way continue to help the person who works for her.

loans.use: to maintain the taxi.

loans.name: Mi Bendicion Group

texts.es: El banco comunal mi Bendición está conformado por 8 integrantes mujeres, madres solteras, responsables de 15 hijos menores de edad. Ella son originarias del  Sauce lugar que está ubicado en la zona de norte del país. El sauce se cacteriza por ser una zona productora de los derivados de la leche. Y la crianza de cerdos, gallinas, ganado. Las integrantes del banco se conocen entre sí se apoyan mutuamente en sus diferentes actividades económicas las cuales decidieron apoyarse para beneficiarse  con el financiamiento. Alba es la coordinadora del banco la cual se encarga de la responsabilidad del banco y sus cuotas en tiempo y forma. Ella tiene por actividad económica la venta de mercadería en general la cual consisten en compra y venta de ropa como pantalones, faldas, vestidos, camisetas, ropa interior, ropa de cama, piyamas. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio en la compra y venta de mercadería para aprovechar las mejores ventas del ano. El banco comunal mi Bendición agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva les brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
The communal bank Mi Bendición is made up of 8 women, single mothers, responsible for 15 minor children. They are originally from El Sauce which is a municipality in the northern part of the country. El Sauce is known as a dairy area, and also for raising pigs, chickens and cattle. The members of the bank are known to support each other in their various financial activities, helping each other to benefit from the funding.

Alba is the coordinator of the bank and it is her responsibility as the one in charge of the bank to collect payments in a timely way. Her financial activity is the sale of general merchandise which consists of buying and selling clothing such as pants, skirts, dresses, shirts, underwear, bed linens, and pajamas.

The purpose of the loan is to have working capital for investing to supply her business for buying and selling the merchandise to take advantage of the best sales of the year. The communal bank Mi Bendición is grateful for the support of the Kiva loaners that support people who have scarce resources and poor countries such as Nicaragua to have a decent working environment.

loans.use: to have working capital to supply her business so she can buy and sell merchandise such as pants, skirts, dresses, shirts, underwear, bed linens, and pajamas.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize and sorghum.

loans.name: Saye

texts.fr:
Madame Saye commerçante depuis plus de 10ans est une femme mariée et mère de famille qui travaille pour améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille. Son activité consiste à vendre des légumes (choux, carottes, oignons) dans le marché local. Elle commence sa journée à 8h et la termine à 14h.
Saye est une brave femme qui appuie son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille. Comme ambition elle désire voir son capital augmenter afin de mieux appuyer  son mari dans les charges de la famille.
texts.en:
Ms. Saye, a merchant for over ten years, is a married woman and a mother with a family. She works to improve her family's living conditions. Her business involves selling vegetables (cabbage, carrots, onions) at a local market. She starts her day at 8 AM and ends at 2 PM.

Ms. Saye is a good and honest woman who supports her husband in covering day-to-day family expenses. Her ambition is to see her capital increase, so as to help her husband further with the expenses.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables (cabbage, carots, onions) to resell

loans.name: El Mantial Del Pariachi Group

texts.es: Este es el Grupo “El Manantial del Pariachi” que conforman 08 socios que se dedican a diversas actividades de comercio la gran mayoría de ellos vecinos de la zona y pasan al ciclo 03. Julia tiene 35 años, casada con 01hijo en etapa escolar, forma parte de la directiva y es la que preside al Grupo. Desde hace 10 años Julia tiene un restaurante donde ofrece comida a la carta, comida criolla, ceviche y gaseosas, cuenta con clientes fidelizados. Julia solicito el préstamo para la compra de gaseosas, pescados y arroz. Su mayor sueño es de ampliar más su negocio y así poder atender mejor a sus clientes. Julia esta agradecida con los inversionistas Kiva por permitirle seguir creciendo su negocio. Julia se encuentra ubicada en la parte de atrás es la segunda del lado izquierdo, viste polo negro.
texts.en: This is the "El Manantial del Pariachi" group which is made up of eight members who make a living in a variety of businesses.  Most of them live in the same neighborhood.  Julia is 35 years old and has a school aged child.  She is the head of the group.  For the last ten years, Julia has had a restaurant where she offers food a la carte, creole, ceviche, and sodas.  She relies on her loyal customer base.  Julia is seeking this loan to purchase soda, fish, and rice.  Her greatest wish is to improve her business so that she can better serve her customers.  Julia is very grateful for Kiva investors because it allows her to continue growing her business.  In the photo, Julia is in the back and third from the left wearing a black shirt.

loans.use: To purchase soda, fish, and rice.

loans.name: Eman

texts.en:
Eman is a conservative person who prefers not to have her photo published online, so her husband Sharef appears in her Kiva profile photo.  The photo is in their grocery store.

Eman is a 22-year-old young married women. She has five children:  three boys and two girls.  Eman and her husband live with their children in a small house in Jabalia camp. Her husband is employed with a low salary. This wage barely covers the family needs. They receive additional income from a small grocery store they have owned for the past two years.  It is considered as a successful business but needs more liquidity to bring more stock to resell. 

Eman took a USD youth loan from Kiva partner FATEN to develop the family business. This loan will help them to buy more products for the store such as dairy products, canned food, cooking oil and rice.  This will increase sales and improve the family's income positively.

loans.use: to buy more grocery products to sell in their store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to market his insurance company

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
Magarita, de 54 años de edad, es una mujer trabajadora y dinámica, además de alegre y sociable, es conviviente de Gabriel quien es transportista y padre de su hija quien ya es independiente. Juntos habitan cómodamente su propia casa. La actividad que realiza Magarita es la venta de bebidas gasificadas, para lo cual cuenta con una congeladora en su propia casa, en donde puede guardar su producto a la temperatura que le agrada a su público consumidor,  quienes compran a diario.  Dedicándose a dicha actividad hace más de10 años,  cuenta con la ayuda de su hija cuando la vista  para la venta del producto a los clientes.
Lo que le gusta de su actividad es el ingreso económico que le genera, y puede apoyar a su familia con algunos gastos, también le gusta el tiempo libre que tiene y lo puede usar en otras actividades. 
Por el contrario, lo que no le gusta es que algunos de sus clientes ya estando ebrios se vuelven algo faltosos. Por otro lado, comenta que en ésta actividad no se pierde por ser un producto de bastante consumo, en toda actividad social siempre tiene demanda, por eso tiene planes de hacer crecer su negocio  y donde atender a los clientes. Por tanto éste será el préstamo número 03 con la institución MFP, se siente agradecida con el crédito recibido, para continuar con su negocio, desea seguir contando con mas créditos,  por eso se compromete a ser puntual en el pago de sus cuotas. Además de sentirse a gusto con su banco comunal, pues  considera a sus miembros ser personas comprometidas con sus obligaciones y solidarias.
Con el monto solicitado de 1200 nuevos soles, lo invertirá en la compra de su mercadería como bebidas gasificadas en variados sabores y marcas, buscando precios bajos por el volumen de sus compras, de esa manera espera aumentar su margen de ganancias.
texts.en:
Margarita, 54, is a hard-working and dynamic woman, as well as joyful and friendly. She lives with Gabriel, who is a truck driver, and the father of her daughter, who is now independent. They live comfortably together in their own house. Margarita sells soft drinks, for which she has a freezer in her own home, where she can keep her product at a temperature that her customers like. They buy from her every day. She has been working in this business for more than ten years. When her daughter visits, she has her help to sell the product to the customers. 
What she likes about her job is the income that she makes, and that she can support her family with some earnings. She also likes the free time that she has and can use for other activities. On the other hand, what she doesn't like is that some customers, already being drunk, become somewhat disrespectful. She says that in this business, one can't lose, because it's a highly-consumed product. It is in demand at every social activity. This is why she has plans to expand her both her business and the place where she serves her customers. This will be her third loan from MFP. Margarita is grateful for the loan to continue with her business. She wants to continue receiving more loans. This is why she is committed to making her payments on time. 
She also feels very content in her communal bank, because she considers the members to be supportive and committed to their responsibilities. With the amount she applied for, 1200 nuevos soles, she will invest in purchasing merchandise like soft drinks of various flavors and brands, looking for low prices for the volume of her purchases. This way, she hopes to increase her profit margin.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks of different flavors and brands.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter used his previous loan of 30,000 KES to boost his building supply business and this increased his monthly income from 64,000 KES to 80,000 KES. He says that he is happy with the progress of his business, although he has not reached his target. 

Peter is currently borrowing a loan of 65,000 KES which he intends to use to purchase for the business more stocks of building materials like bricks, iron sheets, glass, timber, etc. He plans to venture into another business with the anticipated profit from this business.

loans.use: to purchase for his building supply business more bricks, iron sheets, glass, timber, etc.

loans.name: Matogo

texts.en:
Thanks for the previous loan that helped her clear school fees for her son.

Matogo is still running her food stall, which she manages so diligently, as it has given her good results. She does not want to stop working so that she can be able to continue providing her family with basic needs. With this new loan, she will be able to buy ingredients for her food stall such as wheat flour, cooking oil, rice, beans and food flavorings. This way, she is assured of maintaining her customers as well as attracting more.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food stall such as wheat flour, cooking oil, rice, beans and food flavorings.

loans.name: Flora

texts.en:
Flora is 48 years old and lives in the town of Ntungamo in the Mbarara region of Uganda. She is widowed and has four children who are all currently in school. For the past 14 years, Flora has been working hard to manage her retail shop/bar in which sells sugar, salt and cooking oil. 

To help expand her business, Flora has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to increase stock of essential commodities such as milk, cooking oil, sugar and beer in order to attract more customers. It will help Flora to generate greater profits and pay school fees for her children. Flora hopes that in the future she will be able to expand her business into a wholesale shop. 

Flora is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Flora who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans but have businesses that have grown too large for micro-loans.

loans.use: to increase stock of essential commodities such as milk, cooking oil, sugar and beer.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize and sorghum.

loans.name: Evyonne

texts.en: Evyonne is 27 years old and lives in Montserrado County that has the largest Freeport in Liberia. She has been selling in one of the well-known markets that are located in Congo Town. She is married with two children, ages three and nine, that are attending school; all of them live at home. She has been selling rice, pepper, oil, soft drinks, water, beer, etc. for the past seven years. She started this business with money given to her by her husband, and she learned this business from her friends. Her favorite part about her business is that it has paid her children's school fees. She is requesting a loan to purchase more ice, pepper, oil, soft drinks, water and beer for her business. In the future, she wants to buy a piece of land and build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more ice, pepper,oil, soft drinks, water and beer for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize and sorghum.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a 34-year-old business lady with three children. Her husband works as a mason.

Four years ago, she established a business selling clothing, with which she wanted to help her husband with the daily expenses. Her business is located on the outskirts of the town and her main customers are women and men. Working 7 days a week and 10 hours a day, she has been dedicated to her business which she loves.

She has shown desire to achieve her goals through hard work. She requested a loan with hopes that this loan will increase her stock and maximize her profits. 

In the future, she plans to move from an open kiosk to a concrete shop. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to add stock of clothing to sell.

loans.name: Archil

texts.en:
Archil is 35 years old. He lives with his mother in a small village of Gardabani district. 

Archil is involved in agricultural activities. In particular, they have four milk cows and two calves. His mother produces dairy products. Archil brings the products to the capital city with his own car and sells them there. He is a very hardworking man and has a rich experience in his business. 

Archil requested a loan for purchasing calves. After purchasing additional calves, he will expand the livestock and thus the dairy business. This will increase the income of the family. With increased income, they will improve their living conditions. Archil awaits your support.

loans.use: to purchase calves.

loans.name: Alfred

texts.en:
Alfred is 35 years old, married, and blessed with two children aged five and two years.  He hawks fresh milk within the Kapsabet area and he has been doing this for a period of five years, earning a monthly income of Kes 18,000. 

He is currently servicing his sixth loan from KADET LTD after repaying the previous ones successfully. He intends to use this amount to pay milk suppliers and transport costs.  He anticipates profits which he plans to use to repay the loan and expand his business.  

He hopes to prosper in business and improve the living standards of his family.

loans.use: To pay the milk suppliers

loans.name: Evenecer Group

texts.es: El banco comunal Evenecer está conformado por 9 integrantes, madres solteras, con 15 hijos bajo su responsabilidad. Estas mujeres son originarias del  Sauce, lugar que está ubicado en la zona norte del país. Ellas han demostrado su responsabilidad, sus ganas de superación, su buen trabajo en equipo ya que se ayudan mutuamente en sus diferentes negocios. Gloria es la coordinadora del banco la cual se encarga realizar los pagos en tiempo y forma. Ella tiene por actividad económica la compra y venta de cerdos. El negocio lo tiene ubicado en su casa de habitación. La rutina de Gloria es salir tres veces por semana a compra cerdos en pie para la venta. El objetivó del prestamos es comprar un lote de cerdos que son lo están ofreciendo a buen precio y de dicha forma aprovechar las ventas de la temporada navideña. El banco comunal  Evenecer agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva les brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
The "Evenecer" communal bank is made up of nine members—all single mothers—who are responsible for a total of 15 children. These women are natives of Sauce, a place that is located in the northern part of the country. They have demonstrated their responsibility, their desire to better themselves, and their teamwork; they mutually help each other in their different businesses. 

Gloria is the coordinator of the communal bank and in charge of making their payments on time and according to the loan terms. She earns her living buying and selling pigs. Her business is located at her house. Gloria's routine is to go out three times a week to buy live pigs to sell. 

The objective of this loan is to buy a parcel of pigs that are being offered at a good price so she can take advantage of Christmas season sales opportunities. 

The "Evenecer" communal bank is grateful for the help that the Kiva lenders have provided to low-income people in poor countries like Nicaragua, so that they can have a decent means of earning a living.

loans.use: to have working capital and to buy a parcel of live pigs to sell.

loans.name: Bayo Aurore Clotilde's Group

texts.fr: Il s'agit d'un groupe composé de deux femmes en caution solidaire. Agée de 39ans, Clotilde la responsable est divorcée et mère de trois enfants scolarisés. L'aîné et le benjamin ont respectivement 20ans et 09ans. Spécialisée dans la vente des parfums, des souffres, des calebasses, des cauris, des bouteilles et d'autres articles depuis quelques années, elle s'approvisionne dans l'un des marchés du Bénin. Soucieuse de renforcer son pouvoir d'achat et de combler les attentes de ses clients, elle a sollicité et obtenu un concours financier à Finadev. Le bénéfice généré par ce concours financier lui permettra de supporter la scolarisation de ses enfants et les charges de la famille. Bayo Clotilde se retrouve à gauche de la photo.
texts.en:
This is a group composed of two women who mutually guarantee one another. Clotilde, aged 39, is the official of the group. She is a divorced mother of three children, who are in school. The oldest and the youngest are 20 and 9 years old, respectively. Specialized in selling perfumes, sulfur, calabashes, cowrie shells, bottles, and other items for several years, she gets her supplies from one of the markets in Benin. 

Concerned about bolstering her buying power and fulfilling the expectations of her customers, she requested and obtained financial assistance from Finadev. The profits generated by this assistance will enable her to help cover her children's schooling costs and the family expenses.

Bayo Clotilde is on the left in the photo.

loans.use: to purchase empty bottles, perfume, earthen jars, and sulfur

loans.name: Gela

texts.en:
Gela is 44 years-old, married and lives with his wife and four minor children. Several times, he has requested loans from local financial institutions for his trading business start-up, but without any success. His loan requests were rejected each time because of low income and the family’s poor living conditions. The only source of income for the family is the small monthly salary earned by Gela working as a miner. As well, Gela’s wife gets a relevant pension from the local government as she is a mother of many children. The income is enough only for food for the six member family. 

Therefore, Gela and his wife requested a loan from Credo to start a clothing sales business. His loan request was approved in the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisions the provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with reasonable conditions for the country's rural poor who do not have access to credit products, being regarded as “high-risk borrowers” because of low income. Gela will purchase clothes at wholesale prices and resell them in his district for a profit. It will be hard work for Gela and his wife, but according to estimates, their business will be profitable and will increase the income of the family. The increased profit will be reinvested in the clothing trading business to increase the stock and sales volume. Gela’s family will be able to increase their spending to satisfy their daily needs and improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase clothing to resell.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth, 39, she is a hard working mother that has been managing her business for the past nine years.  She lives with her husband and children at the Congo town community. Her children are between the ages of 17 and 20 and are in school.  Elizabeth stopped her education in the 9th grade.

She has a table in the market where she sells tissues, body cream, bath soap, washing soap, bread, mayonnaise and many other items.  She sells from 9am to 5pm.  She received help from her husband to start in this business and she learned to sell from her mother.  Elizabeth use commercial vehicles to transport her goods to her business area.

She thanks the lenders for the support they are giving towards her business.  She has requested a loan to purchase more bath soap, washing soap, tissue, body cream and bread for the business and her dream is to become a big business woman.

loans.use: to purchase more bath soap, washing soap, tissue, body cream and bread, for the business.

loans.name: Hanna

texts.en:
Hanna is a 45-year-old unmarried woman, who has been working in her own grocery store since six years ago. She like her work and puts much effort into improving it and expanding it as much as she can. Hanna is applying for her first loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua in order to increase her merchandise with new released goods and special offer products that will increase income and improve her standard of living.

Hanna is well known in the region with her good reputation and special customer service. That's why she puts so much effort on pleasing customers as much as she can.

She hopes that one day she will be capable of expanding her small shop to a large supermarket.

loans.use: to increase her merchandise with new released goods and special offer products that will increase income.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize and sorghum.

loans.name: Charity

texts.en:
Charity is 26 years old and lives in the town of Ntungamo in the Mbarara region of Uganda. She is married and has one child who is currently in school. 

For the past four years, Charity has been working hard to manage her bar, which sells drinks such as lemonade, spirits, wine and beer. 

To help expand her business, Charity has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more drinks such as lemonade, spirits, wine and beer for resale, and will help Charity to generate greater profits and take good care of herself. Charity hopes that in the future, she will be able to expand the business into a bar and lodging. 

Charity is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Charity who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more drinks such as lemonade, spirits, wine and beer for resale.

loans.name: Afi Danielle's Group

texts.fr: Ce groupe est composé de deux membres en caution solidaire. Afi Danielle, la responsable est âgée 28ans. Mariée et mère de deux enfants scolarisés. Le plus âgé et le moins âgé ont respectivement 8ans et 5ans. Elle vend des produits de la mercerie depuis quelques années puis fait ses approvisionnements dans l'un des marchés du Bénin. Dans le souci d'accroître son chiffre d'affaire et de répondre favorablement à la demande de ses clients, elle a sollicité et a obtenu un financement auprès de Finadev en vue de maximiser son intérêt et de participer à la scolarisation de ses enfants. Afi Danielle se retrouve à gauche de la photo.
texts.en:
This group is composed of two members who guarantee one another in solidarity. Afi Danielle, the group's official, is 28 years old, married, and the mother of two children, both in school. The oldest and the youngest are 8 and 5 years old, respectively. Afi Danielle has been selling sewing supplies for a few years, and she gets her supplies from one of the markets in Benin. 

Concerned about increasing her sales and responding favorably to customer demands, she requested and obtained financing from Finadev with the aim of making the best of her investments and helping to cover her children's schooling costs. 

Afi Danielle is on the left in the photo.

loans.use: to purchase thread, poplin, and zippers

loans.name: Yudy

texts.es: Yudy  de 47 años de edad vive al sur de la ciudad con su esposo y su hija de 16 años de edad, con quien sueña ver convertida en una profesional exitosa. Yudy antes de iniciar su negocio vivió durante 1 año  en Estados Unidos. Con su trabajo persistente logró ahorrar y también empezó a vender mercancías desde ese país; cuando regresó a Colombia   continuó esta actividad comercial pues contaba con un importante número de clientes en Sincelejo,  ciudad   ubicada en la Costa Caribe también.  Poco a poco fue fortaleciendo a un mas su negocio y hoy ha logrado sostenerlo y genera mas ingresos con los cuales ayuda al   bienestar de su hogar. Sus principales clientes son empleados de empresas públicas y privadas, que conocen su sistema de venta a crédito y forman parte de una saludable cartera de crédito. En la actualidad los pedidos son superiores a su capacidad de respuesta oportuna y esta es la razón por la cual acude a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprará blusas, suéteres, bolsos, perfumería y pantalones, que hagan lucir elegante  a la  clientela y a su familia,  en las navidades y el año nuevo, donde esperan lucirse con su elegancia y distinción, para esperar el 2013 con mucha felicidad y unidad en su hogar.
texts.en:
Yudy, 47, lives in the southern part of the city with her husband and her 16-year-old daughter, who she dreams of seeing as a successful professional. Before she started her business, Yudy lived for a year in the United States. With her hard work, she was able to save and she began to sell merchandise from that country. When she returned to Colombia, she continued this activity because she had a large number of customers in Sincelejo, a city also located on the Caribbean coast. Little by little, she went strengthening her business and today she has been able to maintain it and generate more income with which she contributes to the wellbeing of her home. Her main customers are employees of private and public businesses, who are familiar with her system of selling on credit and are part of a healthy loan portfolio. 
Currently, her orders are greater than her ability to fill them in a timely manner. This is why she is applying for a Kiva loan. This is the first round of financing from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. She will buy blouses, sweaters, handbags, perfumes, and pants, which will make her family and her customers look elegant for Christmas and the New Year, when they hope to show off their elegance and distinction and to await 2013 with plenty of happiness and unity in her home.

loans.use: to buy blouses, sweaters, handbags, perfumes, and pants.

loans.name: Shorena

texts.en:
Shorena is 29 years old and lives with her two children in Kutaisi. Several times, she has requested loans from local financial institutions for her hair care business start-up but without any success. Her loan requests were rejected each time because of low income and the family’s poor living conditions. The only source of income for the family is the small monthly salary earned by Shorena working as a waitress at the local café. Total average monthly income is 200 GEL, which is enough only for food for a three member family. 

She requested a loan from Credo to start a beauty salon. Her loan request was approved in the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisions the provision of a business start-up and re-start-up credits with reasonable conditions for the country's rural poor who do not have access to credit products since they are regarded as “high-risk borrowers” because of low income. Shorena will purchase equipment for her beauty salon and start up a hair care business. She will work as a stylist, and according her estimations, the business will be profitable and will increase the income of the family. The increased profit will be reinvested in the same business. Her family will be able to increase their spending to satisfy their daily needs and improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase beauty salon equipment and start up a hair care business.

loans.name: Mai

texts.en: Mai, 31, lives in Paynesville South. She is married, with a son who is 8 years old and is attending school. Her husband is a driver. Mai is a hardworking mother who has been involved in the sales of clothing for the past nine years. She sells imported ladies'  blouses and men's shirts. She started first in this business with goods that she received from her sister from the United States. She sells from 8 a.m. to 6 p.m.  Because of the quality material that she sells, she makes a profit every day. She uses the profit to improve the business and help with the expenses of the home. She uses a commercial vehicle to transport her goods. She thanks the lenders for their support of her business. She has requested this loan to purchase more imported ladies' blouses and men's shirts. Her dream for the future is to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more imported ladies' blouses and men's shirts to increase her sales

loans.name: Beldinah

texts.en:
Beldinah is 52 years old, married to Maxwel and a mother of four children. She knits sweaters (cardigans) and sells shoes at a bus station in Nairobi. She has been in the business for six years now and gets a monthly income of 15,000 Kenyan Shillings. 

This will be Beldinah’s second loan with KADET and she plans to use the entire loan to buy shoes for resale and also wool for knitting more sweaters. She plans to use the profits to expand her business.

In the future, she wants to open a wholesale shop to sell her products.

loans.use: To buy wool for knitting sweaters and also to buy shoes for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more clothes for resale.

loans.name: Elvira

texts.es: Elvira de 36 años de edad se dedica al comercio de mercancía variada, ofrecida mediante guías especializadas de productos, que le provee una empresa a la cual se encuentra afiliada. Su experiencia data de hace 2 años cuando inició con el fin de apoyar los gastos de su hogar y lograr un mayor  bienestar  especialmente a su madre en su ancianidad. Los productos que más ofrece son la ropa interior y la exterior, en la cual se ha especializado y vende a su clientela conformada por vecinos, familiares y amigos, además de los referidos que estos le han suministrado. Sus compras las realiza de contado y sus ventas las hace a crédito principalmente; con la recuperación hace sus compras usualmente, pero en las temporadas donde se incrementa el volumen de ventas como las de fin de año, su mayor desafío es tener el capital de trabajo suficiente,  para responder a los pedidos de su clientela, vender mas y ganar mucho mas. Esta es la razón por la cual acude a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprará ropa interior y exterior, que son sus principales pedidos porque sus clientela y su familia quiere lucir elegantes para recibir la navidad y el año nuevo que se acerca.
texts.en:
Elvira, 36, makes a living selling a variety of merchandise through specialized product catalogs with which she's affiliated.  She has two years of experience, dating from when she needed to support the household expenses and achieve greater well-being, especially for her mother in her old age.  The products she sells most are clothing and underwear, her specialties.  Her customers are her neighbors, family members, and friends, in addition to referrals from them.

She makes her purchases in cash and sells mainly on credit.  She usually makes her purchases once she is repaid.  When volume is up such as at the end of the year, though, her greatest challenge is to have sufficient working capital to fulfill her customers' orders, sell more, and earn a lot more.

This is why she's applying for a Kiva loan, her first financing from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.  She's going to buy underwear and clothing, which are her main orders because her customers and their families want to look elegant when they celebrate Christmas and New Year, which are approaching.

loans.use: to buy clothing and underwear

loans.name: La Inmaculada Concepcion Group

texts.es: Este es el Grupo “La Inmaculada Concepción” que conforman 06 mujeres emprendedoras que se dedican a diversas áreas de trabajo, que pasan al ciclo 25. Victoria tiene 42 años, casada con 04 hijos de las cuales 02 de ellos en etapa escolar. Victoria se dedica a la venta de comida variada en su casa, cuenta con clientes fidelizados. Victoria solicito el préstamo para la compra de mesas, sillas, cocina de 02 hornillas, para ampliar su negocio. Su sueño es poder terminar construir su casa para que sus hijos tengan mejor calidad de vida. Victoria está muy contenta con este préstamo y agradece a los inversionistas Kiva. Victoria se encuentra ubicada adelante es la primera del lado izquierdo, viste polo celeste y pantalón azul marino.
texts.en:
This is the group "La Inmaculada Concepción" (The Immaculate Conception), made up of six enterprising women who work in different sectors. They are on their 25th loan cycle.

Victoria, 42, is married with four children, two of whom are school-aged. Victoria works selling assorted dishes in her home. She has loyal customers. She is applying for the loan to buy tables, chairs, and a two-burner stove to expand her business. Her dream is to finish building her house so that her children have a better quality of life. She is very happy with this loan and thanks the Kiva lenders. Victoria is the first person on the left, dressed in a light blue shirt and navy blue pants.

loans.use: to buy tables, chairs, and a two-burner stove.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.en:
Nancy is 23 years old and single; she stopped her education at 8th grade. She has two children, ages 4 and 6, that are in school and live at home.

For the past two years she has been running a shop where she sells rice, pepper, oil, vita, salt and onions in the local market. Sometimes she has fewer customers, but most of the time she makes a lot of money.

She is requesting a loan to purchase more rice, pepper, oil, vita, salt and onions for her business. In the future, she plans to send her children to school until they finish college.

loans.use: to purchase more rice, pepper, oil, vita, salt and onions for her business.

loans.name: Edith

texts.en: Edith is 20 years old and lives in Congo Town. She stopped her education in the 11th grade. She is single and has two children, ages 2 and 5. Only one is in school, and they both live at home. For the past four years, Edith has been selling fish She started this business with money given to her by her mother. The business has allowed her to save more money, since she has more customers. She is requesting a loan to buy more fish for her business. Her plan is to build a house.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell in her business.

loans.name: Tabu

texts.en: Tabu is 40 years old, married, and has 2 children. She started her business of selling women's and children's clothes five years ago. Tabu's husband is a fisherman. With their combined income, they plan to build a house of their own, since they rent the house they currently live in. At the present time, Tabu needs money in order to buy new things to sell. To pay for these purchases, she would like a loan in the amount of KES 25,000. Tabu's customers are very satisfied and think of her as a scrupulous and honest woman.

loans.use: to buy more clothing for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizers for cultivating maize and sorghum.

loans.name: Nazi

texts.en:
Nazi is 30 years old. She lives with her husband and two children in a small village in Gardabani district.

Nazi is involved in agricultural activities. In particular, she has milk cows and produces dairy products. Her husband brings the products to the capital city with his own car and sells them there. Nazi is a very hardworking woman and has a rich experience in her business. 

Nazi requested a loan for purchasing calves. After purchasing additional calves, she will expand the livestock and thus the dairy business. This will increase the income of the family. With increased income, they will improve their living conditions. Nazi awaits your support.

loans.use: to purchase additional calves.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to replace ceramic tile.

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en:
Lilian is 34 years-old and lives in the town of Mbarara in the Mbarara region of Uganda. She is married and has one child who is currently in school. For the past 10 years, Lilian has been working hard to manage her retail shop, which sells sugar, salt and cooking oil. 

To help expand her business, Lilian has requested a loan of 2000,000 Ugandan Shillings from Kiva partner BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to increase the availability of essential commodities such as milk, cooking oil, sugar and salt in order to attract more customers. This will help Lilian to generate greater profits, improve her business and add other different products. Lilian hopes that in the future she will be able to expand business into a larger scale. 

Lilian is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Lilian who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to increase availability of essential commodities such as milk, cooking oil, sugar and salt in order to attract more customers.

loans.name: Mansura

texts.en:
To support the family income, Mansura is involved in agriculture: animal husbandry and poultry. Owing to the loans from Kiva partner VFAC she can increase and expand her activities to four cows, four calves and 40 turkeys. Mansura's profession is a teacher, she works at the local school  and earns 150 AZN salary. She lives with her family which includes two children, her husband and mother-in-law which are pensioners. With their help she sells milk products, eggs and turkeys. 

Mansura has applied for this loan to buy home furniture. This will help increase her and the children's well-being and improve housing conditions.

loans.use: to buy home furniture.

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en:
Lilian is now 32 years old, still happily married to her husband and taking care of her family of five children. She is still selling new clothes and her income has now increased from Kes 10,000 to Kes 25,000.

She has requested her fourth loan from KADET LTD after she repaid the previous ones successfully. She intends to use this amount to purchase more new clothes for resale during this Christmas festive season when sales are normally high.  She anticipates getting some profits which she plans to use to expand her business. 

She would like to educate her children to higher levels.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes.

loans.name: Purity

texts.en:
Purity used her previous loan to increase her inventory of tea leaves, sugar, and soft drinks for her business. That prior loan enabled her to increase her monthly income from 15,000 KES to 20,000 KES.

She is now seeking a loan in the amount of 80,000 KES, which she intends to use to add more inventory for the shop and to purchase maize for re-sale. She plans to open an M-pesa shop with the anticipated profits generated from the business as a result of the loan. Her dream is to own her own wholesale shop.

loans.use: To continue to expand and improve her business by purchasing additional inventory (e.g., tea leaves, sugar, soft drinks, and maize).

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is 31-year-old single woman residing in the small town of Msambweni, which is well-known for its artisans. This place is visited by many domestic and foreign tourists. Mariam lives alone in a rental house.

Like other responsible ladies, she decided to start a business of selling second-hand clothes at the market. She sells clothing for men and women, which allows her to pay her expenses as well as to help her parents. Mariam has been in this business for five years. Each week she travels to the city to buy clothes to bring back to Msambweni, where she makes all of her daily sales.

Maríam is requesting a loan because she wants to buy a large quantity of second-hand clothing so that she can improve her sales and also take advantage of this festive season.

loans.use: to expand and improve her business by purchasing a large quantity of second-hand clothes for re-sale purposes

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizers for the cultivation of maize and sorghum.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize and sorghum.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is 32 years old and lives in the town of Lyantonde in the Mbarara region of Uganda. She is married and has 2 children who are currently in school. For the past 4 years Rose has been working hard to manage her small business, which sells fresh food. 

To help expand her business, Rose has requested a loan of 2000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more fresh fish for reselling, and will help Rose to generate greater profits to pay school fees and cover her family's basic needs. Rose hopes that in the future she will be able to own the biggest fish selling market. 

Rose is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Rose who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more fresh fish for reselling.

loans.name: Abigail

texts.en:
Abigail is 24 years old and lives in Congo town. She is single and has two children, who are 4 and 6 years old. Her children attend school and live at home.

For the past two years, she has been running a small shop to earn a living. At her shop she sells goods and food items such as charcoal, oil, biscuits, candy, groundnuts, rice, and soap. She explains that she started this business with money given to her by her then-husband, and that the business forces her to save more money for her family.

She is now requesting a loan to purchase more charcoal, oil, biscuits, candy, groundnuts, rice, and soap for her business. In the future, she plans to build a house and to expand her business.

loans.use: to expand and improve her business by purchasing additional inventory (e.g., charcoal, oil, biscuits, candy, groundnuts, rice, and soap) for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize and sorghum.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel is still taking care of his wife and five children and he is happy that he is able to provide for their needs. His butcher business is also doing well and his income has increased from Kes 30,000 to Kes 35,000.

He is currently borrowing his second term loan from KADET LTD after he repaid the previous one. He intends to use this amount to purchase more livestock for slaughter as the Christmas season is approaching and the festivities also mean that his business is at its peak. The profits he earns will be used to expand his business and to repay the loan.  

He wishes to be self sustaining and expand his business further.

loans.use: to purchase livestock for slaughter.

loans.name: Martin

texts.en:
Martin is 59 years old, married, and blessed with seven children between the ages of 35 and 16 years old. He owns a tailoring shop in the Kapsabet area where his business has been in operation for over 20 years, earning him a monthly income of 25,000 KES.

He is serving his first term loan of 100,000 KES from KADET, and he intends to purchase textile materials of different textures to make clothes for resale.  The profits he earns will be used to educate his children who are in school and add more stock to his business.

He hopes to educate his children to greater levels.

loans.use: To purchase textile materials.

loans.name: Mahdi

texts.en: Mahdi is a 26-year-old single man from Lebanon. He is living with his parents and three siblings. Two of them are working. He is supporting his father who is the main source of income for the family. He has owned a hubble-bubble shop since 2010, a Lebanese traditional tobacco. Most of his work depends on delivery. People ask for a hubble-bubble to enjoy their day instead of visiting a café or a restaurant. Today, he is looking to borrow a youth loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to increase his inventory of hubble-bubble equipment, not to forget the charcoal and all related products. In the future, he plans to borrow another Kiva loan so he can expand his business and increase his earnings.

loans.use: to purchase hubble-bubble (traditional Lebanese tobacco) equipment

loans.name: Benetta

texts.en: Benetta is 32 years-old and lives in Montserrado County which has the largest Freeport in Liberia and is the highest marketing area in Liberia.  She is married and her husband has a pension. They have four children between the ages of  10 and 15, only three of her children live with her and are in school. For the past three years she has been selling charcoal and dried goods.  Sometimes she makes less profit because she buys at a high price. She is requesting a loan to purchase charcoal, pepper, oil, tomatoes, etc to resell and, in the future, she hope to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal, pepper, oil, tomatoes, etc/ to resell.

loans.name: Walaa'

texts.en:
Walaa' is 26 years old and from Gaza. He is married and has two children.  Since 2007, he has owned a tailoring shop.

He has asked Kiva partner Ryada for this youth loan in order to buy sewing machines.

He hopes that this loan will help him increase productivity and thus imporve his income so that he achieves his dream of owning a costume factory.

loans.use: to buy sewing machines.

loans.name: Amina

texts.en: Amina is asking for a new loan to expand her existing business and also open a new business where she wants to sell clothes for men, women and children. She is happy for the support she has received since it provided her an opportunity to have an increased income with which she wants to expand her lines of operation. With this loan, she will be able to buy bundles of clothing and also a stock of fish to sell. Amina thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to buy bundles of clothing and also a stock fish to sell.

loans.name: Evans

texts.en:
Evans is a farmer, aged 40, in Kisii county in Kenya, where he lives with his wife and four children, of whom only three are in school. He has been in farming for the past ten years, producing milk, maize, beans and sugarcane, which he sells at the local market in his area. He is a carpenter as an additional source of income.

He is requesting a 60,000 KES loan from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase a dairy cow, which will increase his milk production and earn him extra income which will help him raise his living standards. He will also use some of the money to pay for his children's schooling.

Poor markets and poor road networks are his major challenges in farming.

He is very thankful to Juhudi Kilimo for funding him with the loan.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Maarouf

texts.en: Maarouf is a 34-year-old Lebanese married man living with his wife and two young children who are attending school. He is the main income source of the family. In 2005, he decided to get involved in the car trading business. Due to his clever negotiation skills and great personality, he was able to succeed in this domain. But his finances were hardly helping him cover the high costs of living. That’s why he started to work in parallel as a showroom manager to be able to enhance his family’s way of living. Today, he is requesting to borrow a loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase additional cars and increase his earnings. His purpose is to better develop his business. This is how Maarouf works every day to achieve his goals.

loans.use: to purchase more cars to sell

loans.name: Mona

texts.en: Mona is a 50-year-old married woman from Lebanon. She is living with her husband, three children and a grandson. In 1990, in order to supplement the family’s income, she decided to start her own work as a farmer. Her job consists of cultivating vegetables, which she sells to customers from her town. And when she has orders from the neighboring villages, she sends the harvestings with her husband who transports them with his pick-up. Today, she is asking to borrow a loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to prepare the lands for a new season. She will diversify her harvesting and no doubt, she will need a big quantity of seeds and fertilizers. She states that the loan will certainly help her increase her business productivity by a large percentage, which will return to her higher profits. In the future, she plans to open a vegetable shop and start selling her own harvested goods.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Mwanapili

texts.en:
Mwanapili, a 36-year-old mother of two children who are 14 and 8 years old, has been selling home products and footwear such as basins, plates, and shoes for quite some time. She also has a small fruit and vegetable stall in the same locale. Mwanapili, very well-known in the area, has many customers because of the quality of her products, her good prices and excellent service.

Mwanapili is dedicated to her work. Every day she gets up with the hope of improving her situation and working toward a prosperous future. She knows that only with effort and dedication she will be successful, and will not give up until she makes it. Over the last few months demand has increased, and she wants to take advantage of this by increasing her investment. She is therefore requesting a loan through Yehu to buy more fruits, vegetables and utensils to sell. Mwanapili promises to pay the loan back on time, while offering her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy more fruits, vegetables and utensils to sell.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma lives with her family, her husband and two children. She raises chickens: she started this business on her own and runs it out of her home. She doesn't have a set schedule and she has lots of experience in this field.

She is asking for a loan to buy chicks to raise. She will also buy vitamins and feed (concentrated). This loan will help her business grow and help expand her farm so that she can increase her sales.

Fatuma’s goal is to have a good business with better revenue because this will allow her to provide the best for her children.

loans.use: to buy chicks to raise, vitamins and feeds (concentrated).

loans.name: Eunice Del Socorro

texts.es: Eunice con su previo creidkiva, compró mercancía variada y artículos deportivos  que vendió, su mercado se amplió y ahora tiene nuevos pedidos y nuevos clientes. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva con el cual comprara ropa y calzado con estilos elegantes, porque su clientela va a lucirlos para las fiestas navideñas y de fin de año, por eso han hecho a Eunice sus pedidos con suficiente tiempo. Así ellos estarán muy felices bailando, gozando luciendo sus vestidos, mientras Eunice estará generando utilidades para lograr un mayor bienestar en  su familia. Su mensaje a los financiadores de Kiva es el siguiente: “ Doy gracias a ustedes por ayudarme a mejorar mi vida económica”
texts.en: With her previous Kiva loan, Eunice bought a variety of merchandise and sports items and sold them. Her business expanded and now she has new orders and new clients. Currently, she's requesting a Kiva loan to buy stylish clothing and shoes. Her clients made their orders early enough so that they will be wearing her articles during the Christmas festivities and New Year. That way they'll be very happy dancing, enjoying themselves and showing off their dresses, while Eunice is generating income to improve her family's quality of life. Her message to the Kiva investors is the following: "I give thanks to you for helping me improve my financial situation”.

loans.use: buy stylish clothing and shoes.

loans.name: Tevekgul

texts.en:
Tevekgul is 51 years old. He is married and has two children. Tevekul is an IDP (Internally Displaced Person) from Fizuli town; now he lives in Fuzuli region with his family. 

He has been in food production for five years. He must increase his monthly income to support his family. Now he needs 2,000 AZN to buy some new products to resell for improving his business.

loans.use: to buy new products to resell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more clothing stock

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize and sorghum.

loans.name: Gulzar

texts.en:
Gulzar is an old client of Kiva. She is 56 years old. She is married and has a child. Gulzar is very thankful to Kiva and its lenders for every loan. She can make her business better with Kiva. But now she needs 2,300 AZN (Azerbaijani New Manat) to buy a fridge for her cafe, because her old fridge has been spoiled.

Gulzar is an Internally Displaced Person. She is a refugee from the town of Fuzuli and now lives in the Fuzuli Region, with her family.

loans.use: To buy a fridge.

loans.name: Manana

texts.en: Manana is 42 years old, a widow and she lives with two children in Bolnisi district. Several times, she has requested loans from local financial institutions for her trading business start-up without success. Her loan requests were rejected each time because of low income and the family’s poor living conditions. The only source of income for the family is the small monthly amount earned by Manana’s son, who has a horse and serves local farmers in land cultivation and transportation. Manana requested a loan from Credo to start a clothing sales business. Her loan request was approved in the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisions the provisions for business start-ups and re-startup credits with reasonable conditions for the country's rural poor, who do not have access to credit products. They are regarded as “high-risk borrowers” because of low income. Manana will purchase clothes and bedding at wholesale prices and resell them in her district for a profit. It will be hard work for Manana, but according to her estimates, her business will be profitable and will increase the income of the family. The increased profit will be reinvested in her clothing trading business to increase her stock and sales volume. Her family will be able to increase their spending to satisfy their daily needs and improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase clothing and bedding for resale

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia is 36 years old and is married to Sospeter who runs a shop which brings in additional income for the family. They have been blessed with four children aged 12, 15, 17 and 18 years respectively. Lydia sells fish. She has been in business for 12 years and earns a monthly income of kes 30,700. 

She is taking her second loan after she successfully repaid her previous loan. She intends to use the current loan amount to purchase more fish for resale. She plans to apply the anticipated profits toward expanding the business.

loans.use: To purchase more fish

loans.name: Salome

texts.en:
Salome is a 33 year old woman, she is married and the mother of one child. She repairs and sells electronics in the outskirts of Kangemi. She has been in this business for seven years and she earns a monthly income of thirty thousand shillings. 


This will be Salome's first loan with KADET LTD and she plans to use the entire loan to purchase more spare parts and second hand electronics for resale. 

In future she hopes to open a big shop and become a successful business woman.

loans.use: To buy second hand electronics

loans.name: Racheal

texts.en:
Racheal is a thirty-seven-year-old woman. She is married to Edward and a mother of two children. She is a poultry and pig farmer in the outskirts of Kangemi. She has been in this business for four years, and she gets a monthly income of twenty-three thousand shillings. 

This will be Racheal's fifth loan with KADET LTD, and she plans to use the entire loan to purchase feed for her pigs and poultry. 

In the future, she hopes to start a dairy farm and to become a successful business woman.
