loans.use: To purchase food for her pigs and poultry

loans.name: Nicasio Arcenio

texts.es: Nicasio de 44 años de edad, casado con tres hijos, de los cuales dos están estudiando bajo su responsabilidad. Él es originario de Chinandega lugar que está ubicado en la zona de occidente del país.  Nicasio tiene por actividad económica el servicio de taller de carpintería. El cosiste la elaboración y confección de muebles de madera para la venta de contado y de crédito. Tiene 8 años de desempeñar dicha actividad. El negocio surgió con un poco de ahorros propios y por la necesidad de tener un trabajo para los gastos de la casa. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio en la compra de materia prima como: madera, clavos, jucos, pega, clavos. Taladro.  Nicasio agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva le brindan a las personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua.
texts.en: Nicasio is 44 years old, married and has three children, all of whom are in school. He is originally from Chinandega, a place that is located in the Western part of the country. Nicasio has his own carpentry shop that he runs as his primary source of income. He makes furniture from wood to sell paid for in whole or in installments. He has been doing this for eight years. His business started with a little bit of savings he had and because he needed to job in order to take care of household expenses. The loan will be used to invest in working capital and to supply his business with prime materials such as wood, nails, glue, and a drill. Nicasio is thankful for the help the investors at Kiva have given him and to others with little resources available to them in countries as poor as Nicaragua.

loans.use: invest in working capital and to supply his business with prime materials such as wood, nails and glue.

loans.name: Bilha

texts.en:
Bilha is a thirty five year old woman. She is married to Wilson and the mother of three children. She supplies stationery and has a boutique in Kiambu.  She has been in the clothing business for three years and she gets a monthly income of seventy thousand shillings. 

This will be Bilha's first loan with KADET LTD and she plans to use the entire loan to purchase more clothes for resale. She plans to use the profits to reinvest in the business. 

In future she hopes to open a bigger shop and become a successful business woman.

loans.use: To add more clothes, hand bags, jeans etc

loans.name: Annet

texts.en: Annet is a 28-year-old married woman who deals in cattle rearing for both milk and meat products that she sells to get income for her family. She wants the loan to complete her home. She desires to find a source of income from where she will get enough money to cater for her children’s higher education. Her challenge is drought, which affects her output from the cows and sometimes other cows will succumb to death. However, since this year was graced with a lot of rain, Annet will get enough yield in the form of milk, so she will sell some to pay back the loan. In the photo is Annet with her cows.

loans.use: To buy construction materials to complete her house

loans.name: Kinanasi

texts.en:
Kinanasi is 40 years old and resides in the town of Msambweni, which is located in the coastal region of Kenya. She sells carvings, paintings, and baskets. Kinanasi lives with her seven children in a house she owns. She is a widow who is very much dedicated to her work. 

Kinanasi is requesting a loan so that she can buy a large quantity of these types of merchandise in different fashions and patterns that she does currently not have in stock. This will allow her to serve more customers and increase her sales.

loans.use: to buy carvings, paintings, and baskets.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize and sorghum.

loans.name: Mwanajuma

texts.en:
Mwanajuma is 28 years old and married with three children. She lives with her husband, who is a chef, and their children. Her eldest child attends school.

She sells cassava and other food items from a food kiosk. She works alone in this business. She is asking for this loan to buy ten sacks of cassava. She dreams of owning a hotel in the future.

loans.use: To buy ten sacks of cassava

loans.name: Saul

texts.en:
Saul is 36 years old and lives in the town of Maganjo in the Luwero region of Uganda. He is married and has three children, two of whom are currently in school.

For the past four years, Saul has been working hard to manage his retail shop, where he sells goods such as sugar, salt, and cooking oil.

To help expand his business, Saul has requested a loan in the amount of 2,000,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to increase his inventory of commodities such as milk, cooking oil, sugar, and salt. By doing so, he expects that the loan will enable him to attract more customers and to help him generate more profits, which will in turn help him pay school fees for his children. In the future, Saul hopes that he will be able to expand his business into a supermarket.

Saul is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Saul who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but who have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to further expand his business and to attract more customers by increasing his inventory of commodities (e.g., milk, cooking oil, sugar, and salt)

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is now 30 years old and lives in the town of Wobulenzi in the Luwero region of Uganda. She is married and has two children, both of whom are currently in school.

For the past three years, Ruth has been working hard to manage her bar/lodge, where she sells drinks such as spirits, wine, and beer.

To help expand her business, Ruth has requested a loan in the amount of 3,000,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan proceeds will be used to purchase a variety of new drinks, which she expects will attract new customers and will help Ruth generate more profits to pay school fees for her children. In the future, Ruth hopes to be able to expand her business into another town.

Ruth is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Ruth who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but who have businesses that have grown too large for microloans. "

loans.use: to expand her business and to attract more customers by purchasing a variety of new drinks for re-sale

loans.name: Luis Alberto

texts.es: Luis Alberto de 63 años de edad, casado con 5 hijos de los cuales 4 trabajo uno está bajo sur responsabilidad tiene 8 años de edad. Él es originario de Chinandega, lugar que está ubicado en la zona de occidente del país. Luis Alberto se caracteriza por ser un hombre trabajador, responsables de buenas costumbres. Tiene por actividad económica una pulpería ubicada en su casa de habitación desde hace 22 años que se dedica a dicha actividad. Una pulpería es una pequeña tienda que vende productos de consumo diario y en cantidades pequeñas como: arroz, frijoles, azúcar, leche, pan, sobre de café, sobre de shapoo. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su pulpería para sasficer a sus clientes. Luis Alberto agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva le brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua
texts.en: Luis Alberto, 63, is married with five children. Of his children, four are working and one, who is eight years old, is under his care. He originates from Chinandega, which is located in the west of the country. Luis Alberto is characterized by being a hard-working, responsible man with good habits. His business for the last 22 years is a pulpería that he runs out of his house. A pulpería is a small store that sells everyday consumption products in small quantities, like rice, beans, sugar, milk, bread, packets of coffee and packets of shampoo. The objective is to invest the loan in business capital and stock up his store in order to satisfy her clients. Luis Alberto is grateful for the help the Kiva investors give to those of few recourses and developing countries like Nicaragua.

loans.use: invest in business capital and stock up his store with products like rice, beans, sugar, milk, bread, packets of coffee and packets of shampoo

loans.name: Yawasi

texts.en:
Yawasi is 50 years-old and lives in the town of Ntungamo in the Mbarara region of Uganda. He is married and has seven children with three of them currently in school. For the past 15 years, Yawasi has been working hard to manage his mixed farming, which sells milk, raw bananas and coffee. 

To help expand his business, Yawasi has requested a loan of 2000,000 Ugandan Shillings from Kiva partner BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more seeds such as beans and maize for planting and cattle feed which will help the cattle produce enough milk. This will help Yawasi generate greater profits and pay school fees and medical bills for his children. Yawasi hopes that in the future he will be able to expand his business on a large scale. 

Yawasi is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Yawasi who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.


"

loans.use: to buy more seeds such as beans and maize for planting and cattle feed which will help the cattle produce enough milk.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize and sorghum.

loans.name: Ziya

texts.en:
Ziya is 40 years old. He is married and has two children. Ziya is an IDP (Internally Displaced Person) from Shusha town. Currently, he lives in the Fizuli region with his family.

For five years now, he has been in the taxi business. He explains that he must increase his monthly income to support his family.

As a result, Ziya is seeking a loan in the amount of 2,000 AZN to buy spare parts for his car and to make some home repairs.

loans.use: to improve his business by purchasing spare parts for his vehicle

loans.name: Loyce

texts.en:
Loyce is 29 years old and lives in the town of Bombo in the Luwero region of Uganda. She is married and has two children.

For the past two years, Loyce has been working hard to manage her salon, where she works as a hairstylist.

To help expand her business, Loyce has requested a loan in the amount of 2,000,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan proceeds will be used to buy more essentials for her salon, including braids and a hair dryer. She expects that the loan will help her generate increased profits and will enable her to improve her family's living stardands. In the future, Loyce hopes to expand her business into a vocational hairstylist training center.

Loyce is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Loyce who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but who have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to expand and improve her salon by purchasing additional hair products (e.g., braids) and a hair dryer

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty is 31 years old and lives in the Luwero region of Uganda. She is married and has 4 children who are all currently in school. For the past 2 years, she has been working hard to manage her pharmacy, which sells drugs. 

To help expand her business, Betty has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more products such as pampers, cotton wool, panadol and septrine, and will help Betty to generate greater profits and pay school fees for her children. She hopes that in the future she will be able to expand her business into a clinic.  

Betty is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Betty who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more products such as pampers, cotton wool, panadol and septrine

loans.name: Rosette

texts.en:
Rosette is a 39-year-old, single parent living in Fort Portal, Uganda. Her personal goals are to educate her children and to buy a car.

She used the previous loan to buy clothes to sell. Seven years ago she secured enough capital to open a retail clothing shop. Her business challenges continue to be things like price fluctuations, inflation, high fuel and transportation costs, and seasonality.

Rosette is seeking this loan so that she can buy clothes to sell this Christmas season.

loans.use: to expand her business and to capitalize on the Christmas season by purchasing additional clothes for re-sale purposes

loans.name: Delia Maria

texts.es: Delia de 33 años de edad, casado con dos hijos menores de edad, comerciante, del departamento de Chinandega lugar que está ubicado en la zona de occidente del país. Delia se caracteriza por ser una mujer responsable, trabajadora. El objetivo del crédito es para realizar mejoras en su casa de habitación como es reparar la cocina. Con el financiamiento comprara material de construcción como: zinc, arena, cemento, ladrillos, perlines, alambre, hierro. Delia agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva les brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un techo digno donde vivir.
texts.en: Delia, 33, is married with 3 young children. She's a businessowner from the Chinandega department, which is located in the west of the country. Delia is described as a responsible, hard-working woman. The objective of this loan is to make improvements to her home, like repairing her kitchen. With the loan, she'll buy construction material such as, zinc, cement, bricks, purline, wire and iron. Delia is grateful for the help Kiva investors give to people of few recourses -- and developing countries like Nicaragua -- so that they can have a decent roof to live under.

loans.use: to invest in construction materials to make home improvements, like zinc, cement, bricks, purline (horizontal rafters that support a roof), wire and iron.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize and sorghum.

loans.name: El Mana Group

texts.es: El banco comunal el  Mana está conformado por 11 integrantes, de los cuales son 10 mujeres y un varón, todos con familias con 20 hijos bajo su responsabilidad. Los integrantes de este banco se caracterizan por ser personas responsables, trabajadoras, buenas  pagas los cual lo  han demostrado en los créditos anteriores en tiempo y forma. Ellos son originarios de la misma comunidad se conocen entre sí y por eso decidieron unirse y formar el banco para beneficiarse del crédito  e invertir en sus diferentes negocios. María del Rosario es la coordinadora del banco comunal el Mana la cual se encarga de verla por la unión y responsabilidad de lo integrantes. Ella tiene por actividad económica una pulpería ubicada en su casa de habitación. Una pulpería es una pequeña tienda de comestible que vende en cantidades pequeñas como sobre de shampoo, sobre de café, sobre de salsa de tomate, cigarro por unidad, arroz, tiste, azúcar, leche, pan, frijoles, verduras, queso, crema, huevos.  El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio en compras de productos comestible para surtir su pequeña pulpería. María del Rosario agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva les brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en: The "El Mana" communal bank is composed of 11 members--10 are woman, and one is a man. They all have families, with a total of 20 children for whom they are responsible. The members of this bank are characterized by being responsible and hard-working people who have demonstrated their ability to make payments on time with previous loans. They are originally from the same community, which is how they know each other, and for this reason decided to come together and form a bank to obtain credit that can be invested in their different businesses. María del Rosario is the coordinator of the El Mana communal bank, which means that she watches over the group and is responsible for the members. Her business is a small grocery store located in her home. In her shop, she sells small quantities of things such as shampoo, coffee, tomato sauce, cigars, rice, tiste (a local beverage), sugar, milk, bread, beans, vegetables, cheese, cream, and eggs. The purpose of this loan is to use it as capital and stock María del Rosario's small grocery store with comestibles and other products. María del Rosario is grateful for the support that Kiva lenders provide to people with few resources and to poor countries such as Nicaragua, so that people can have honest work.

loans.use: to stock her small grocery shop with comestibles such as coffee, tomato sauce, cigars, rice, tiste (a local beverage), sugar, milk, bread, beans, vegetables, cheese, cream, and eggs.

loans.name: Isatu

texts.en:
This is 50-year-old Isatu. She is a widow and has three children who are 27, 17 and 3 years old. She has one additional dependent. In 2000, Isatu established her peanut business. She began her business because she wanted to help her husband support their family. Working seven days a week and 12 hours a day, she earns about Le 900,000 every month in profit from this business. 

Isatu would like a loan of Le 4,500,000. She requires a loan in order to buy more peanuts for her business. In the future, Isatu plans to build a house and to give her children a quality education. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy more peanuts to sell

loans.name: Rehema

texts.en:
Rehema is 43 years old and lives in the Luwero region of Uganda. She is married and has 4 children, 1 of whom is currently in school. For the past 2 years, she has been working hard to manage her retail shop, which sells sugar,salt and cooking oil. 

To help expand her business, Rehema has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to increase her stock of essential commodities such as milk, cooking oil, sugar, and salt in order to attract more customers; it will also help her to generate greater profits and send her child to a good boarding schoold. She hopes that in the future she will be able to complete her unfinished house and further expand her poultry farming business. 

Rehema is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Rehema who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to increase her stock of essential commodities such as milk, cooking oil, sugar, and salt

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase two specialized professional sewing machines, cloth, and materials.

loans.name: Jacinto Rufino

texts.es:
Jacinto Rufino tiene 57 años de edad vive en unión libre no tiene hijos vive con la esposa en el Cantón ventanas provincia de los Ríos.

LA VRC SAN NICOLAS, se encuentra ubicada en el Recinto San Nicolás, Parroquia puerto Pechiche Perteneciente al Cantón Pueblo Viejo, Esta Ventanilla se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto Siembra de maíz.

Jacinto Rufino se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, arroz las compras y las ventas las realiza en san Jacinto. Solicita el Crédito para invertir en la agricultura, comprar semillas, insumos, urea, mata monte, fertilizantes, veneno para la maleza para mantener en buenas condiciones los cultivos.

El Crédito será de mucha ayuda porque va a invertir en la agricultura y le va a generar ganancias.
Los desafíos que se le presenta  muy frecuente son: la competencia, las plagas, enfermedades que se dan en los cultivos. El sueño es sembrar cacao este nuevo año. En los tiempos libres le gusta escuchar mùsica y jugar indor.
texts.en: Jacinto Rufino is 57 years old, and lives in a common-law marriage. He does not have any children, and lives with his wife in Ventanas canton, in the province of Los Ríos.  The San Nicolas community bank is located in San Nicolás, in Puerto Pechiche parish, in Pueblo Viejo canton. The members of this bank work in short-cycle agriculture, growing corn. Jacinto Rufino is a farmer who grows corn and rice. He makes his purchases and sales in San Jacinto. He is asking for this loan to invest in his farm by purchasing seeds, urea, Matamonte (an herbicide), fertilizers, and weedkiller so that he can keep his crops in good condition. The loan will be very helpful because it will allow him to invest in his farm and make better profits. Jacinto Rufino frequently faces challenges such as competition, pests, and crop diseases. His dream is to be able to plant cacao in the new year. In his free time, he likes to listen to music and play indoor soccer.

loans.use: to invest in his farm by purchasing seeds, urea, herbicides, weedkiller, and other agricultural supplies.

loans.name: Al Safa Group

texts.en:
Sawsan is the featured borrower in Al Safa Group, she is the one located in the middle. She applied for an Al Majmoua Lebanese Association for Development (Kiva partner) group loan with her friends because they have known each other a long time and they trust each other.

Sawsan is a 26-year-old, married woman who has been working in the women's beauty business for 14 years. She was only 12 years old when she started working in this domain, helping her parents to make a living. 

Today, Sawsan is working on her own. She is developing her business as best she can and her loyal customers are supporting her a lot since she is an energetic and enthusiastic person. 

Sawsan's applied-for loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua Lebanese Association for Development will be invested in her baby delivery expenses and she is very much excited to soon see her baby in her hands.

She states that she will put forth so much effort to improve and develop her business and open a beauty salon in the future, transitioning from working from home, to provide her child with a secure, healthy life. She is insisting that she won't let her child face her own family's financial problems and will make sure he will get a suitable education.  

Majida is the one on the left. She is 40 years old and single. She has worked in a jam factory for five years and is requesting a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua Lebanese Association for Development in order to pay for surgery that she needs to undergo. She hopes that, one day, she will be capable of opening her own factory.

Zahraa is the one on the right. She is 24 years old and single. She has been working as a tutor for two years and is requesting this loan in order to pay for her university fees. Zahraa is a smart girl and she is willing to open a nursery school in the future because she loves dealing a lot with babies.

loans.use: to pay for her baby delivery expenses.

loans.name: Kedrethy

texts.en:
Kedrethy is 31 years old and lives in the town of Lyantonde in the Mbarara region of Uganda. She is single and has one child who is currently in school. For the past 12 years, Kedrethy has been working hard to manage her bar, which sells drinks such as lemonade, spirits, wine and beer. 

To help expand her business, Kedrethy has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more drinks such as lemonade, spirits, wine and beer for resale. This will help Kedrethy to generate greater profits and improve her family's standard of living. Kedrethy hopes that in the future she will be able to have a well-stocked bar that will meet all her customers needs. 

Kedrethy is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Kedrethy who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for micro-loans.

loans.use: to buy more drinks such as lemonade, spirits, wine and beer for resell

loans.name: Rosa De Saron Group

texts.es: El banco comunal Rosa de Saron esta conformado por 8 integrantes, madres solteras con 16 hijos bajo su responsabilidad. Ella son originarios del Sauce, que esta ubicado en la zona norte el país. Estas  mujeres se caracterizan por ser mujeres responsables, trabajadoras, de buenas costumbres. Trabajadoras. Con ganas de superación personal. María de Jesús es coordinadora del banco la cual se encarga de la responsabilidad de los pagos de cada integrante.   María de Jesús tiene por actividad económica la elaboración y venta de tortillas. La rutina diaria de esta mujer es levantarse todos los días a las  4: 00 am para moler y palmear la tortilla y luego salir a venderla de forma ambulante. El financiamiento lo necesita para invertir en capital de trabajo comprar maíz, leña, bolsas, plásticas. El banco comunal Rosa de Saron esta agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva les brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en: The "Rosa de Saron" communal bank is composed of 8 members who are single mothers, with a total of 16 children for whom they are responsible. They are originally from Sauce, which is located in the northern area of the country. These women are characterized by being responsible, hard-working, and polite, with dreams of moving ahead in their lives. María de Jesús is the coordinator of the bank, which means that she is responsible for all of the payments from each member. As her business, María de Jesús makes and sells tortillas. Her daily routine is to wake up every day at 4:00 am to grind and shape the tortillas. Later, she will leave to sell them door-to-door. She needs this loan to invest in her business by purchasing corn, firewood, bags, and plastic wrap. The "Rosa de Saron" communal bank is grateful for the support that Kiva lenders show to people with scarce resources and to countries as poor as Nicaragua, so that people can have honest work.

loans.use: to invest in her business making and selling tortillas, and to purchase supplies such as corn, firewood, bags, and plastic wrap

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en: Mohammad is a Lebanese married man. He’s 55 years old. He’s really attached to his wife and children, two of whom are studying and one is working. By cooperating, Mohammad and his wife are able to cover their heavy life expenses in order to live a respectable life. He started his business many years ago. He had to work with high professionalism to prove that he’s a necessary support for his family. He has been working as a car mechanic in his own garage and has gained a fair number of customers asking for his services. Today, he’s asking for a loan from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to buy added mechanic's tools and renovate his garage. In that way, he will respond rapidly to his clients’ problems. He believes that acting properly is really essential to attract more customers. In the future, he plans to take more Kiva loans and improve his business.

loans.use: to buy mechanic's tools and renovate his garage

loans.name: Hajara

texts.en:
Hajara is 31 years old and lives in the town of Lyantonde in the Mbarara region of Uganda. She is widowed and has 2 children who are both currently in school. For the past 11 years, Hajara has been working hard to manage her small business, which sells beds and clothing shelves. 

To help expand her business, Hajara has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more materials for making beds, which will help Hajara to generate greater profits and pay school fees for her children. Hajara hopes that in the future she will be able to to educate her children up to university level. 

Hajara is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Hajara who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for micro-loans.

loans.use: to buy more materials that will be used for making beds.

loans.name: Nichelas

texts.en:
Nichelas is 32 years old and lives in the town of Lyantonde in the Mbarara region of Uganda. He is married and has 2 children. For the past 10 years, Nichelas has been working hard to manage his dairy farm, which includes cattle that produce milk and cheese. 

To help expand his business, Nichelas has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more cattle feeds that will help increase the production of milk and cheese for resale. The increase will help Nichelas to generate greater profits enabling him to improve his family's standard of living and pay for his medical bills. Nichelas hopes that in the future he will be able to to have the best cattle breeds in the whole village. 

Nichelas is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Nichelas who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for micro-loans.

loans.use: to buy more cattle feeds that will increase the production of milk and cheese for resale

loans.name: Elifaazi

texts.en:
Elifaazi is 33 years old and lives in the Luwero region of Uganda. He is married and has 4 children, 3 of whom are currently in school. For the past 3 years, he has been working hard to manage his small shop, which sells products such as rice, sugar and millet. 

To help expand his business, Elifaazi has requested a loan of 3,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more rice, millet and sugar to resell, and will help him to generate greater profits and pay school fees for his children. He hopes that in the future he will be able to create another business in town. 

Elifaazi is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Elifaazi who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to purchase more rice, millet and sugar to resell

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize and sorghum.

loans.name: Mahaveer Self Help Group

texts.en:
Minati is 40 years old and lives with her husband and in-laws. She is engaged in selling dried and fresh fish in the market, which is two kilometers away from her village. Her husband catches fish from the Chilika Lake, which is near to their village (Chilika is a famous lake in Odisha known for the migratory birds). The demand for fish in the region is very high as it is consumed by most of the people. She makes dried fish by keeping the fish in sunlight until all the water in it evaporates and preserves them for future use (like when fish are not available in the market, in the rainy season). Dried fish is also used as a supplement to fresh fish. 

Minati is requesting a loan to buy a cool storage box for keeping fish, fishing net and insecticides to prevent fish from decaying for her fishery business. She says that this will help her in strengthening the business and responding to client demand.

This group is made up of neighbors and friends who formed the group Mahaveer Self Help Group (SHG). The members of the group have selected Minati as their president. The lady sitting second from the left-hand side in the photo is Minati. The common goal of the group is to increase their business activity.

loans.use: to purchase a cool storage box, fishing net, etc.

loans.name: Hadija

texts.en: Hadija is 40 years old and married with six children. Two are in secondary school, three are in primary school, and the eldest is an independent adult. Hadija has been involved in selling fish from her home, a business she has run for the past year. She says that her goal is to have a seafood shop in the near future. She is asking for this loan to buy more fish to sell. She hopes to increase sales through this loan.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine lives with her husband and children. She started her business raising and selling chickens a year ago through her own initiative. Currently, her business is going very well since she can keep up with her household and educational expenses. She needs a loan to invest in the purchase of two sacks of chicken feeds and chicks. This will increase her profits considerably and with time, she will improve her quality of life.

Christine is a nice person with very good character who can get along well with anyone. She likes her work and she wants to be successful and improve her family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase of two sacks of chicken feeds and chicks.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize and sorghum.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize and sorghum.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize and sorghum.

loans.name: Carine Aurore's Group

texts.fr: Ce groupe est composé de deux femmes en caution solidaire. Carine Aurore, la responsable, âgée de 36ans, est divorcée et mère de deux enfants dont l'aîné est scolarisé. Les deux enfants ont respectivement 05ans et 02ans. Elle s'est spécialisée dans la vente des pâtes dentifrices, des paquets de spaghetti, de Milo, de lait, de mayonnaise et d'autres articles depuis quelques années. Elle s'approvisionne dans l'un des marchés du Bénin et de l'extérieur. En vue de renforcer son chiffre d'affaire et de satisfaire à la forte demande de ses clients qui augmente sans cesse compte tenu du bon emplacement de son activité, Carine Aurore a sollicité et a obtenu un appui financier à Finadev. Cet appui financier lui permettra de maximiser son profit et de participer à la scolarisation de son enfant. Carine Aurore se retrouve à gauche dans la photo.
texts.en:
This group is composed of two women who guarantee one another in solidarity. Carine Aurore, the group's official, is 36 years old and the mother of two children, of whom the oldest child is in school; they are 5 and 2 years old. Carine Aurore has been a specialist in selling toothpaste, packets of spaghetti, Milo, milk, mayonnaise, and other goods for a few years. She gets her supplies from one of the markets in Benin and from abroad. 

With the aim of bolstering her sales and satisfying the strong demand from her ever-growing customer base, and given that her business has a good location, Carine Aurore requested and obtained financial support from Finadev. This support will enable her to maximize her profit and to help cover her children's schooling costs.

Carine Aurore is on the left in the photo.

loans.use: to purchase toothpaste, canned tomatoes, spaghetti, and mayonnaise to sell

loans.name: Banco Comunal La Esperanza Group

texts.es: El Banco Comunal la esperanza está conformado por 14 integrantes todas madres solteras, de la comunidad del Sauce, lugar que está ubicado en la zona norte del país. Estas mujeres se caracterizan por ser responsables, trabajadoras, de buenas costumbres. Mujeres luchadoras humildes.  Norma es la coordinadora del banco la cual se encarga de la responsabilidad de las integrantes del  grupo en cuanto a sus pagos en tiempo y forma. Ella tiene  por actividad económica la compra y  venta de cerdos en pie. La rutina de esta mujer es salir a las comunidades a busca lote de cerdos para la venta. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio y aprovechar las mejores ventas de la temporada navideña. El banco comunal agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva le brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno
texts.en:
El Banco Comunal la esperanza está conformado por 14 integrantes todas madres solteras, de la comunidad del Sauce, lugar que está ubicado en la zonThe “La Esperanza” communal bank has 14 members, all single mothers, who are from the town of El Sauce, which is located in the north of the country. These women are responsible, hardworking and of good character: determined humble women. Norma is the bank coordinator, which means it is her responsibility to make sure the group members make the correct payments and on time.  

Her own economic activity is the buying and selling of pigs. She carries out her work by visiting other towns and villages in search of pigs to sell on. The aim of this loan is to invest in working capital and stock her business in order to take advantage of the increased sales during the Christmas period. The communal bank is grateful for the help given by Kiva investors to people with scarce resources and in poor countries, like Nicaragua, so that they can have a way to achieve a decent job.

loans.use: to invest in working capital and buy pigs to sell on

loans.name: Mwanamisi

texts.en:
Mwanamisi has a small store where she sells basic products such as grains, instant products, snacks, bread, drinks, and other things. She has done this for some time and has many customers who prefer her business because of her products’ quality, her good prices, and the excellent service she provides.

Mwanamisi is an active, entrepreneurial woman dedicated to her work and with many goals that she wants to achieve. She is working hard to reach a more prosperous future and feels satisfied with the business. Demand has increased in recent weeks and she wants to make a new investment, so she is asking for a loan to buy more grains, instant products, snacks, bread, drinks, etc. 

Her motivation to succeed is one of the most important dreams Mwanamisi has. She lives with her family in a home of her own but wants to have a new beginning and leave behind the crime that surrounds her. She feels that this is one of the best decisions she has made and she is proud of that.

loans.use: to buy more grains, instant products, snacks, bread, drinks, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize and sorghum.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize and sorghum.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is a 42-year-old widowed mother of five. Three of her children have already completed school and the other two are both in secondary schools. Mary has been working in agriculture for almost ten years. She also sells cereals alongside her farming. Mary is a very ambitious woman who is also very respectful of her family obligations; she took responsibility early on by regularly contributing to the household expenses. She is requesting a loan to buy agricultural inputs and seeds. The loan will have a positive impact on her work, as it will allow her to diversify her product offering, to improve her family's nutrition, and also to put some money aside. In the future she wants to become a major trader.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs and seeds.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en: Sarah lives in Montserrado County, an area which has the largest Freeport and is the number one commercial county in Liberia. Sarah is married with four children between 16 to 25 years old; only two live at home, one is out of high school, while the two younger ones attend school. For the past 15 years she has been selling dry fish. She started this business from her savings. A challenge Sarah faces is transportation costs. She enjoys her business because it enables her to sustain her family. She is requesting a loan to purchase more dry fish for her business. Sarah's plan is to build a house and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more dry fish for her business

loans.name: Bernadette's Group

texts.fr: Il s'agit d'un groupe de deux personnes en caution solidaire. Bernadette, la responsable est âgée de 41ans. Mariée et mère de trois enfants dont l'ainé et le benjamin ont respectivement 10ans et 03ans. Spécialisée dans la vente des pagnes et des sous-vêtements depuis quelques années, elle s'approvisionne dans l'un des marché de l'extérieur. Dans le but d'augmenter son capital et de couvrir les besoins de ses clients, elle a sollicité et a obtenu un financement à Finadev en vue d'accroître son revenu supplémentaire et de participer à la scolarisation de ses enfants. Bernadette se retrouve à gauche dans la photo.
texts.en:
This group is composed of two women who guarantee one another in solidarity. Bernadette, the group's official, is 41 years old and the married mother of three children, of whom the oldest and the youngest are 10 and 3 years old, respectively. Bernadette has been a specialist in selling 'pagnes' (the colorful cloth of western Africa) and undergarments for a few years. She gets her supplies from one of the markets abroad. 

With the goal of increasing her capital and meeting the needs of her customers, Bernadette requested and obtained financing from Finadev, so as to grow her additional revenues and help cover her children's schooling costs. 

Bernadette is on the left in the photo.

loans.use: to purchase 'pagne' cloth and undergarments to sell

loans.name: Santa Lucia Group

texts.es: El banco comunal Santa Lucia está conformado por  8 integrantes, siete mujeres y un varo, madres, y padres  solteros, con 10 hijos bajo su responsabilidad. Estos integrantes  se caracterizan por ser luchadores, trabajadores, para poder sacar a sus hijos adelantes y brindarles mejores oportunidades de vida. Ellos son originarias del Sauce lugar que está ubicado en la zona norte del país. María de Jesús es la coordinadora del banco comunal Santa Lucia la cual es la que se encarga de la responsabilidad y unión del mismo en cuanto a sus cuotas en tiempo y forma. Ella tiene por actividad económica la venta de cuajada de forma ambulantes y en su casa de habitación. La rutina diaria de maría es levantarse a las 4: am a preparar su pana de cuajada que pesa unos 20 kg, para salir a vender en su comunidad sus cuajadas. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su  negocio con la compra de cuajada y mejorar sus ingresos. El banco comunal  Santa Lucia agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva le brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
The Santa Lucia Community Bank has eight members, seven women and one man. They are single mothers or single fathers with ten children to care for. All are known for their hard work and effort to help their children get ahead and give them opportunities in life. The members come from El Sauce in the north part of the country. 

María de Jesús is the coordinator of the Santa Lucia Bank. One of her duties is to see that repayment of the loan is made correctly and on time. She earns her living selling cheese curd in the streets and from her home. Her daily routine consists of getting up at 4 am to prepare the curds. The container of curds which she carries into the streets weighs 20 kg. María plans to use her share of the loan to buy more curds and earn more money. 

All the group members are grateful for the support and financing that Kiva lenders give to low-income people and to poor countries such as Nicaragua so that they can earn a decent living.

loans.use: to buy and sell cheese curd

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a modern sewing machine, a specialized sewing machine for jeans, pay for thread and also for maintenance of her machines.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en: Rebecca is 43 years old and lives in Montserrado County, an area that has the largest Freeport and is the number one commercial county in Liberia. Rebecca is married with three children aged between 26 to 29 years old. Her children are all living on their own. For the past 20 years Rebecca has been selling fish in the local market. She started this business with money given to her by her husband. Rebecca is requesting a loan to purchase more fish for her business. Her plan is to build a house for her children.

loans.use: to purchase more fish for her business

loans.name: Tuzamurane Group

texts.fr:
Antoinette fait partie du groupe Tuzamurane  et   habite à Gitega. Elle  a   26 ans et est mariée à Pascal, un  commerçant. Ensemble ils ont  5 enfants, dont 2 étudient.

Elle  fait le commerce de  boutique (haricot, sel, savon, …)  depuis 10 ans. 

Elle  est à son  quatrième  crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle obtient, elle  va  augmenter son capital et acheter beaucoup d’articles  de sa boutique (haricot, sel, savon, …) à revendre, pour gagner plus. 

Avec les bénéfices de son commerce, elle  a acheté un terrain  pour agrandir son espace cultivable.
texts.en:
Antoinette is part of the group Tuzamurane, and she lives in Gitega. She is 26 years old and married to Pascal, a merchant. Together they have five children, of whom two are students. 

Antoinette has been a shopkeeper (beans, salt, soap, …) for ten years. 

She is one her fourth loan with the microfinance institution Turame. With this KIVA loan she is obtaining, she is going to increase her capital and purchase many goods (beans, salt, soap, …) for her shop to resell, so as to earn more. 

With the profits from her business, she has purchased a plot of land to expand her arable terrain.

loans.use: to purchase many goods (beans, salt, soap,...) for her shop to resell and earn more

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty, 25 years old, lives together with her friend and a child who is 5 years old and is in school. She has been selling beans, Vita, bath soap, hair grease, bread, soft drinks and many other items for the past four years. 

Betty learned to sell well from her mother, because she always has what her customers need and she makes a profit when she sells. With the profit generated from the business she buys more goods and contributes toward household expenses. She sells from 7 a.m. to 5 p.m. daily. 

She is so grateful to all the lenders who are supporting her in her business. She has requesting this loan to purchase more hair grease, soft drinks, Vita, and bath soap for the business. Her plan for the future is to become a big business woman.

loans.use: to purchase more hair grease, soft drinks, Vita, and bath soap for the business.

loans.name: Abdallah

texts.en:
Abdallah is 29 years old and a hardworking and friendly man. He lives in a home of his own with his wife, together with their two-year-old child, to whom Abdallah wants to provide a brighter future. Abdallah owns and manages a retail shop. Since he began his business, he has had many difficulties, such as inadequate working capital and the high cost of commodities. 

Since 2010 when he began the business, his potential customers have increased. Therefore it is for this reason that Abdallah has requested a loan of 30000 KES, to expand his business and satisfy his growing clientele.
He is grateful for your assistance.

loans.use: to purchase stocks of flour, basic grains, and instant products for his general store

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther, 47, lives together with her friend at West Point. She is a hard working mother with three children between the ages of 16 and 28, who are in school. Esther sells for twelve hours a day. She sells lappers (country cloth), and children's slippers. She has been involved in this business for the past five years. Esther learned to sell from her mother, and transports her goods by truck from Guinea. Esther started this business with the amount of $7.000.00LD (seven thousand  Liberian  dollars) that she received from her friend. She enjoys doing this business because she has a lot of customers  and makes profit. She thanks the lender for empowering her in her business. She has requested a loan to purchase more lappers (country cloth) and children's slippers for the business. Her plan for the future is to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more lappers (country cloth) and children's slippers for the business.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en: Lydia is 47 years old and lives in Montserrado County, an area that has the largest Freeport and is the number one commercial county in Liberia. Lydia is married with three children between 3 to 20 years old; all of them are in school and live at home. Lydia has been selling clothes for the past four years.  She started this business with money given to her by her husband and she learns this business from her friend. Her favorite part about her business is the buying. She is requesting a loan to purchase more clothes for her business. In the future she want to become an international businesswoman.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes for her business

loans.name: Vivian

texts.en: Vivian is 32 years old and lives in Montserrado County, an area that has the largest Freeport and is the number one commercial county in Liberia. Vivian is married, with one child aged 13 who is in school and lives at home. She has been selling rice, oil, peanuts, butter, and onions for the past twenty-five years. She started this business with money given to her by her husband and she learns this business from her husband. Her favorite part about her business is that it gives her more profit. She is requesting a loan to purchase more rice, oil, onions, peanuts, and butter for her business. In the future she wants to build a house for her children.

loans.use: to purchase more rice, oil, onions, peanuts, and butter for her business

loans.name: Amina

texts.en: Amina is a 25-year-old single business lady who runs a business selling clothes door to door. She has has been in business for two years. Amina is very hardworking and profit-oriented. Her business has grown tremendously. The desire to open boutiques is always ringing in her mind. Amina requires a loan of 20000 KES to buy more shoes and clothes for selling.

loans.use: to buy more shoes and clothes for selling

loans.name: Jonneh

texts.en:
Jonneh, 41 years-old, live in the Paynesville South community with her husband and three children.between the ages of 13 and 20.  Only two of the children are in school.  For the past fourteen years she has been selling mineral water.

She sells from 9am to 7pm daily and she lovse her business because she makes a profit, especially during the dry season. She learnt to sell from her mother and uses a motorbike to transport her goods to her business area.

She thanks all Kiva lenders for empowering her in her business. She is requesting a loan to purchase more mineral water for the business. Her plan is to educate her children and build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more mineral water to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize and sorghum.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize and sorghum

loans.name: Ade

texts.en: Ade is 30 years old and lives in Montserrado County, an area that has the largest Freeport and is the number one commercial county in Liberia. Ade is single with three children between 2 to 10 years old; two are in school and all live at home. For the past three years Ade has been selling fashion clothes. She started this business with money that she received from her mother; her favorite part about her business is that she makes more profit. Ade is requesting a loan to purchase more fashion clothes for her business. In the future she wants to build her house and buy a car for her children.

loans.use: to purchase more fashion clothes for her business

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria, 30, lives together with her friend and three children in the West Point community. Her children are between the ages of 8 months to 8 years. Victoria is a hard-working mother who has been involved in this business for the past five years. She sells pepper, salt, palm oil, onions and Vita in her community, in order to help with the family expenses. Victoria first started in business by selling mineral water. She is proud of her business because she makes profit every day. Victoria uses the profit to buy more goods and improve the business. She has requested a loan to purchase more pepper, Vita, palm oil, salt and onions for the business. She thank the lenders for their support in her business. Her plan for the future is to become a
major business woman.

loans.use: to purchase more pepper, Vita, palm oil, salt and onions for the business.

loans.name: Gustavo Adolfo

texts.es: Gustavo es un joven de 23 años de edad no trabaja pero estudia con mucha ilusión la carrera de ingeniería en sistemas con la ayuda de sus padres, a Gustavo le interesa mucho su carrera porque quiere llegar a ser desarrollador de sistemas en su comunidad y apoyar a su familia para hacer esto posible necesita apoye de crédito para poder pagar el curso de titulación de su carrera ya que sus padres son de escasos recursos y no pueden cubrir este costo de una sola vez, agradece mucho el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Gustavo is a young, twenty-three-year-old man.  He does not work, but he studies a systems engineering career with a lot of excitement and with the help of his parents.  This career is very interesting to Gustavo because he wants to become a systems developer in his community, and to support his family.

To make this possible, he needs help from a loan to be able to pay the final fee to officialize his degree.  His parents have scarce resources and they cannot cover this one-time cost.  He is very thankful for the offered support.

loans.use: to pay his final fee to officialize his degree.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize and sorghum.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize and sorghum.

loans.name: Yeater

texts.en:
Yeater is 40 years old and lives in Montserrado County, which has the largest Freeport and is the number one commercial county in Liberia. Yeater is single with two children aged three months and 12 years old. One attends school, and both live at home. For the past ten years she has been selling soap. 

Yeater says her main challenge is the raining season. She started this business with the help of her friends, and she learned this business from her friends, too. Her favorite part about her business is that it helps her get more money, and what makes her proud is that it helps her send her children to school. She is requesting this loan to purchase more charcoal for her business. She plans to buy land and build a house for her children in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more charcoal for her business

loans.name: Maria Luisa

texts.es:
María es una mujer de 49 años, tiene estudios primarios y está casada con Hugo de 56 años. Con quien tiene 3 hijos ya adultos. María se educó con sus padres que aunque de escasos recursos, le pudieron al menos regalar parte de su educación y también le enseñaron todo sobre la agricultura, con la cual María podría obtener el sustento. Ahora María vive con su cónyuge en la ciudad de El Puyo, cantón capital de la Provincia de Pastaza, una provincia que forma parte importante de la Región Amazónica del Ecuador, siendo el centro de la selva amazónica. En su capital Puyo se puede gozar de un agradable clima y un paisaje esplendoroso con ríos, cascadas diversidad de fauna y flora por lo que turistas nacionales y extranjeros llegan a deleitarse de estos cálidos atractivos. Por ser el turismo una de las actividades económicas más importantes, en el centro de la ciudad se encuentra fácilmente todos los servicios para acoger al turista como son hoteles, hosterías, restaurantes, instituciones financieras, etc. También los habitantes se dedican a la agricultura y ganadería que son favorecidas con la tierra fértil que posee este lugar. Sin duda El Puyo es una ciudad que vale la pena visitar ya que ha crecido mucho en los últimos años por el espíritu emprendedor y trabajador de su gente. 
Al ser la agricultura una actividad importante en la zona, María se ha dedicado a trabajar en este negocio desde hace 5 años. Dedica los fines de semana 10 horas a la venta de yuca, plátano y caña y aunque los otros días también realiza ciertos tipos de cuidado a los sembríos, ella paralelamente a la agricultura atiende una tienda de víveres de cuyos ingresos tiene el sustento para todos los días. Ahora María quiere que esta tienda esté más surtida ya que con la experiencia que ha ido adquiriendo sabe los productos que son más demandados por sus clientes y con los cuales a veces no cuenta en stock. Por esta razón María necesita un crédito para comprar mercadería al por mayor para ofrecer variedad de productos en su tienda y con esto obtener mayores ingresos que le ayuden a sustentar los gastos legales para formalizar los documentos que avalan la propiedad de los terrenos en donde ella trabaja. María es una mujer emprendedora y trabajadora que no se ha visto limitada por ningún obstáculo y es por esto que agradece a Fundación Alternativa por la ayuda y la confianza que le han brindado.
texts.en:
María is a 49 year old woman. She studied at primary school and she is married to Hugo who is 56 years old with whom she has three grown children. María was brought up by her parents, and although they had scarce resources, at least they gave her some education and they also taught her about agriculture so that María could obtain a living.

Now María lives with her husband in the city of El Puyo, the capital of the canton of Pastaza Province, a province that is an important part of the Amazon region of Ecuador, in the center of the Amazon jungle.

In the capital of Puyo one can enjoy a pleasant climate and a splendid landscape with rivers, waterfalls, and a variety of flora and fauna which nationals and foreign tourists visit to enjoy themselves at these warm attractions.

Since tourism is one of the most important economic activities, in the city center can easily be found all the tourist services such as hotels, hostels, restaurants, banks, etc. Also, the local people work in agriculture and livestock that are favored because of the fertile land that this place has. Puyo is a city worth visiting as it has grown a lot in the last years through the entrepreneurial spirit and hard work of its people.

Since agriculture is an important activity in the area, María has been doing this work for 5 years. She works 10 hours on the weekends selling cassava, bananas and sugarcane and although the other days she also takes particular steps caring for her crops, at the same time she attends to a grocery store whose income takes care of everyday expenses.

Now María wants to supply this store as through the experience that she has acquired she knows the products that are the most demanded by her clients and which she sometimes does not have in stock. This is why María needs a loan to buy merchandise at wholesale in order to offer a variety of products in her store and thus obtain better income to help her cover the legal expenses to execute the documents to endorse the ownership of the land where she works.

María is an enterprising and hardworking woman who has not been overcome by any obstacle and this is why she is grateful to Fundación Alternative for the help and trust that they have given.

loans.use: to buy groceries to stock the small store which she maintains during the weekdays.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize and sorghum.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize and sorghum.

loans.name: Anna

texts.en:
Anna is 48 years old and lives in Congo Town in Montserrado County, home to Liberia’s largest city, Freeport. She is married with two children aged seven and fifteen years old. Both live at home and attend school.

Anna has been selling palm oil and vegetables for the past three years. She started this business with money given to her by her husband and learned how to sell from her friends. Transportation costs are her main challenge in regards to her enterprise. Her favorite parts about selling are that it gives her money and makes her feel proud of herself. The money she earns helps her to take care of her children.

Anna is applying for a 15,000 LRD loan from BRAC Liberia to buy more palm oil and vegetables such as cassava, potatoes, yams, etc. to resell. Her goal is to build a house for her children.

loans.use: buy more palm oil and vegetables to resell.

loans.name: Dorathy

texts.en:
Dorathy, 41 years old, stopped her education in the 9th grade. She is a single mother who has been working very hard for the past eight years in managing her business. She has four children between the ages of 10 and 27, two of whom are in school and stay at home with their mother. The other two children are independent.

Dorathy sells palm oil in the community market. She sells eleven hours a day, and transports her goods by motorbike to her business area. She makes profit when she sells because she sells good palm oil to her customers. She appreciates the lenders for their continued support towards her business.  She has requested this loan to purchase more gallons of palm oil for the business in order to increase her sales. Her plan is to become a big business woman.

loans.use: to purchase more gallons of palm oil for the business to increase her sales.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize and sorghum.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize and sorghum.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: outfit a washing station and buy chairs, a hair-coloring caddy, dyes and cosmetics.

loans.name: Jamama

texts.en:
Jamama is 25 years old and lives in Montserrado County, which has the largest Freeport and is the number one commercial county in Liberia. She is single with two children, aged seven and four years old, that are attending school and live at home. She has been selling dishware, including bowls, plates, spoons for the past two years. 

She says her main challenge is that there is not enough money to buy goods. She started this business with the help of her friends, and she learned this business from her friends too. Her favorite part about her business is that it helps her to support her home. She is requesting this loan to purchase more dishware, including bowls, plates, and spoons in order to expand her business. In the future she wants to become a big business woman.

loans.use: to purchase more dishes, bowls, plates, spoons and other items to expand her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for jeans, T-shirts, and boots for his business.

loans.name: Nansiede Eve Antonine's Group

texts.fr: Il s'agit d'un groupe composé de deux personnes en caution solidaire. Agée de 35ans, Nansiede Antonine est mariée et mère de trois enfants dont deux sont scolarisés. Le plus âgé et le moins âgé ont respectivement 14ans et 2ans. Elle vend des yaourts FanMilk depuis quelques années et s'approvisionne auprès des grossistes de Fan Milk au Bénin. Soucieuse de renforcer son fonds de roulement et de couvrir les attentes de ses clients, Nansiede Antonine a sollicité et a obtenu un financement auprès de Finadev en vue de maximiser son intérêt et de participer à la scolarisation de ses enfants. Nansiede Antonine se retrouve à gauche dans la photo.
texts.en:
This group is composed of two persons who guarantee one another in solidarity. Nansiede Antonine, aged 35, is married and the mother of two children in school. The oldest and the youngest are 14 and 2 years old, respectively. Nansiede Antonine has been selling FanMilk yogurt for a few years and gets her supplies from FanMilk wholesale merchants in Benin. 

Concerned about bolstering her working capital and meeting the expectations of her customers, Nansiede Antonine requested and obtained financing from Finadev, so as to make the best of her investments and to help cover her children's schooling costs.

Nansiede Antonine is on the left in the photo.

loans.use: to purchase FanMilk yogurt to sell

loans.name: Brigitte's Group

texts.fr: Il s'agit d'un groupe composé de deux femmes en caution solidaire. Agée de 42ans, Brigitte la responsable est veuve et mère de deux enfants scolarisés dont l'aîné est déjà à l'université. Le plus âgé a 22ans et le moins âgé a 15ans. Elle vend du maïs, du riz, du haricot, du mil et d'autres céréales depuis quelques années puis s'approvisionne dans l'un des marchés du Bénin. Dans le souci d'élargir ses activités et de combler les attentes de ses clients, elle a sollicité et a obtenu un financement à Finadev en vue d'accroître son revenu supplémentaire et de participer à la scolarisation de ses enfants. Brigitte se retrouve à gauche dans la photo.
texts.en:
This group is composed of two women who guarantee one another in solidarity. Brigitte, aged 42, is the group's official. She is a widow and the mother of two children in school. The oldest child is a university student at age 22; the youngest is 15. Brigitte has been selling corn, rice, beans, millet, and other grains for a few years. She gets her supplies from one of the markets in Benin. 

Concerned about expanding her business and fulfilling the expectations of her customers, she requested and obtained financing from Finadev, so as to increase her additional revenues and to help cover her children's schooling costs.

Brigitte is on the left in the photo.

loans.use: to purchase corn, rice, beans, and millet to sell

loans.name: Marie

texts.fr: Marie, âgée de 46ans, est mariée et mère de quatre enfants dont trois sont scolarisés. L'aîné et le benjamin ont respectivement 29ans et 04ans. Elle vend des savons, des paquets de spaghetti, de sucre, de cousse cousse et d'autres articles depuis quelques années puis s'approvisionne dans l'un des marchés du Benin. Dans le souci d'accroître sa capacité d'approvisionnement et de répondre favorablement à la demande de sa clientèle, Marie a sollicité et a obtenu un financement auprès de Finadev en vue de maximiser son bénéfice et de participer à la scolarisation de ses enfants.
texts.en: Marie is 46 years old, married, and the mother of four children, of whom three are in school. The oldest and the youngest are 29 and 4 years old, respectively. Marie has been selling soap, packets of spaghetti, sugar, couscous, and other goods for a few years. She gets her supplies from one of the markets in Benin. Concerned about increasing her ability to stock up on supplies and responding favorably to customer demands, Marie requested and obtained financing from  Finadev, so as to maximize her profits and help cover her children's schooling costs.

loans.use: to purchase soaps, canned milk, couscous, and spaghetti to sell

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca is 32 years old and lives in Congo Town. She is single with two children ages six and twelve years old. They are attending school and live at home. She has been selling dry fish for the past fifteen years. She says sometimes customer response to her business is slow. 

Rebecca started this business with money given to her by her husband and she learned this business from her mother. Her favorite part about her business is that it gives her more profit. She is requesting a loan to purchase more dry fish for her business. In the future she wants to become a international businesswoman.

loans.use: to purchase more dry fish for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for jeans, cosmetics, hair products, and hair.

loans.name: Con Dios Adelante Al Progreso 1, 2 & 3 Group

texts.en:
Marina is the coordinator of her group "Con Dios Adelante al Progreso 1, 2 & 3" ("Forward Progress with God"). The group is located in the rural area of San Pedro de Macoris, surrounded by sugar cane fields. She makes her home here in a simple structure with her four children. She is a single mother. Her most difficult challenge has been to raise her children and educate them.

Marina is excited to be seeking her 8th loan with Esperanza. She started doing business almost 9 years ago, at first walking with a bag of clothing, cosmetics and shoes. Now after taking out some loans, she has had increases her sales and has run other business like selling chickens in her community. Marina plans to use this loan to invest in her business and she will buy some live chickens to start selling every day and for Christmas. She will also increase her inventory by buying miscellaneous items. She will use her business profits to reinvest in her business. She thanks all of you for your support.

loans.use: To buy chickens for resale as well as miscellaneous items like clothing, cosmetics and shoes for resale.

loans.name: Maxime Codjo

texts.fr: Agé de 39ans, Maxime Codjo est marié et père de deux enfants scolarisés. Les deux enfants ont respectivement 07ans et 04ans. Il vend des ananas depuis quelques années et s'approvisionne dans l'un des marchés du Bénin. En vue de renforcer son pouvoir d'achat et de répondre à la demande de ses clients, il a sollicité et a obtenu un concours financier à Finadev. Le bénéfice généré par ce concours financier lui permettra de supporter les charges de la famille et de payer la scolarité de ses enfants. Il souhaiterait acquérir des terrains pour en faire un champ d'ananas.
texts.en: Maxime Codjo, aged 39, is married and the father of two children in school. The two children are 7 and 14 years old. Maxime has been selling pineapples for a few years and gets his supplies from one of the markets in Benin. With the aim of bolstering his purchasing power and responding to customer demands, he requested and obtained financial assistance from Finadev. The profits generated from this assistance will enable him to cover family expenses and to pay his children's schooling costs. He would like to acquire some land to establish a field of pineapples.

loans.use: to purchase pineapples

loans.name: Kolu

texts.en:
Kolu is 33 years old and did not attend school. She has two children aged four and eighteen years old who are both in school and doing very well. The family lives in Montserrado County where Freeport, Liberia’s largest and busiest city, is located. While she was displaced from her home during Liberia’s decades of civil war, she now sees her present home in terms of economic opportunity.

With a friend’s assistance Kolu has started selling foodstuffs from a small market table. She is applying for a 20,000 LRD loan from BRAC Liberia to buy more rice, oil, beans, etc. to expand her business. In the near future she hopes to build a house for her children.

loans.use: to buy more rice, oil, beans, etc. to resell.

loans.name: Hassanatu

texts.en: This is 48-year-old Hassanatu. She is widowed and has three children, aged ten, 18, and 28, two of whom attend school. In 2000, Hassanatu established her motorbike parts business. She began her business because she wants to be self-reliant after the loss of her husband. Her business is located in the city center, and her main customers are motorists and mechanics. Working seven days a week and 12 hours a day, she earns about SLL 1,250,000 every month from this business. She would like a loan of SLL 4,000,000. Hassanatu requires a loan to increase her stock of engine oil. In the future, Hassanatu plans to expand the shop and improve her trade in engine oil. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to pay for engine oil.

loans.name: Abdul

texts.en: This is 30-year-old Abdul. He is single and has one child, aged three. In 2009, Abdul established his carpentry and products business. He began his business because he wanted to be self-reliant after finishing his apprenticeship. His business is in the outskirts of the city, and his main customers are adults. Working seven days a week and 12 hours a day, he earns about SLL 1,548,000 every month from this business. He would like a loan of SLL 3,000,000. Abdul needs a loan to buy more timber. He hopes that this loan will increase the products he can make and result in more sales. In the future, Abdul plans to improve the shop and build a showroom. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to pay for timber.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
This is 39-year-old Veronica. She is married and has 3 children aged 17, 12 and 4 years. She has 1 additional dependent.  

In 2002, Veronica established her provisions and drinks business.  She began her business because she was unable to further her education and needed a source of living. Working 7 days a week and 12 hours a day, she earns about SLL 1,000,000 every month from this business. 

Veronica would like a loan in the amount of SLL 4,000,000.  She requires this loan in order to buy more provisions wholesale at a reduced rate. In the future, Veronica plans to expand her business and educate her children. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy drinks and provisions for resale.

loans.name: Fatmata

texts.en:
This is 27-year-old Fatmata. She is married and has 2 children, aged 7 and 4 years.

In 2005, Fatmata established a salon and cosmetics business after her husband encouraged her to engage in business for herself. Working 7 days a week and 10 hours a day, she earns about SLL 650,000 every month from this business. 

Fatmata would like a loan in the amount of SLL 3,000,000. She requires this loan in order to buy more quantities of hair products. 

In the future, Fatmata plans to expand her salon into a cosmetology school to train young girls. She also plans to support her children's education to a very good secondary school. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy hair products for her salon.

loans.name: Abizigirwa Group

texts.fr:
Lela fait partie du groupe Abizigirwa  et   habite à Bujumbura. Elle  a   59 ans et est mariée à  Martin, un chauffeur.  Ils ont  3 enfants adoptifs, âgés de 1  à 11 ans, dont 2 étudient.

Elle fait le commerce de boutique (riz, haricot, sucre,...)  depuis six mois. 

Elle  est à son  cinquième  crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle  obtient, elle  va  augmenter son capital et acheter beaucoup d’articles de sa boutique (riz, haricot, sucre,...) à  revendre .Elle va aussi ouvrir  un cafétaria, pour gagner plus.
texts.en:
Lela is part of the group Abizigirwa. She lives in Bujumbura. She is 59 years old and married to Martin, a driver. They have three adopted children, aged 1 to 11 years old; two of them are students. 

Lela has been a shopkeeper (rice, beans, sugar,…) for six months. 

She is on her fifth loan with Turame. With this KIVA loan she is obtaining, she is going to increase her capital and purchase many goods for her shop (rice, beans, sugar, …) to resell. She is also going to open a cafeteria, so as to earn more.

loans.use: to purchase many goods (rice, beans, sugar,...) for her shop to earn more

loans.name: Hounsou Appolinaire

texts.fr: Appolinaire est âgé de 35ans. Marié et père de trois enfants dont l'aîné est déjà scolarisé. le plus âgé et le moins âgé ont respectivement 07ans et 01an. Il a une grande boutique où il vend des paquets de spaghetti, des boîtes de conserve, du lait, du savon et d'autres articles depuis quelques années. Il s'approvisionne dans l'un des marchés du Bénin et de l'extérieur. Dans le souci de renforcer son capital et de satisfaire les exigences de ses clients, il a sollicité et a obtenu un financement auprès de Finadev. Les intérêts issus de ce financement lui permettront de payer la scolarisation de son enfant et de supporter les charges de la famille. Il souhaiterait acquérir une parcelle.
texts.en:
Appolinaire is 35 years old. He is married and the father of three, of whom the oldest is already in school. The oldest and the youngest are 7 and 1 years old, respectively. Appolinaire has a large store where he has been selling packets of spaghetti, canned foods, milk, soap, and other goods for a few years. He gets his supplies form one of the markets in Benin and from abroad. 

Concerned about bolstering his capital and satisfying the requirements of his customers, he requested and obtained financing from Finadev. The [profits] from this financing will enable him to cover his children's schooling costs, as well as family expenses. He would like to acquire a plot of land.

loans.use: to purchase soap, milk, and spaghetti to sell

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is a 69-year-old married woman. She has nine grandchildren ranging from 21 to four years in age. She describes herself as a hardworking woman.

For the past forty years Sarah has run a dairy from which she sells milk. Her main customers are from the surrounding countryside. She describes her biggest business challenge to be outbreaks of bovine diseases.

Sarah is applying for a 12,900 KES loan, her first from SMEP DTM, to buy a solar lamp to be used by her grandchildren and six other family members. Her ambitions include seeing her dairy grow and running a big hotel in her hometown.

loans.use: to buy a solar lamp.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer for her farm.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.en:
Rosa is single and 39 years old. In 2005, Rosa established a business selling drinks, pure water and mobile phone recharge cards in order to empower herself to meet her basic needs. Rosa works 7 days a week and 10 hours each day; she earns about SLL 1,100,000 every month from this business. 

Rosa would like a loan in the amount of SLL 4,000,000 to buy more drinks, pure water and mobile phone recharge cards for her business. In the future, Rosa plans to build a house and expand her business. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more drinks, pure water and mobile phone recharge cards for her business.

loans.name: Lieu

texts.en:
Lieu was born in 1969. She has two children: one is a soldier, and the other, a farmer. Her husband grows rice. Lieu raises chickens to earn a living. She gains 3,000,000 VND a month. Her family’s total earnings are about 10,000,000 VND per month. 

She has participated in SEDA's credit program since 2007. In the last cycle, she borrowed 5,152,000 VND and repaid the loan on time. In this loan cycle, she would like to borrow 6,944,000 VND to buy food for her chickens.

loans.use: to buy food for her chickens.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is a 38-year-old married woman. She has 4 children with ages ranging from 6 months to 16 years. She describes herself to be a focused and hard working woman. 

Maria operates a farm where she sells farm produce such as cereals. She has been involved in this business for ten years. Her business is local and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be the high cost of transportation (delivery) of cereal to customers. Her business goal is to buy three more acres of land to plant maize, beans, etc. within the next five years. Maria hopes that in the future, she will improve her business. 

This is Maria's first loan with SMEP DTM. She will use the KES12,900 loan to buy a solar lamp which will be used by her  family.

loans.use: to buy a solar lamp.

loans.name: Massa

texts.en:
