This is 45-year-old Massa. She is divorced and has five children between the ages of 14 and 28. She has two additional dependents living with her to help an elder sister and assist in schooling. 

In 2005, Massa established a general store, selling drinks, provisions, toiletries and cement. She began her business so she could be self-reliant after divorcing her husband. Her business is located in the city center and her main customers are all ages and sexes. Working 7 days a week and 14 hours a day, she earns about SLL 1,800,000 every month from this business. 

She would like a loan in the amount of SLL 5,000,000. Massa has already received and successfully repaid five loans, and now requires a new loan in order to buy additional inventory for her store. She hopes that this loan will improve her stocks. In the future, Massa plans to improve her business by opening another shop at the outskirts of town. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To pay for additional inventory for her general store.

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma is a 39 year old married woman and a mother of two children from Loboc, Bohol. She is engaged in hog raising business for more than 10 years now.
Alma is asking for a loan to buy additional piglets and feeds . 
In the future, Alma hopes of making her hog raising business a success.

loans.use: to buy additional piglets and feeds

loans.name: Eleuteria

texts.en:
Eleuteria is a 50-year-old married woman with three grown children from Garcia, Bohol. She has been engaged in a sari sari or variety store business for two years now. She earns 5,000 PHP monthly. This is the source of her income and is used to support their daily needs.

Eleuteria is requesting a loan to buy soft drinks, noodles, salt, sugar, food snacks, canned goods and etc. Through this loan, her store will contain lots of items to attract the attention of nearby customers.

In the future, Eleuteria dreams of expanding her business and making more profit.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, noodles, salt, sugar, food snacks and canned goods.

loans.name: Rufina

texts.en:
Rufina is a 59 year old married woman and a mother of five children from Loboc, Bohol. She is engaged in coconut wine selling business for several years  now. Her husband works as a carpenter.
Rufina is asking for a loan to buy more coconut wine to sell. 
In the future, Rufina hopes of making her business a success. Moreover, she also plans of exploring other ventures to augment her income.

loans.use: to buy more coconut wine to sell

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie is a 41-year-old married woman from Bohol, Philippines. She is the mother of four children. She has been earning a living through her sari-sari or variety store business for several years now.

Rosemarie is asking for a loan to buy additional stock to sell like canned goods, noodles, rice, soda, soap and toiletries. Through this, she will be able to attract and cater to more customers and buyers in her store. 

In the future, Rosemarie hopes of making her business a success and sustainable. She also wants to save money for the schooling of her children.

loans.use: to buy additional stock to sell like canned goods, noodles, rice, soda, soap and toiletries.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase the items she sells for resale; specifically clothing, bridal lingerie, cosmetics, perfumes and undergarments.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more provisions and food.

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas Group

texts.es: El banco comunal Mujeres Unidas está conformado por 11 integrantes, madres solteras con 20 hijos bajo su responsabilidad. Estas mujeres se caterizan por ser trabajadoras, responsables. Ellas son originarias del sauce lugar que está ubicado en la zona norte del país. El sauce se caracteriza por ser una zona productora de leche y sus derivados, la crianza de cerdos, ganados, gallinas. Estas integrantes decidieron unirse para beneficiarse del crédito.  Oneyda es la coordinadora del banco la cual se encarga de la responsabilidad del banco en cuanto a las cuotas en tiempo y forma. Ella tiene por actividad económica una pulpería ubicado en su casa de habitación, una pulpería es una pequeña tienda que vende producto comestible y en cantidades  pequeñas como sobre de café, sobre de shampoo, arroz, frijoles, pan, leche, cuajada. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su pulpería para brindar mejor servicios a sus clientes. El banco comunal  Mujeres Unidas agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva le ofrecen a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
Mujeres Unidas Communal Bank is made up of 11 members, single mothers with 20 children in their care.  These women are known for being hardworking and responsible.  They're from El Sauce, located in the northern part of the country.  El Sauce is known for producing milk and dairy products and for raising pigs, livestock, and chickens.  These members decided to get together to take advantage of a loan.

Oneyda is the coordinator of the bank.  She's responsible for the amount and punctuality of the payments to the bank.  Her job is a "pulpería" located in her house.  A pulpería is a small store that sells food products in small amounts, such as envelopes of coffee or shampoo, rice, beans, milk, and curd.

The goal of the loan is to invest in working capital and stock her grocery store to give her customers better service.

Mujeres Unidas Communal Bank is grateful for the help Kiva lenders give to low-income people and poor countries such as Nicaragua so they can have decent jobs.

loans.use: to stock her store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cosmetics for resale.

loans.name: Azul Group

texts.en:
The Trust Bank, "Azul" meaning "blue" is located in the rural town of Chuicabit in the state of Quetzaltenango. Comprised of eleven enthusiastic women, the group was formed around four years ago. At least 88% of the women never attended school. Their average age is 35 years old. The ladies of "Azul" are involved in various kinds of businesses such as agriculture, commerce (buying and selling fruit and vegetables), and animal husbandry.

The current president of "Azul" is 31-year-old Irma. She has three children ranging in age from six to thirteen, each of whom is enrolled in primary school. Irma did not have the opportunity to study and she realizes how important education is for her children. She and her husband strive each day to provide the necessary things for their children, focusing on good nutrition and health as well as education.

Irma is a talented seamstress. She sews aprons and embroiders blouses. Her current goal is to buy a variety of fabrics to fill orders for aprons that she has received. Irma is anxious to secure another micro-loan from Friendship Bridge so that she can meet the increased demand that comes at this time of the year. She is on her 5th loan cycle. Irma points out that micro-loans are a great way to move ahead, especially in small rural communities of Guatemala.

Irma, along with the ten women of "Azul," wish to express their gratitude to all KIVA investors, who they feel bonded with because of these loans. The loans are especially important at this time of the year for each of the women because of the year-end holidays. The women wish all who are involved in KIVA much prosperity and happiness in the coming year.

loans.use: To buy fabric to make aprons for sale.

loans.name: Tity

texts.en:
This is 44-year-old Tity. She is married and has 4 children aged 21, 19, 8 and 4 years old.  In 2008, Tity established a charcoal business. She began her business because she wants to assist her husband in taking care of the home. 

Working 7 days a week and 11 hours a day, she earns about SLL1,800,000 every month from this business. She would like a loan of SLL3,000,000. She needs this new loan in order to buy bags of charcoal. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately SLL 300,000. In the future, Tity plans to educate her children up to university level. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy palm oil for her business.

loans.name: Creciendo Para El Futuro 4, 5 & 6 Group

texts.en:
Juana is the coordinator of her group, "Creciendo Para el Futuro 4, 5 & 6" ("Growing for the Future"). Her group is located in Samana, a lush and rugged peninsula with a new and still undeveloped tourism industry. She is a single mother with a 4 children. Juana wants to establish her business by building a local shop on a plot of land next to her house.

Having repaid her previous loans, and because her business has grown, Juana is excited to be taking her 8th loan with Esperanza. She has had her retail clothing and shoe sales business for around four years. 

Juana plans to use this loan to invest in her business by buying many dozen of each product in order to sell them for the Christmas season. She will use the additional profits to save and and to supply some of the needs of her children and for her home. Juana dreams of becoming professional and having a successful business. This Esperanza associate began with us to access loans for her business. She thanks you all for your support!!

loans.use: To buy clothes and shoes for resale.

loans.name: Alberta

texts.en:
Alberta is single with no children. She has received schooling through the Junior High School. 

Alberta sells clothing and jewelry at Wegbe near Hohoe and has been doing this since 2009. Alberta uses her income to pay for her personal expenses like rent and clothing. 

Alberta will use the loan to purchase more clothing for resale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Alberta plans to reinvest back into her business.

loans.use: to purchase more clothing for resale.

loans.name: Stella

texts.en:
Stella is married with 4 children. Her husband is a farmer. Stella has received no formal education. 

Stella is a food vendor at Wegbe near Hohoe. She has been cooking food for sale for the past 10 years. Stella uses her income to help pay for the family’s expenses, such as school fees, food and so on. 

Stella will use the loan to purchase foodstuffs and ingredients for the preparation of the food she sells. With the new profits from her expanded business, Stella plans to introduce new dishes to the menu.

loans.use: to purchase foodstuffs and ingredients for the preparation of the food she sells.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is married with 3 dependents. Her husband is a farmer. She has received a middle-school education. 

Josephine is a fishmonger and also sells other foodstuffs at Wegbe near Hohoe. She has been selling fish and foodstuffs for 16 years now. She is responsible for feeding of the family and a few other of the family’s expenses. 

Josephine's loan will be used to buy more foodstuffs from the farmers for resale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to increase her capital, which will enable her to increase sales.

loans.use: to buy more foodstuffs from the farmers for resale.

loans.name: Banco Comunal Corazon De Jesus Group

texts.es: El banco comunal Corazón de Jesús está conformado por nueve integrantes un hombre y ocho mujeres, todos padres de familia con 20 hijos bajo su responsabilidad. Ellos son originarios del Sauce lugar que está ubicado en la zona norte del país. Estos integrantes se caracterizan por ser trabajadores, responsables. Melida es la coordinadora del banco la cual se encarga de la responsabilidad del de las cuotas de pagos de los integrantes que la realicen en tiempo y forma. Ella tiene por actividad económica una pulpería ubicada en su casa de habitación. Una pulpería es una tienda que vende productos de consumo diario y en cantidades pequeñas como sobre de café, arroz, frijoles, azúcar, leche, pan, detergentes. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio. El banco comunal Corazón de Jesús agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva les brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
The communal bank “Corazón de Jesús” (Heart of Jesus) is composed of nine members: one man and eight women, all parents with 20 children under their responsibility.  They come from Sauce, a place that is located in the northern part of the country.  These members are characterized as being hard-working and responsible.  

Melida is the coordinator of the bank and is in charge of the responsibility of the payment installments of the members and the time and manner in which they fulfill them.  She has as her economic activity a “pulpería” located in the house where she lives.  A “pulpería” is a store that sells products of daily consumption and in small quantities like packets of coffee, rice, beans, sugar, milk, bread and detergents.  The objective of the loan is to invest in working capital and stock the business.  

The communal bank “Corazón de Jesús” is grateful for the help that the Kiva lenders provide to people of limited resources and poor countries such as Nicaragua so that they can have a way to work with dignity.

loans.use: to invest in working capital and to purchase products for daily consumption like coffee packets, rice, beans, sugar, bread and detergents.

loans.name: Paulina

texts.en: Paulina sells foodstuffs, including cassava dough, which is commonly added to corn dough and to prepare a local meal called banku. She normally sells her food stuff at Wegbe, near Hohoe. Paulina has received no formal education. She is married and has 8 dependents. Her husband is a commercial driver. Paulina has been selling foodstuffs for 6 years now. She is responsible for assisting her husband in taking care of the family’s expenses. Her loan will be used to buy more ingredients and cassava to prepare cassava dough for resale. She hopes to reinvest her new profits in her business.

loans.use: to buy more ingredients and cassava to make cassava dough for resale.

loans.name: Peace

texts.en: Peace sells cooking utensils and sleeping mats at Wegbe, near Hohoe. Peace received a middle school education. She is married and has 6 dependents. Her husband is a farmer. Peace has been selling cooking utensils and sleeping mats for some time now. She is responsible for paying her children’s school fees and other expenses. She will use her loan to buy more cooking utensils and sleeping mats for resale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to introduce other goods that are in high demand in her area.

loans.use: to buy cooking utensils and sleeping mats for resale.

loans.name: Ann Thakurani Self Help Group

texts.en: In 2012, 12 women from Balugaon village stepped out, decided to build a secure future for their family and formed a group named Ann Thakurani Self Help Group. The members of Ann Thakurani Self Help Group are all women from the district of Khurda in Odisha, India. One of them is Mrs. Lili, who was selected as their president. The lady standing in the middle wearing a cream-colored sari with a red floral print in the photo is Lili. Lili is 32 years old and is staying with her husband and her four children. Her husband is a farmer and has been involved in cultivation for a long time. She got the idea of doing vegetable cultivation from her husband, so she gathered some other women from her neighborhood and told them about her plan. They liked her idea and appreciated her. She took on leadership of the group and started to cultivate vegetables and sell them in her village. Initially, she started growing only a few vegetables like potatoes, tomatoes, and onions, but later on she grew bitter gourd, snake gourd, cucumbers, ladyfingers and brinjal (eggplant). She has a very good relationship with her customers as she sells fresh vegetables to her customers. Now she has a new idea of purchasing some more land for cultivation so that she can grow more vegetables on a large scale, for which she has requested a loan to purchase land, seeds and fertilizers.

loans.use: to purchase land, fertilizers, seeds, manure etc. for vegetable cultivation.

loans.name: Charity

texts.en: Charity sells fish and jewelry at Wegbe near Hohoe. Charity has received no formal education.  She is married and has four dependants. Her husband sells drinks. Charity has been selling fish and jewelry for five years now. Her loan will be used to buy more jewelry for resale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to add to her capital to increase her stock.

loans.use: to buy more jewelry for resale

loans.name: Vivian

texts.en: Vivian sells provisions and foodstuffs at Wegbe near Hohoe. Vivian has received no formal education. She is married to a carpenter. Vivian has been selling provisions for some time now. Her loan will be used to buy more foodstuffs and groceries for resale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to reinvest in her business.

loans.use: to buy more foodstuffs and groceries for resale.

loans.name: Charlse

texts.en:
Charlse is 32 years old and lives in the town of Lyantonde in the Mbarara region of Uganda. He is married and has three children, with two of them currently in school. For the past 10 years, Charlse has been working hard to manage his retail shop, which sells sugar, salt and cooking oil. 

To help expand his business, Charlse has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more essential commodities such as milk, cooking oil, sugar and salt to attract more customers, and will help Charlse to generate greater profits and pay his children's school fees and medical bills. Charlse hopes that in the future he will be able to build a big commercial house. 

Charlse is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Charlse who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to purchase more essential commodities such as milk, cooking oil, sugar and salt to attract more customers.

loans.name: Charity

texts.en: Charity is married and has two children. She has received a middle school education. Charity sells provisions at Wegbe near Hohoe. She has been doing this business for three years now. Her husband is a commercial driver. Charity will use the loan to purchase groceries for resale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Charity plans to add to her capital to increase sales..

loans.use: to purchase groceries for resale

loans.name: Brampah

texts.en: Brampah is married and has one child. She has received a Junior High School education. Brampah is a petty trader and a fishmonger at Alavanyo, Hohoe.  She has been doing petty trading for the past six years and decided to be a fishmonger when she realized that she needed extra funds to cater to her only child. Her husband is a local herbalist who doesn’t value education. Brampah uses her income to pay for her child’s school fees. Brampah will use the loan to purchase more fish to smoke. With the new profits from her expanded business, Brampah plans to save and own a bigger fridge for storage.

loans.use: to purchase more fish to smoke.

loans.name: Virgen Del Pilar Group

texts.es:
Es un grupo que va por su tercer ciclo. Son de la ciudad de Lambaré y todas sus miembros son mujeres muy trabajadoras que se esfuerzan por salir adelante y por dar a sus hijos todo lo que necesitan para ser personas de bien.
Cynthia, una de las miembros, se dedica a la venta de todo tipo de platerías, con lo que ayuda a su familia  y tiene los medios para poder cubrir los gastos que día a día surgen. Ella es una persona que quiere salir adelante, y lo muestra con todo el esfuerzo que hace.
Solicita de esta ayuda para poder comprar joyas y seguir vendiendo y con esos ingresos ayudar a su familia.
texts.en:
This group is in its third loan cycle. They are from the city of Lambaré and all of the members are very hardworking women that are driven to get ahead in life to give their children all that they need so that they become good decent people.

Cynthia, one of the members, works selling all kinds of silver with help from her family she has the means to meet the day to day expenses that come up. She is a woman that wants to get ahead in life and shows it with all the effort that she puts into her work.

She needs this loan to buy jewelry and keep selling them. With the income she wants to help her family.

loans.use: buy silver jewelry to sell.

loans.name: Junta De Saneamiento Chololó Group

texts.es:
La Junta de Saneamiento Chololó - fue fundada en el año 2.008, actualmente cuenta con 781 usuarios. El Presidente electo en la última asamblea ordinaria es el Sr. Ascención, los demás miembros de la comisión son el Sr. Justino, Carlos, todos ellos forman parte de la comisión y son los representantes de la comunidad electos por la misma.
Ellos proveen de este servicio fundamental a esta comunidad de la ciudad de Paraguarí, con lo cual ayudan a las personas que más lo necesitan. El deseo de esta junta de saneamiento es el de poder seguir creciendo y el día de mañana llegar a más personas, ya que son de la idea que todas las personas tienen derecho a gozar de este servicio.
El crédito fue solicitado para la compra y reparación de bomba y transformador de la aguatería
texts.en:
The Chololó Sanitation Board was founded in 2008 and currently has 781 members.  Ascención was elected President at the last regular meeting.  The other members of the committee are Justino and Carlos.  They are all members of the committee and they are community representatives who are elected by the people.  

They provide this essential service in this community in the city of Paraguarí and help people who need it most.  They hope that this sanitation board can continue to grow and reach more people since they believe that all people have the right to this service.  

They have requested this loan to purchase and repair the water pump and transformer.

loans.use: to purchase and repair the water pump and transformer.

loans.name: Tsorkor

texts.en: Tsorkor is a seamstress from Alavanyo, Hohoe. Tsorkor has received a formal education but only up to the Junior High School level.  She is a young, single lady. Tsorkor has been sewing for the past two years. She is responsible for her general upkeep. Her loan will be used to buy and sell cloth in large quantity since her customers who want to sew buy cloth from her. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save for her future.

loans.use: to buy cloth in a large quantity

loans.name: Kporvuvu

texts.en: Kporvuvu is a hairdresser in a community called Alavanyo, Hohoe. Kporvuvu has received a Junior High School education.  She is single. Kporvuvu has been a hairdresser since 2009. She is responsible for herself and her younger sibling. Her loan will be used to buy hair relaxers, wigs and pins since her customers have increased. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to open a bigger salon.

loans.use: to buy hair relaxers, wigs and pins

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize and sorghum.

loans.name: Sara

texts.es:
La Sra. Sara es soltera y vive con sus padres, ella está administrando su propia carnicería, en un local que ella misma mando construir con sus propios ingresos. Ella es una persona que desde joven ha tenido que luchar y trabajar y hoy en día esta creciendo gracias a su esfuerzo y sacrificio.
Sara ya tiene muy buena clientela gracias a que es una buena carnicera y siempre ofrece muy buenos servicios a sus clientes. Gracias al trabajo que está realizando ayuda con sus ingresos a su familia para una mejor calidad de vida.
Ella solicita de este crédito para la compra de cortes de carnes, con los cuales podrá seguir trabajando y dando buena variedad a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Mrs. Sara is single and lives with her parents, she is managing her own butcher’s shop that she contracted to be made with her own income. From a very young age she had to work hard and is growing thanks to all of her hard work and sacrifice.

Sara has a good customer base because she is a good butcher and always offers good customer service. Due to the work that she is doing, she has enough income to help her family have a better quality of life.

Sara needs the loan to buy different cuts of meat to keep working and offering a good variety of products to her customers.

loans.use: buy cuts of meat to sell.

loans.name: Mujeres Emprendedoras Group

texts.es:
El comité se llama “Mujeres Emprendedoras” en homenaje a las mujeres que buscan su progreso. Se encuentra en el Primer Ciclo con 13 integrantes. Cada una con sus respectivas actividades y quienes aun no la tienen quieren poder emprender una.
Liliana, quien es parte de este grupo se dedica a la venta de ropas, siempre está con muy buena variedad que ofrece a sus clientes, y gracias a eso se hizo de muy buena clientela. Es una persona muy trabajadora, a quien le gusta lo que hace por ser un trabajo digno y por sobre todo honesto.
Solicita Liliana de este crédito para poder comprar remeras, pantalones, jeans, y demás prendas, para poder seguir teniendo la variedad que ofrecer siempre a sus clientes.
texts.en:
The “Enterprising Women” communal bank is in honor of women who want to get ahead in life. This is their first loan and the group is made up of 13 members. Each of the members have different jobs and those who do not want to start their own.

Liliana is a member of this group, she sells clothing and always has a good variety of merchandize to offer her customers and thanks to that she has a loyal customer base. She is a very hardworking woman who enjoys what she does because it is dignified work but above all because it is honest.

Liliana needs the loan to buy shirts, pants, jeans, and other items of clothing to keep having different types of merchandize to offer her customers.

loans.use: buy shirts, pants, jeans, and other items of clothing.

loans.name: Virgen De Las Gracias 2 Group

texts.es:
El comité Virgen de las Gracias 2 es de la Ciudad de Caaguazú, es integrada por 12 señoras emprendedoras, ellas son mujeres humildes y trabajadoras que buscan un mejor porvenir para ellas y sus familias.
Vilma, quien es parte de este grupo, comenta que tiene una despensa, y que este negocio es el que la ayuda a seguir adelante y ayudar a su familia. Todos los días trabaja desde muy tempranas horas y termina muy tarde, ya que tiene mucha clientela y demanda.
Solicita de este crédito para la compra de verduras, carnes, bebidas y demás productos para poder surtir su local y dar así una buena variedad a sus clientes, lo cual le ayudará a tener más clientes nuevos.
texts.en:
The “Virgin of Thanks 2” communal bank is located in the city of Caaguazú, it is made up of 12 enterprising women who are very humble and hardworking and want to find a better future for their families and themselves.

Vilma is a member of this group, she has a small grocery store, this business helps her to get ahead in life and to provide for her family. Everyday she begins work very early in the morning and ends very late at night since she has a lot of customers and demand for her products.

Vilma needs this loan to buy vegetables, meats, beverages and other products to stock her small grocery store and to provide a good variety of merchandize which in turn will help her acquire new customers.

loans.use: buy vegetables, meats, beverages and other products.

loans.name: Kuña Katupyry Group

texts.es:
El comité Kuña Katupyry es de la ciudad Lambaré. Actualmente están en el segundo ciclo, y quieren poder seguir creciendo y así seguir ayudando a sus familias para poder darles un futuro mejor.
Una de estas mujeres es la Sra. Bernarda, quien vende calzados de segunda mano. Ya que hoy en día la vida es muy difícil, y muchas personas no tienen el dinero para poder comprarse zapatos nuevos, es por eso que se inspira y se dedica a este negocio. Está saliendo adelante ya que tiene buena clientela.
Solicita de este crédito para poder comprar más calzados para poder venderlos y así seguir dando a su clientela lo que piden.
texts.en:
The Kuña Katupyry communal bank is located in the city of Lambaré. This is their second loan and they want to continue to grow to keep helping their families and provide a better future for them.

One of the members is Mrs. Bernarda, she sells second hand shoes. Since life today is very difficult and many people don’t have money to buy new shoes, Mrs. Bernarda was inspired and started her business. She is getting ahead since she has a good customer base.

Mrs. Bernarda wants this loan to buy more shoes to sell them and to keep giving her customers what they want.

loans.use: buy second had shoes to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase wood for making furniture to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more palm oil for her business

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en: Evelyn is divorced and has two children. She has received schooling, but only up to a junior high school level. Evelyn is a petty trader who deals in jewelry and hair accessories in Alavanyo, Hohoe, which she has been doing for the past three years. Evelyn uses her income to look after her children since her husband does not cater to them. Evelyn will use the loan to purchase more goods like jewelry and hair accessories to sell. With the profit from her expanded business, Evelyn plans to save for her children’s future.

loans.use: To purchase more goods like jewelry and hair accessories to sell

loans.name: Amanfo

texts.en:
Amanfo is not married but has two children. She has received schooling through junior high school. Amanfo is a petty trader in Alavanyo, Hohoe, which she has done for eight years. Amanfo uses her income for the upkeep and school fees of her children. 

Amanfo will use the loan to purchase and introduce mother-care products that the customers are demanding. With the new profits from her expanded business, Amanfo plans to save and increase her capital and expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase and introduce mother-care products that the customers are demanding.

loans.name: Abdul

texts.en:
This is 26-year-old Abdul. He is married and has one child, aged 1 year. He has four additional dependents.  

In 2004, Abdul established his provisions and drinks business. He began his business because after his high school education, there was no job. Working seven days a week and 12 hours a day, he earns about 1,428,000 Le (Sierra Leone leones) every month from this business. 

He would like a loan in the amount of Le 4,000,000. Abdul requires a loan in order to buy more stock. In the future, Abdul plans to erect his own house and open a bigger shop. He is thanking you for your support.

loans.use: to pay for drinks and provisions.

loans.name: Ñepytyvo Group

texts.es:
El presente comité se encuentra, en su 8vo ciclo. Podemos resaltar el sentido de pertenencia, responsabilidad del grupo que se ve reflejada en sus pagos. Todas las señoras son de escasos recursos pero no le impide a cumplir con sus responsabilidades. Trabajan todas por sacar adelante a su familia y darles todo lo que necesita para una vida digna.
Alba, la presidenta, se dedica a la costura, tiene un pequeño tallercito donde hace todo tipo de trabajos y con lo cual puede ayudar a su familia. Ella es una persona muy trabajadora y emprendedora, que con mucho sacrificio y esfuerzo está saliendo adelante y día a día va mejorando en todo lo que hace.
Alba quiere seguir creciendo y es por eso que solicita de este crédito, para poder invertirlo en la compra de telas, hilos, gomas y demás, para poder usarlos en las confecciones que realiza y cumplir así con sus clientes.
texts.en:
The present communal bank is on their 8th loan cycle. We can highlight the group's sense of ownership and responsibility which are reflected in their payments. All of the ladies are of scarce resources but this doesn't stop them from fulfilling their responsibilities. They all work to keep their families ahead and give them all they need for a dignified life. 
Alba, the president, makes a living sewing; she has a little shop where she does all types of work that allow her to help her family. She is a hardworking and entrepreneurial person that with a lot of sacrifice and effort is getting ahead and improving everyday in all she does. Alba wants to keep growing, that is why she is requesting this loan to invest in the purchase of fabric, thread, elastics and more. She will use these materials in the confection of her work and thus fulfill her customers' needs.

loans.use: to purchase fabric, thread, elastics and more.

loans.name: Florence

texts.fr: Agée de 33ans, Florence est mariée et mère de trois enfants dont deux sont scolarisés. Le plus âgé et le moins âgé ont respectivement 12ans et 1an. Elle vend des paquets de spaghetti, des boîtes de conserve, des savons et d'autres articles depuis un an puis s'approvisionne dans l'un des marchés du Bénin. Dans le but d'augmenter son pouvoir d'achat et de satisfaire la demande de ses clients, Florence a sollicité et a obtenu un micro crédit à Finadev en vue d'accroître son revenu additionnel et de participer à la scolarisation de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Florence is 33 years old, married, and the mother of three children, two of whom are in school.  Her oldest and youngest children are respectively 12 years old and 1 year old.

She has been selling boxes of spaghetti, canned foods, soaps and other goods for one year, stocking up from a market located in Bénin.

In order to increase her purchasing power and to meet the demand from her customers, Florence has requested and obtained a micro-loan from Finadev.  This loan will be used to increase her additional income and to contribute to her children's school fees.

loans.use: to buy 1/4 box of spaghetti, 20 boxes of milk, 15 cans of tomatoes and 1/4 box of palmida soap.

loans.name: Elisa

texts.es:
La Sra. Elisa vive en la ciudad de Encarnación, es casada tiene un hijo. Ella es dueña de una despensa bien surtida hace más de 4 años; Cabe destacar que trabaja con toda su familia y le va muy bien. Su marido trae productos desde posadas y distribuye por el barrio y las colonias en su propio vehículo.
Gracias a este negocio y al trabajo de toda la familia han podido crecer muchísimo y lo siguen haciendo. Quieren poder ir agrandando su despensa, hasta tener un gran super donde pueda ofrecer mayor variedad y confort a sus clientes.
Solicita Elisa de este crédito para la compra de bebidas, panificados, verduras, frutas, carne y demás para poder seguir dando buena variedad a sus clientes, ya que eso es lo que más les atrae.
texts.en:
Ms. Elisa lives in the city of Encarnación. She is married and has one son. She is the owner of a well-stocked general store which she has had for over four years. It is worth noting that she works with her whole family and it is going very well. Her husbands brings merchandise from Posadas and makes deliveries around the neighborhood and suburbs in his own vehicle. Thanks to this business and the work of the entire family they have been able to grow considerably and are continuing to grow. They want to be able to expand their shop until they have a large supermarket where they might offer greater variety and comfort to their customers. 

Elisa is seeking this loan for the purchase of drinks, bakery items, vegetables, fruits, meat and other products in order to be able to keep providing a good variety to her customers since that is what draws them the most.

loans.use: to purchase drinks, bakery items, vegetables, fruit, meat and other items.

loans.name: Heliodora

texts.es:
La señora Heliodora tiene 60 años, está casada desde hace mucho tiempo con el señor Pedro, tienen un hijo, ya mayor, y viven en su propia casa en la ciudad de Encarnación.
La señora Heliodora es comerciante desde hace varios años, tiene un Mini mercado bien surtido en su casa. Tiene mucha clientela en la zona ya que venden todo tipo de productos de primera necesidad, bebidas, artículos para el hogar, ropas y otros. Su local ha ido creciendo de a poco ya que empezaron con una pequeña despensa y luego fueron ampliando cada vez más. Su esposo y su hijo le ayudan en la atención del negocio. Además de esto ellos tienen en su casa habitaciones para alquilar, lo que también les ayuda mucho. Gracias a estas actividades ellos han podido salir adelante, mantener su hogar y solventar cualquier gasto imprevisto.
La señora ha solicitado este crédito para realizar algunos arreglos en su vivienda, ya que algunas habitaciones que alquila necesitan ser reparadas, y así seguir dando un buen servicio a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Heliodora is 60 years old. She has been married to Pedro for a long time and they have one son, who is grown up. They live in their own house in the city of Encarnacion. 
Heliodora has been a shop keeper for a number of years. She has a well-stocked mini supermarket in her house. She has many customers in the area, as they sell all kinds of basic food products, drinks, household goods, clothes and other things. Her shop has expanded gradually. They started with a small stock of food, and added to it more and more. Her husband and son help her to look after the business. Apart from this, they have rooms to let in their house, which is a great help. Thanks to these activities they have been able to survive, maintain their home and meet any unforeseen expenses. 
Heliodora has applied for this loan in order to make some improvements to her house, as some of the rooms that they rent out are in need of repair, and in this way, to continue to offer good service to their customers.

loans.use: to repair her house.

loans.name: Elida

texts.es:
La señora Elida es separada vive actualmente sola. Tiene un hijo mayor de edad que en la actualidad se encuentra por la Argentina, y el cual la ayuda desde allí.
Nos cuenta que para poder empezar este negocio tuvo que viajar a la Argentina a trabajar, fue ahí donde aprendió el oficio de modista ya que trabajaba en una fábrica de camperas como costurera y al transcurrir los años pudo  ahorrar y así regresar a su país, comprar una  máquina de coser y empezar con su negocio. Actualmente es una de las personas más conocidas en la confección de prendas de vestir, camperas, cortinas, sábanas, etc.
El préstamo solicitado será destinado para la compra de telas y otros artículos para poder cumplir con la demanda de sus clientes, así pretende brindarles una mayor atención y rapidez.
texts.en:
Elida is separated and lives alone at the moment. She has a grown up son who is in Argentina at present. He sends her help from there.
Elida relates that, in order to start her business she had to travel to Argentina to work. It was there that she learnt the trade of dressmaker, working as a seamstress in a factory producing wind cheater jackets. She was able to save money over the years, and as a result, was able to return to her own country, buy a sewing machine and start up her business. At the present time, she is one of the best known people for sewing articles of clothing, jackets, curtains, sheets etc.
The loan that Elida has applied for is intended for the purchase of fabrics and other articles, so as to be able to satisfy her customer’s wishes. In this way, she intends to offer them better service and more speed.

loans.use: to buy fabrics and other sewing articles.

loans.name: María

texts.es:
María es madre soltera ella tiene 2 hijos vive con su madre, María es una persona trabajadora, emprendedora y muy responsable en sus actividades ya que desea cumplir sus metas. María  trabaja con su madre en la crianza de animales (cerdos rosados), se dedican a este negocio desde hace mucho tiempo ya que buscaron la manera de buscar ingresos para su hogar, además este negocio es la única fuente de ingresos económicos que tienen por tal motivo María le pone mucho empeño y amor a su trabajo.

María realiza un nuevo crédito en Fodemi el mismo que será invertido en la compra de chanchos pequeños y en la construcción de chancheras grandes para un buen manejo de en su crianza y reproducción. 

María sueña en seguir trabajando en la crianza de cerdos y ser una pequeña distribuidora para los mercados de la ciudad, sus dos pequeños hijos la motivan para cumplir este sueño que ella tanto anhela.
texts.en:
María is a single mother with 2 children. She lives with her mother. María is hardworking, enterprising and very responsible in her activities as she wants to achieve her goals. María works with her mother raising animals (pink pigs). They have been running this business for a long time. They set up the business because they wanted to earn income for their household. It is the family’s only source of income and so María puts a lot of effort and love into her work.

María is requesting another loan from Fodemi. She will also use this loan to buy young pigs, and in the construction of large pig pens which will improve how she raises and breeds the pigs. 

María’s dream is to continue working as a pig farmer and to become a small distributor for city markets. Her two small children are her motivation for making this dream a reality.

loans.use: to buy young pigs and in the construction of pig pens

loans.name: Basilio

texts.es:
El Sr. Basilio tiene 50 años, está casado con la Sra. Josefina de 49 años, tienen tres hijos, por quienes ambos se esfuerzan para poder darles todo lo que necesitan para sus estudios, ya que quieren que el día de mañana sean personas de bien.
Anteriormente en Sr. Basilio trabajaba como empleado, de ahí salió y formo su propia empresa, se dedica al mantenimiento de piscinas actualmente cuenta con varios clientes y se hizo muy conocido por el buen servicio que da. Le gustaría ampliar su empresa contar con más empleados y que todos sus hijos terminen sus estudios.
Solicita de este crédito para la compra de cloro, y elementos para limpiar y tratar el agua.
texts.en:
Basilio, age 50, is married to Josefina, age 49, and they have three children.  They both work very hard to give their children everything they need for their studies, since they want their children to grow up to be good and successful people.

Basilio previously worked for a company, which he left to start his own swimming pool maintenance business.  He now has many customers and is well known for the quality of service he provides.  He would like to expand his business and hire more employees.  He would also like all of his children to finish their studies.

He is requesting this loan to buy chlorine and other products for cleaning and treating swimming pools.

loans.use: to buy chlorine and other products for cleaning and treating swimming pools.

loans.name: Buator

texts.en: Buator is a petty trader and a seamstress in Alavanyo, Hohoe. Buator has received education to the junior high level. She is married with two children. Her husband is a farmer by occupation. Buator has been a petty trader for the past eight years and decided to be a seamstress after she gave birth to her second child so she can earn more money. She assists her husband to cater for the home. Her loan will be used to acquire more sewing materials and goods for her petty trading business. She intends to save her profits to open a shop in the future.

loans.use: to acquire more sewing materials and goods for her petty trading business.

loans.name: Afenyo

texts.en: Afenyo is a petty trader in the township of Alavanyo, Hohoe. Afenyo has never been to school. He is married with four children. His spouse is also into petty trading. Afenyo has been in the petty trading business since 2010. He is responsible for paying the children’s school fees and for feeding his extended family. His loan will be used to acquire more goods to fill his shop. He intended to save his new profits from his business to get more capital.

loans.use: to acquire more goods to fill his shop.

loans.name: Nelly

texts.en:
This is Nelly, 66, a resident of Taguig, Philippines. She is a widow and a mother. She operates the business and she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.  

Nelly operates a salon business. She offers hair styling, hair grooming, hair straightening, manicure and pedicure, and the like. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 600 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue operating her business, she is requesting a Php 30,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy beauty products and hair products like straightening treatment and other products needed in her business. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

All Nelly wants is to have a good health. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for beauty products and hair products needed in her salon.

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
This is Nenita, 54, a resident of Taguig, Philippines. She is single and she operates the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.

Nenita operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a Php5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php500 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php40,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Nenita hopes to expand her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Sarin's Group

texts.en: 47-year-old Sarin is a villager residing in a rural area of Kandal Stoeng district located in Cambodia’s Kandal province. She is married and a mother of eight children, three (a daughter and two sons) of whom are under her responsibility and currently in school. Sarin makes her living through farming rice while her husband works as a construction worker to complement the income. Sarin is leading a group of two female members who both are third-time borrower with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) to take out a loan the amount of 1,160,000 KHR in total. The group leader Sarin was so satisfied with the previous loans that she obtained and successfully paid back because, with those loans, she was able to build an appropriate house in which her family can live. Now with this new requested loan portion, Sarin will spend on building a proper latrine for consumption in the family. Via the help of this loan, Sarin will be able to create a healthy environment not only for herself but for her whole family. She can also promote sanitation and hygiene practices in her community as well.

loans.use: to build a proper latrine

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
This is Evelyn, 48, resident of Taguig, Philippines. She is married to Teodoro and a mother to her children. She together with her husband manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Evelyn operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a Php5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php500 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php50,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Evelyn hopes to expand her business and it will become a grocery store. She wants her whole family to be followers of God. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
This is Myrna, 56, resident of Taguig city, Philippines. She is married to Agapito, an employee, and mother to her children. She, together with her husband, manages their own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.

Myrna is a mineral water distributor. What she basically does is buy mineral water in container from wholesalers, sell them per container (5 gallons per container) with a profit. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php500 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php20, 000 loan. She will use the loan to buy more stocks of mineral water to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Myrna dreams to be a successful businesswoman. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where he can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for more stocks of mineral water to expand her product inventory.

loans.name: Kong's Group

texts.en:
Kong, 49 years old, lives in a rural village of Kandal province’s Kandal Stoeng district in Cambodia. She is a widow with four children. To support the family, Kong has a business farming rice and selling fruit, earning around 19,000KHR daily and saving about 9,500KHR after offsetting the daily cost of living. This will be Kong’s second time requesting a loan via VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). The past loan has helped her relieve the family’s burden and enabled her to have access to medical care. 

She is now leading a group of four members, all of whom are females, to apply for a loan in the amount of 160,000KHR each. As a group representative, Kong will spend her loan portion on building a proper latrine for use in her family. With this latrine properly installed, Kong will be able to avoid using unsanitary practices and create a healthier environment for her beloved family.

loans.use: To build a latrine.

loans.name: Margie

texts.en:
This is Margie, She previously accessed a 10,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase more quantities and varieties of grocery items and products needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for her children’s education, and in their personal, household and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for another 12,000 PHP loan for her to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her inventory. The more items displayed at the store the better. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from the business will definitely help sustain her family’s daily needs and her children’s education expenses. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Margie hopes to be successful in life and that there will come a time that she will no longer need to get a loan. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Pasiencia

texts.en:
This is Pasiencia, 50, resident of Silang, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Nicanor, a farmer, and a mother to her children. She, together with her husband, manages their household as they operate the business. At this time, she and her husband are working hard to provide income to their family.

Pasiencia operates an internet café business. Services like this become a need as customers’ demand increases. Her main patrons are students, who utilize her services for school requirements. She has customers who need to rent computers for business purposes, like writing a resume or any office documentation, as well as customers who would just love to surf the net and visit any social network.  She earns a minimum of Php500 in profit every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php15,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy additional computer parts and accessories needed in her business. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business.  

Pasiencia dreams to have a quiet life and hopes to expand her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional computer parts and supplies needed in her business.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is a married man aged 59 years with nine (9) children.He is a typical farmer who also operates a retail shop in Kagadi town which he has been operating for the last 16 years. David started this business in order to pay school fees for the children since the harvests were only seasonal. He also wanted to make more income to develop his family.

He wants a loan of 2,000,000/=(two million Uganda shillings) to buy  organic manure to put in his coffee farm so he can improve the quality and quantity of his yields. He will also buy more items for selling in the business to meet the demand and earn more returns from the business.His major clients are residents of the town.

David hopes to use the proceeds from the business to expand on his coffee plantation in order to have a stable source of income for the family and also cater for his retirement when he grows old. But his major challenge is the rain which make transportation of the commodities difficult plus the poverty among the residents, when they don't have money to buy his commodities. He is a very hard working man. In the photo David on the right with the UGAFODE staff in his coffee garden.

loans.use: to buy organic manure for his coffee plantation and items for his retail shop

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize and sorghum.

loans.name: Alberto

texts.en:
This is Alberto. He previously accessed a 17,000 PHP loan that he used to buy spare parts and accessories and for the maintenance of his Jeepney unit. His earnings were a big help in his personal, household and business expenditures. 

He would like to apply for another 25,000 PHP loan for him to buy spare parts and for the maintenance of the Jeepney unit. His profits from his business will definitely help him to sustain daily needs. He looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in his heart. 

Alberto hopes to have a good life. He faithfully meets up with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his work every week and where he can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies. 

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for spare parts and maintenance of his Jeepney unit.

loans.name: Elsie

texts.en:
Elsie is a 39-year-old married woman and a mother of nine children from Sikatuna, Bohol. She earns a living through her sari-sari or variety store business.

Elsie is asking for a loan to buy additional stock to sell, like canned goods, snack foods, candies, cooking ingredients, soap and toiletries. With this, she will be able to attract and cater to more customers in her store. In the future, Elsie hopes of making her business a success.

loans.use: to buy additional stock to sell, like canned goods, snack foods, candies, cooking ingredients, soap and toiletries.

loans.name: Maliza

texts.en: Maliza is a hardworking woman living in Kamwenge, Uganda. She operates a bar alongside a restaurant business, and with the income earned she has been able to buy land and pay school fees for her dependents. Her personal goal is to build a permanent house for residence, while her business dream is to own a hotel despite the challenges of inadequate capital and stiff competition. Maliza intends to use the loan facility to buy a pool table so as to attract more customers to her bar.

loans.use: to buy a pool table so as to attract more customers to her bar.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Costatine

texts.en:
Costatine is a 50-year-old married man with eleven children living in Masindi-Uganda. After realizing that the wages he used to earn as a casual laborer could not help him provide basics to his family, he decided to venture into a charcoal business twenty-two years ago. 

Like most good fathers, he dreams of educating his children to attain degrees as a minimum qualification, while his business plan is to venture into solar trade since it is not harmful to the environment. He has challenges of inadequate capital and customers who do not pay on time. 

Costatine intends to use the loan to buy charcoal to sell.

loans.use: to buy charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase hybrid seed and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize and sorghum.

loans.name: Yusta

texts.en:
Yusta is a 36-year-old married woman with three children living in Fort Portal, Uganda. She operates a beauty salon, and with the profits she has been able to buy land and practice farming. She is a very ambitious woman who is afraid to raise her kids under poor conditions like the ones she experienced while growing up, and she is determined to change her future and that of her children. 

Her personal goal is to educate her children up to the University while her business plan is to stock her salon, buy more land for farming and start a dairy. Yusta is requesting a loan to buy weaves, and to buy land for farming.

loans.use: to buy weaves and buy land for farming.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is a married man, aged 33 years, with four children who are all school going. He and his wife sell eggs in Kagadi town, a business they operate six days a week. He also vends newspapers as an additional source of income for the family.

He wants a loan of 1,000,000 shillings to add to his egg business and be in a position to increase the income for the family, and also meet the increasing demand for the eggs. 

John's major challenges are the business of eggs being delicate to handle and the limited capital compared to the demand. He hopes to buy a vehicle for transporting the eggs, using the proceeds from the business as it is growing.

loans.use: To buy more eggs to sell.
